name: ab cdef
text:
Used to be great pharmacy staff.

Based on past experience, I would have said, great staff, retail & pharmacy, friendly knowledgeable helpful courteous!  Store is very clean open well organized well lit accessible!  Again, and the staff make it a pleasure!

***NOW, Sunday 2/28/21, pharmacy staffed by 2 women, the black woman was arrogant, and, white woman rude. My wife who is gravely ill, was very frustrated trying to get a health critical item, asked for help getting the item, the white woman stated she “I will not help you”!***

name: S Alshammari
text: On the 24th we to The Pharmacist and I haven't got enough money told him to give me one month supply only. He did give me the wrong medicine and one missing. I come on the second day and met the same person told to come back at 1 pm. When I came today on Friday she told me that we don't have your medicine in the system trying to cover other pharmacists' back. I called my doctor and got the prescription took it back to them then they told me they don't have it.

name: Jerry Stephens
text: The attitude of the pharmacist is almost consistently unacceptable. The front of the store has about 8 customers in line with 1 person trying to help them all. I walk to the pharmacy with my 3 items (2 OTC medicines and a drink) the 2 pharmacy staff members wouldn’t ring me up even though there literally wasn’t 1 other customer in the pharmacy. I get my medicine filled there 2 times a month and the pharmacy staff literally always has a bad attitude!

name: Deb S
text: All the staff are great! They are friendly and helpful. They will go out of their way to assist you.

name: Shelia Martin
text: The pharmacy staff was very friendly and helpful to me.  The rest of the store was clean and organized. I will shop there again.

name: Amber Miller
text: Always friendly, and store is nicely organized.  Very clean

name: amanda griffin
text: The attitude in the Pharmacy could use a major adjustment!

name: Charles Edwards
text: It's a nice CVS.

name: Kimberly Holcomb
text: Great place to buy work supplies!

name: Tina Quillen
text: The people who work here are the most helpful, most knowledgeable, kindest people that I could ever hope to deal with when shopping for anything. I recently had a dilemma where I had to send my husband to buy my hair color. I phoned ahead and the woman actually helped me to pick out a perfect color over the phone and had it ready and waiting on my husband when he walked in. I'll never buy my hair products anywhere else as long as I can get to Sally's in Jasper. This place goes above and beyond when it comes to having a helpful staff. Thank you Sally's!!

name: Melissa Smith
text: Friendly service

name: Patricia Hedges
text: Very rude worker!!

name: Jill Cooner
text: You people so rude thanks for upsetting my daughter .grow up and handle things better .will not be buying anything from u

name: Julia Horn
text: They are the best at Jasper , helpful in every way

name: Cathy Sanford
text: Great products

name: Jason Shafer
text: Great service fair pricings

name: Rachel Jean
text:
It’s a quick stop in for miscellaneous items that I want. Their chocolate selection is not great but they have a nice selection of ice cream. Ordered some photos but was never informed their machine was broken.

On one occasion I was greeted by a male employee. Then I saw him hide in an adjacent aisle and stare at another female customer the whole time I was there. Definitely some racial profiling happening and it made me uncomfortable. I ended up leaving without making a purchase.

I haven’t seen that employee since and the other employees have been very nice.

name: Karen Glover
text: Never saw a clerk. There was a self check out.

name: Lessye Demoss
text: My car broke down in their parking lot. They were super-nice, offered to let me sit in the air conditioning, and to leave my car there until tow truck came. Tow truck never came and I had to get a ride home an hour away. The next morning, the assistant manager did me the favor of checking on it to see if it would start (it did!). That's just really decent, and one more reason for me to love CVS Pharmacies.

name: Steve Driskell
text:
Employees were especially kind and welcoming to Spire employees.  Some employees had stories regarding their interaction with Spire employees and contracted contruction crews.  CVS Employees were very hospitable and eager to understand the work going on around them.

This is perhaps the most friendly CVS I've visited.

name: Archie Gresham III
text: Awesome customer service. On Wednesday December 4th, the cashier went out of her way to help calm my two year old son down who was crying for toys. It worked! Thanks!

name: gail maddox
text: Terrible service

name: Ray Rollins
text: Poor customer service prescription never ready when they say it will be, pharmacy employees are never nice

name: David Barr
text: Friendly people

name: Rena Nix
text: Friendly staff!!!

name: Honeybea 12
text: Pharmacy dept. is horrible. They were not friendly at all. Lack customer service totally.

name: Micheala Robinette
text: I got my vaccine here and they were so calm and quick. They were very nice and welcoming. I didn't even realize it was over until the lady moved away. 10/10 Would come again!

name: Lauren McCreery
text:
The pharmacists at the CVS are rude and extremely unprofessional. You’ve completely lost my service; which includes everyone else in my household.

I shouldn’t have to yell me name and birthday across the pharmacy for you to look me up.
I was told yesterday that my medication was going to be coming in on a truck today, so I left my prescription with the pharmacist. Today I was told that I can’t have my prescription back and that I had to go to a different pharmacy in town, have that pharmacy call over to CVS to have my prescription filled. This is absurd. My daughter and I are both sick, but THANK YOU for making me go out of my way and go into another pharmacy because you wanted to lie to my face.
Also, whichever pharmacist was on tonight, your attitude sucks and you should learn how to have a conversation with people without cutting them off.

name: Elizbeth “LizBeth” Hammond
text: I had my medications transferred from Walmart. It was always something with my medications not ready, not enough pills, out of stock, long lines, no updates if they didn’t have your meds after waiting lengthy periods of time and no drive thru window. I needed all medications with a drive through and majority at one location. It’s been some extra effort put in at CVS and small hiccups getting correct address updated, correct refills and hold time is somewhat lengthy on the phone, except for today. I like CVS online app. You have so many options of convenience. I plan to give this pharmacy a chance because, for now, they’ve been willing to correct their actions without blaming the customer or implying that I should have did something differently or more energy making sure my medications were ready or available. There haven’t been a lot of attitude about answering questions related to medications or requesting their names.

name: Brian Colvin
text:
Only use this pharmacy if you feel like waiting in line for them to not have the prescription filled that you called in seven hours prior to arriving.

Told to pull around front after being in the drive thru line for over twenty minutes.

Rudeness from the woman working the drive thru when I advised her I had no clue what the one medication was she was handing me.

Buy-Rite is a far better location.

name: Sonja Dowell
text: The worst and slowest  service there and everyone had a attitude will never go back to them ever don’t deal with people that are rude

name: Andrew Green
text: I went to go get my daughter’s prescription, was told they are 3 DAYS behind, how does that even happen? Not to mention the rudeness that was present during the conversation from the employee. Needless to say our business was transferred to another pharmacy. Definitely don’t recommend.

name: Natalie Joiner
text: I really like this store. The staff is  super nice. They always have what I need in stock. I print a lot of pictures and the staff always helps with questions I have. I don't fill my prescription here but have had the pharmacist help me with over the counter med questions.

name: MzHoney Flowers
text: Nice ppl but sooo slow not enough staff in pharmacy...they never ever answer phone my meds been in there 2 days bc when i go they always say come bk 30 to 40 mins to pick up then when you come bk its still not ready!!

name: Debra Shiver
text: Recieved text my meds ready. When I got off work 6 hours later arrived at store, surprise they were not ready, waited additional 35 minutes still not ready left without.  I guess try tomorrow.  Should not text if not ready horrible servi

name: Bethene Childree
text: Enjoy shopping here. The employees are always friendly and helpful

name: wes adkins
text: Every time we get a prescription filled here it always has issues. On re-occurring prescriptions they either don’t get refilled on time or have odd issues that aren’t brought up till purchase. Today’s fill issue was on a re-occurring refill that was supposed to be automatic. I wasn’t contacted on it so I called yesterday to have it filled and ready for pick up today. Pulled up to a backed up Drive-thru like usual Just to have the teller explain to me that my prescription is not ready it’s not even filled. Waited at drive-through window for the clerk to put the pills in a bag. Now I know why the drive-thru line is always so long. Don’t waste your time here go to another pharmacy unless you have plenty of time.

name: Emily Turner
text: I needed a pharmacy that was more conviently located than my traditional one and they were helpful and got me sqared away as quickly as they could

name: ChristianXP
text: Have them my info Sunday and my pills are not ready by Wednesday. They have an excuse everyday on why they haven't had this done. I mean I need one of those pills to actually you know live.

name: becka wilkins
text: I left the hospital and got the the pharmacy drive thru about 7 pm (it doesnt close til 8pm) it took me ten minutes to get someone to the window and when she got there she was rude to start off with and told me id have to wait til tomorrow morning and i told her i have mrsa and she became more rude and said "it doesnt matter you still have to wait til tomorrow" it wouldnt have bothered me if she wasnt so rude about it

name: joel turner
text: When a Dr calls in an order for a patient it should be ready for pick that day not the afer

name: Risha Chinn
text: Pharmacy NEVER answers the phone in a timely manner! The minimum wait time I've had was 10min! Also, they never have a prescription ready when they say it will be and always have to wait at least 30min in drive thru or inside. SLOWEST PHARMACY EVER!!!

name: Kacie Vance
text: Horrible service. Rude employees. Hour long waits.

name: Kayla Johnson
text: If I could give them 0 starts I would. This is the WORST pharmacy I have ever used in my entire life. There’s no reason it should take 4-5 hours to fill a prescription and then another hour sitting in the line to pick it up. I can’t spend all day at the pharmacy waiting on a prescription. It’s ridiculous. Do not use this pharmacy. It’s terrible. They’re all half wits.

name: Gabbiy Calvaria
text: Jesus, the pharmacy will keep you on hold for 20 mins and just not helpful. It’s a good thing we’re not going through a pandemic and need to speak to somebody 🤔 unprofessional

name: Aziz Nazarov
text: I was waiting for thirty min at drive through . Not helpful staff

name: Stephanie McElmurray
text: I moved to Moody and had to switch to this pharmacy and they have always been so nice.

name: Riley Robinson
text: Worst pharmacy ever. On the phone for a hour just to check the status of a antibiotic

name: Bare Grilles
text:
This is for the pharmacy staff. The retail staff is magnificent!
Quite possibly the worst customer service experience I've had. I went to get a prescription filled because I had just had a tooth extraction and the woman with glasses couldn't be any less helpful. She needa some refresher training in customer service

name: Rene' Pittman
text: If I could give a negative star rating I would. The staff of the pharmacy is beyond rude. Like next level you need to go to some sort of basic manners school kind of rude! Husband is switching to Publix and I am happily at CVS. With other options this place should be your absolute last choice.

name: John Ward
text:
Ordered online got email to go collect and only some of order had arrived. Received no apology or help or info as to when to come back, Just a bad attitude.

Weeks later after finally getting my complete order and still no apology, i recieve an email from Walgreens asking for feedback. I gave a polite and accurste but negative review. Then recieved another email telling me the feedback left didn't meet their standards and bit had been moderated.

Walgreen, if you don't like negative feedback don't give negative service, and how dare you moderate my response.

name: April Juliana
text: Worst pharmacy in the world. Employees can not be bothered to try and help customers but can get an attitude and that seems to be fine.

name: Leslie L
text: My husband has a prescription he must have and Walgreens in Leeds Al. has this prescription. The drive through was closed today so I entered the store (not wanted to go inside trying to keep my husband as well as I can) the cashier, when I asked,  told me the pharmacy  was closed I asked to speak with the manager. The shift manager  can out and I asked him why the pharmacy  was closed he said someone  in the pharmacy tested positive  for COVID-19.  I told him I must have my husband's  prescription because  he could end up in the hospital  without it. His answer  was that he didn't  know when the pharmacy  would open back up and they were having the store cleaned  tonight by a professional cleaning  co. So what is a person to do if they depend  on a medication that they have a prescription for and can't  get it from the co. they have trusted to fill that prescription? The shift manager at 4:10 PM Tuesday  answer  was to call the doctor and get a new prescription sent to another store. I guess he doesn't  realize how difficult  it is to get intouch  with a doctor and a doctor at that time of day. Wouldn't  you think that the owner of this pathetic excuse  for a pharmacy would have had an emergency  plan in plan? We have been dealing with this Virus  for many months and a company this large should have a disaster plan in plan for just this type  of scenario. Pathetic. Everyone of my friends  has had a horrible  experience  with this store. We are going to flood the social media sources and expose  this company for who they are. They care nothing about the people  that keep them in business it's  all about money to this owner. Would you not think that they would close the whole store if someone  tested positive for COVID-19 I mean do they think that the virus decides to stay in one area of the store. Do they think that people  don't  go in there and touch products  before they go to the pharmacy. Just an example the bottom  line is money not care. Even Sonic  hamburger restaurant in Leeds Al. closed completely when one of it's employees tested positive and they sell burgers. The Walgreens in Leeds Al. Is absolutely  the worst pharmacy  in Leeds. You would think if they cared they would have had a disaster plan in place and they could have contacted all patrons that have life sustaining medications of the situation and where they could pick up their medication. There are many other drug stores  in Leeds and the surrounding area. I encourage  everyone who has had a dangerous experience with this co.to stop using  them and contact the head office. Good luck finding a competent person that works with this co. If I was a pharmacist  I would not want my name and reputation affiliated with Walgreens.

name: LaDeidra Scruggs
text: I really wish I had read these reviews before dealing with this pharmacist. I went in to get meds and Janeen slammed my meds on the counter and disappeared for like 7 minutes with my insulin. I’m happy I read these comments because I honestly thought I was being discriminated against. She was extremely rude and nasty to the point where I don’t trust my meds she disappeared with. I called and spoke to Trisha the store manager who claimed she reviewed the camera but she called me back in less than ten minutes. She must be great at operating cameras. I will never ever step foot inside this place again and if you’re smart you won’t either! If I could give this pharmacy negative stars I would.

name: Randy Dowling
text: Whether it's not being able to get your insurance figured out, or simply having your medication locked behind a computer system that's always down, or whatever the excuse of the day is, the pharmacy ALWAYS has something wrong. I've been using this pharmacy for years simply because it's on my way home, but I don't have time for this anymore. Considering I typically have to visit less than a couple of times a month, the rate of disappointment is comical.

name: Ak 205
text: Pharmacist here are rude, spiteful and out of control! It should not be that hard to get a prescription filled when your insurance WILL cover it and the doctors already sent it in electronically! They tell you to come pick it up then place it on delay when you complain. Do NOT put yourself in this nightmare! Walgreens needs to fire Janeen & hire new people. I’ve been with Walgreens for years and have never ever ever had these issues. Only with her!

name: Mohammad Rahman
text: Great staff! I have a basic understanding of all the checks and balances on how a prescription  is filled. Knowing what I know now, this pharmacy does an excellent job in providing me my medication. People don't understand how problematic an  insurance company can be in paying for a medication. With all the safety measures, calling doctors for problems with prescriptions and handling insurance companies/patients, I give this pharmacy 5 stars! Keep it up!

name: Jennifer Phillips
text:
Walgreens has printed off several bday invitations , graduation invitations and pictures for me for a few years now. I went today to get my granddaughters invitations printed and they didn’t have a clue . Then wanted to charge me $5.99 a invitation and I said no and whom ever they have working in the photo lab dept. I highly suggest they transfer to another dept.  also they need training on how to use the stores app. How pathetic.
Jennifer

name: Ashley Anthony
text:
Between my inept doctor's office and former pharmacy not communicating, I'm glad to come to this one.  They went out of their way to reach both places, reauthorize my prescription, refill, and everything else.  My whole family's used this location with no issues for 8 years.

A lot of the customers who come here are older meaning they're very rude and impatient to the pharmacy staff; especially through the drive up window.  I couldn't believe how they were spoken to despite running around like crazy on a Saturday.

name: Sharon Duncan
text: First time leeds Walgreens has been extremely rude.... The girl working working the drive thru needs some training....

name: Carol Reed
text: I have used  Walgreens for years. They have never been rude to me

name: Alyssa Allums
text: The lady at the cash register was so rude not good customer service at all do not recommend coming here at all

name: Nimitz 17
text: This pharmacy never has anything in stock and alway tells me it will be 2 or 3 days till they can get it! But the Walgreens near Vulcan can do it in one day every time. Why is that, laziness maybe? I live in Moody but will drive to the Vulcan pharmacy every month. Not only are they fast they are super nice. Leeds? Not so much.

name: mary leigh harp
text: We drove through on our way home from Thanksgiving. My husband had been to urgent care this morning, but the local Walgreens was closed. We thought we'd have to wait until we got home tomorrow to fill his 5 prescriptions, but we thought we'd give it's shot in Leeds. 15 minutes! Just 15 minutes, while we grabbed a bite to eat. Everything was ready when we returned, the drive thru staff was super friendly. Well done!

name: Meredith Brewster
text: The girl at the drive thru window has a very ugly attitude!

name: Jason Pittman
text: Extremely rude pharmacy.

name: Felisha Crews
text:
I'm rating this location low due to the pharmacy. The store itself is great. However the pharmacy staff is always always rude! It's so ridiculous how rude... they always look mad and like they hate their life. After a year of filling meds there and dealing with poor attitudes I decided to change pharmacist and I'm very glad I did. Parkway pharmacy is much more pleasant to deal with.

Another thing they never had all the medicine. We would have to go back days after to pick up the rest of one script. Crazy! So glad I don't have to deal with them anymore.

name: Wayne Knight
text: I have been using them for over 5 years. In the last year they have messed up 9 different prescriptions. The last time they gave me meds clearly marked for someone else.

text:
It took 4 phone calls between them and my doctor to get my rx right and when I arrived it was still wrong. The store is great, the pharmacy is not.

Update: lowered my rating because every time I need an rx filled there is an issue or delay. Please find another pharmacy.

name: joey snyder
text: I went to the store to get some things and they had some toys marked down I  decided to buy a few I got to the cash  register and they were ringing up at regular price the lady when to look at where I got them and got the  assistant manager to fix the price then he told me that they were not on sale even though I had proof they were with a on line sale ad the then got so rude with me and told me to leave or he would call the cops I have never been so Humiliated in my life I will never go back in there again I called the corporate office they told me they would call me back and never heard a thing I have owned a business of my own for over 26 years I would never treat a customer this way

name: Rach Hill
text: Worked there for a little while....Great selection of products but "too many chiefs and not enough indians!!!!"  for minimum wage....no thank you.

text: Staff is always nice. Unless it's the "young" kids working.....then they are just BLAH, and bordering on rude.

text: I was a customer in Huntsville Al. When they closed their doors i was in a panic. The other choices i had was to go to Athens or Arab. I chose Arab. The best decision i couldve made. I was greeted with 100%  professionalism. Teresa has a beautiful store well stocked, and full of knowledge. I am so happy!! Ladies, this is the new merle norman place to go. You will be happy too. She was so friendly and helpful to me. Teresa has my business now. The drive was not bad and well worth it!!.

text: Friendly, clean & spacious Studio!  Lastly, nearest to my home.

name: Kayla LeFew

name: Nancy Meadows

text: CVS is a close to home place to drop in for some items. Prices are ok compared to other stores. It seems like when I had any medications in the pharmacy they would cost more then anywhere else.  One reason why I moved from there.  The staff are fairly good but they dont treat you like a local hometown pharmacy would. The photo printing is nice to have close to home.

name: Alisa Byars
text: Stopped by today within 2 weeks.  Place is a mess, prices are wrong, coupon would not work. The young lady at the front needed help. Manager no where. Went to the back with 4 people.  Slaw thing could not give me my discount. Manager MIA. I finally gave up and left. Saw the manager outside.   I explained the situation. She could did not apologize or care a less of addressing my concerns.  Moulton location is the best

name: Mistye Toraij
text: Thank you jamiee for your awesome customer service today!

text: Frequently doesn't have prescriptions in stock. Takes them 3 times longer to fill prescriptions than Walgreens, which is just across the street.

name: Johnathon Rainey
text: Friendly

name: Blaine R.
text: I am done with this CVS Pharmacy! I have been a loyal customer of theirs for years and every time I've needed anything be it a prior authorization or anything else, I have had the hardest time with them. Unprofessional,  snappy women working in pharmacy with no customer service! Done!!

name: Keith Wilson
text: Have been using this location for all our pharmacy need they are super helpful and very knowledgeable and informative

name: Carolyn Walker
text:
I love Tiffany, Toby and Mike they are the best.
They know you by name and try to get you the best price.  The other store employees are sweet and helpful.  You need to give this CVS a try.

name: Vicki
text: Always treated with respect and care at the pharmacy. Prescriptions filled quickly, friendly people.

name: Lynn Wray Dillard (Alabama Creeks)
text: Great location with easy access. Some of the kids in the pharmacy are rather aloof. But others are professional, helpful and kind. Clean wide open layout in the shopping area.

name: Annie Hunter
text: Filled my prescription WRONG shorted me 11 capsules. When I wanted to pick up the remaining 11 capsules because I was charged out of pocket for a 30 day supply I was told I REVEIVED A FULL PRESCRIPTION! NEVER IN MY LIFE OR AS A PROFESSIONAL HAVE I EVER TRIED TO GET A EARLY REFILL!!  I was treated like trash!  THE CAMERA will tell because this will be pursued!!!!

name: George Darling
text: Friendly service. Difficult to exit parking lot if you're traveling east.

name: John King
text: Very unprofessional and inconsiderate when dealing with mentally ill patients. This is not how a pharmacy should be run.

name: Heather Hall
text: Expensive

name: Carolyn Maness
text: Awful

name: Jody Gray
text:
I am giving this store five stars for effort, when in reality, I have been so very frustrated with this pharmacy.  I have been a loyal Walgreens customer for at least 20 years, and have used Walgreens on the east coast, the west coast, and in between.  I’ve never had any issues with any other Walgreens as I have at this store.

To begin with, I’ve experienced phone wait times for up to an hour.  I just gave up on calling…I go directly to the pharmacy and wait to speak to the pharmacist.  I take a lot of meds, and there are times I have to personally request the pharmacy to fill certain prescriptions, as Walgreens online won’t allow me to electronically file certain scripts. Luckily I’m not far from the pharmacy, and driving over is no big deal for me. If you need to talk to someone in the pharmacy, just save yourself the frustration of calling.

I used to be a Job Coach, so I didn’t just want to hate this pharmacy…I wanted to understand what the problem was (is).  The problem is, they are always extremely busy, and maybe understaffed.  There have been times I have visited the store when there were at least 15 cars in line for the pharmacy; the line being wrapped around the building.  In addition there were also times where there were up to 10 people in line at the pharmacy.   I’ve sat and watched the employees working, and they are all working like crazy.  Nobody is on their phones, no one is standing around talking…they all seem to be working just as hard as they can.  In addition, I’ve always been treated with the level of kindness and professionalism that made me a loyal Walgreens customer many years ago. When I’ve been there I’ve heard the phone ringing constantly.  But In the pharmacy employees’ defense…they are so overwhelmed with customers in the store, no one has time to answer the phones.

Walgreens, if this pharmacy is understaffed, help them find some more employees!  There are a ton of people who depend upon this pharmacy for their medications.  Help this pharmacy to be better!

Sincerely, an extremely loyal Walgreens customer.

name: Beverly Nickerson
text: This Walgreens is so much better then the one on Crawford rd. However, I have been trying to get my prescriptions for a couple days now but they have been super busy. I was finally able to get there at a time there was only one person in front of me. They literally looked for this lady's prescription for almost 30 min and I had to leave. They could have at least had her wait to the side and grabbed the line full of people an mine and had the one person look for the meds. Finally able to wait in line for however many hours I needed and now they have to redo a prescription because I waited to long to come and get it.

name: Belinda Napier
text:
I wished I could give them zero stars!
This is not the 1st time this has happened but this time it was an emergency!
My husband never complains but he has been in severe pain after taking 3 days worth of antibiotics so we call our doctor after hours and he immediately sends a prescription to the Walgreens pharmacy on Summerville road phenix city Ala. They then proceed to say we are out of the drug and won't have it till Monday
We then asked if they could check other pharmacies for availability and they said no!
I then said mam it is in your database who has it, then she immediately put me on hold and said you can call this pharmacy and see if they have it...
This is your job not the patient!
I will be calling Monday morning to report this store!

name: Wanda Perry
text: As of using the store part for shopping is excellent. But as for the pharmacy the pharmacists are excellent. But there is one cashier in the pharmacy who lies to customers about how soon they can fill certain prescriptions!! I think it is wrong that this cashier has the audacity to manipulate people's lives. But the higher ups keeps letting her get away with it or they just don't know or just don't care!!!!! So beware!!!!!

name: Scott Bush
text: I dropped off a prescription Thursday and still haven’t been able to get it. No help from anyone. I am past frustrated.  This will be the last time we use this pharmacy. If you can’t get a prescription filled, what good are you.

name: Jeff Lee
text: Can't get anyone to answer the phone to check on a prescription.  Called twice' on hold for over 35 minutes. Was told I was one caller out. That one caller must be mighty long winded for both of my calls. Wonder how corporate will feel?

name: Shaunon Nelson

It was a crazy blonde lady working drive through i reported it but she made me feel like i was garbage for trying to pay cash for MY LEGAL PRESCRIPTION. This happened in july of 2018 hope shes been fired you dont treat people like a drug addict when they are clearly not!

name: Lorri Holland
text: This specific pharmacy right here is amazing! It you want someone who actually cares about you as a person, go here! My mom came to visit from FL and accidentally left her medicine. Her heart is only working at 20% so her medicine is VERY important. I called the CVS in Jasper and the lady literally laughed at me and told me were were screwed when I asked what she recommend we do. Called here just to see and they were beyond fantastic. She understood the situation and had actually had it happen to herself before. She told me what to do and was beyond patient with my moms doctor and regular pharmacy. They really saved us, and we were able to get a weeks worth of her meds. I am beyond thankful for them because I get to spend the week with my mom instead of her having to drive back 7 hours the day after she got here.

text:
I saw a resident who was very nice. When she brought in the doctor that she works under,   later in the visit, I was dumbfounded at the doctor ‘s lack of professionalism. She entered the room all smiles and told me that she was the best around at what she did. When I tried to ask questions she immediately turned into a very sarcastic, condescending woman and said if I didn’t like what she had to say that there are other doctors that can help me and that she had just told another patient the same thing  that morning. This woman needs to retire because her bedside manner was repulsive. It disturbs me that someone like this person is mentoring our future doctors with her shockingly dreadful attitude. She was two  completely different people in less than a minute’s time. I believe that she is the one who needs to find a doctor that can help her.
I want to reiterate that the resident was very professional and kind.

They just looked at the problem area and said "take this, this, this and schedule another appointment in 3 months" and sent me on my way.

name: Sandra Koulourides
text: I am almost 50 years old and my skin has never looked this good.  I look rested and 10 years younger thanks to Dr. Northington.  She knows how to get skin looking it's best.  I would not trust anyone else with my skin!

name: Rebekah Fitts
text: Dr. Northington is fellowship trained in cosmetic dermatology and has extensive experience doing all sorts of treatments and knows how to help you figure out the best treatment for what you are looking to do, whether it is get rid of wrinkles, dark spots or fat.  She is always so nice and accommodating and is just the BEST!

name: Amanda James
text: I have been seeing Dr. Northington for years for my acne and scarring. She makes you feel comfortable as soon as she walks into the room like you're talking to a friend instead of just your doctor. She genuinely cares about her patients' overall health as well as their dermatological health. Before starting any treatments, she has always discussed all the aspects and side affects. Based on these discussions, we've determined some more common methods were not right for me and suggested other options. When I was a teenager, she helped me decide on the best topical treatments, antibiotics, and ways to use them comfortably without drying out my face. When I grew older, she helped me decide on the best treatment for my scars and virtually erased the acne scarring I've had for over 10 years. You would never be able to guess today that I have been dealing with consistant acne since I was 12 years old. During any treatments I've had in the office, she made every effort to make sure I was comfortable and reduce as much pain as possible. I have referred many friends to Dr. Northington for things such as extreme dandruff, wart removal, and acne. Some have even driven over 80 miles just to be seen by her. Every person I've referred comes away a fan.

name: Jordan Arnold
text:
I went in with my mother to get a flu shot a couple days ago, and I wanted to get a video of me receiving a flu shot. (There are tons of videos circulating the internet of children, teens, and adults reacting to needles) and I was going to video myself receiving one with my mother's help because she too thought it would be funny.
We were both perfectly fine with putting our experience on camera, and did not feel as though it were violating our privacy.
The nurse, or woman with needle named Shay came in and just as my mother was about to get her shot, she tells me to turn off my camera. She would not provide services while being videoed. I was stunned and asked why and she proceeded to tell me it was a violation of HIPAA.
I was annoyed, but turned it off, not understanding what the deal was with videoing my esperience when countless others have done it IN DOCTORS OFFICES. When it came time for me to receive my shot she looked at me like I was crazy for jumping away from the needle and crying.
I DONT LIKE NEEDLES WHY DO YOU THINK I WAS RECORDING.
My arm was sore for days after the shot, which was probably my own doing for tensing up but she did nothing to even console her "patient". Not knowing much about HIPAA I went and asked some of my nursing friends and a phlebotomist I went to school with if there was a passage in HIPAA about a provider refusing service because of privacy on camera and both said no I even followed up on it by looking up HIPAA. Because the P in HIPAA stands for PATIENT not PROVIDER. Walgreens, if you don't want people videoing their experience (knowing what they are risking with their own privacy) please put up signs saying "no video or camera beyond this point" which will clear things up big time.
I will never get my flu shot at Walgreens again. Tell your "nurse" to work on their bedside manner.

name: Jack Johnson
text: They didn’t have the chicken I lick

name: lqsi12
text:
Nice that they are giving corona vaccine, but there were difficulties  encountered.
1st, cold call on my phone the morning of the appointment that my  Medicare insurance number is needed.... Well I was told never give out personal information over the phone.  When I arrived for my appointment time, I can provide at that time.

2nd  arrived for appointment 15 minutes early as instructed.   Went inside CVS, ( about 15 - 20 persons ) standing around at front door, and I noticed a second line ( 4-6 persons ) , and noticed there was another line down by the  Pharmacy another ( 4-6 persons ). The  woman in control at the door was quick to answer that there were problems with " Insurance " and that I should wait.  Standing for long periods of time for me is not possible.  After waiting for over 1 hour my name is still not called, and noticed that I have yet to see anyone that I first saw in the Pharmacy line has left.

Maybe those coming in for the vaccine appointment, should be politely informed of the extensive waiting time so that they can make a choice.  Personally I was not that comfortable around so many other masked people in a busy area.

name: alexis Seymore
text: Wish I had read reviews before I drove an hour to get COVID vaccine. Registered online, gave all of my pertinent info including health insurance info. Appt time assigned to me was 4:15. Long, long line when I arrived. A person working there told the men behind me the wait would be about 2 hours! How is this possible when everyone has preregistered and supplied their information? Very poor performance.

name: Cheyenne Hamilton
text:
Posting for my grandpa who’s trying to get my grandma and great aunt covid vaccinated:

We drove 1 hour and 15 minutes to Bay Minette CVS for our vaccine appointments. My wife, Ramona and my 87 year old sister could not go inside to the pharmacy, due to physical constraints, to get their vaccines and they would not come outside to administer the shots. The pharmacist at Foley CVS has been administering our vaccinations for the past several years. She comes to our truck and it only takes a couple of minutes. She's a real blessing to us.  However CVS Foley doesn't currently offer covid vaccines.  We were so disappointed that the Bay Minette CVS personnel were so unaccommodating for their handicap patients. That's just another example of how people, the employees, of a particular location make a real difference.
*Wal-Mart Robertsdale (no available appointments for next 7days)
*Wal-Mart BayMinettee(no available appointments for next 7days)
*Baldwin CO Heath DP (vaccine will be available June 8th
No appointment times available at this time)
*CVS - None available at this time except Bay Minette
(no handicap) We will NOT be trying another CVS unless we can verify they will come out to the truck.
* Foley CVS Five Stars
* Bay Minette CVS Zero Stars

name: Donna Willingham
text: CVS had friendly clerks and people who worked there helping with vaccines.

name: Jami M
text: My experience with the pharmacy is becoming less pleasant each time I’m there. Particularly when a young guy with glasses and long hair is there. My prescription is never ready when I know the exact time it is called in, the drive thru line is extremely long and you have to wait a good amount of time before you can even get to the window. Finally, when I make it to the window, they tell me they are backed up and it would be another 2 -4 hours when it’s ready. Then out of nowhere you get a text 10 minutes after you leave the store that it’s ready. This has happened more than 3 times and it gets old and a little distracting especially when you have sick children in the car.  And not to mention that the same guy can be very rude! You can certain tell, when Mary(the pharmacist is not there).

text:
The place seems to be under new management. That's a shame because the old manager Jeri and her crew were top notch. I witnessed the new manager screaming at one of the older employees, who quit right there on the spot. She was one of the nice ones, I had been dealing with her for years. Somebody needs to teach that woman how to talk to employees! I don't know how this woman ever made management, but they need to send her back to whatever ghetto she came from.
I'll be taking my business to Bell's Pharmacy from now on. I shopped here because of the customer service and I see that going downhill fast.

text: The new AI automated refill system is horrible!  Instead of just putting in a prescription number it is now making you go through every Rx on file and will not give you the "skip all" option. When I called back I had to be irate enough that the AI agent finally put me thru to the human being.  The staff works hard and the automated system should serve them and the customer.  Please fix this.

name: Krystal O
text: I just wanted to say thank you to the wonderful staff especially the cashier's who went above and beyond to make sure I could get a hard to find item that my husband needs who is an over the road truck driver to stay sanitized and safe on the road. Their random act of kindness really touched my heart and ment alot to not only me but my husband and children as well who want their daddy to be safe while doing his job. And thanks to the great cashiers he can. From the bottom of all our hearts, thank you all so very much and your thoughtfulness will not be forgotten.

name: Robert Ferraro
text: Horrible pharmacy, was told they needed to order prescriptions, come back tomorrow. Came back the following day, different person said they needed to order the prescriptions. Horrible. Going elsewhere from now on.

name: Wesley Key
text: Tough competition, but overall these guys do a good job and we have trusted them for years.

name: Ed Whitman
text: Rude pharmacist. Tries to act like she is a doctor. Very rude to doctors nurse. The pharmacy  tects are great. I fairness the pharmacist  I reviewed was a sub I  understand this  pharmacist  will not be back. The regular pharmaist  is great and again the tects are great to the regular crew I give a 5

name: Cassie Albright
text: Scheduled an appointment online for a flu shot. Waited 45 minutes for the shot. I brought in my paper work filled out, they did not acknowledge it at all and tried to get me to fill out the same piece of paper, again. Pharmacist was pleasant. But, I would rather have timely service.

name: Emily Todd
text: Clean well stocked AMAZING staff!

name: Rodney Danbery
text: Unprofessional employees I've ever experienced

name: wendy pope
text: ample parking and a convenient Bojangle's fried chicken next door

name: Krystle Cox
text: Spent 3 days trying to get a refill for a medicine that can't be abruptly stopped. I was told it was out of stock finally on day 2 after four phone calls. At this time I was told it'd be there the next day at 10 am. 6 pm the next day no meds in stock still!!! They didnt even call their other pharmacies to see if they had it at another location. After 15 years of loyalty, Walgreens just lost my business heading into day 4.

name: Gennie S.
text: Drive through wait is too long. If someone is going to take a while they need to have that car drive around.    Inside wait is too long as well

name: unfairadvge
text: Easily one of the worst pharmacies I have ever been to. Both pharmacists were amazing and did their job well. The techs on the other hand were very ill informed and extremely rude. If there's another Walgreens 10 miles down the road, I'd suggest you go there.

name: Marta Sun
text: I only do grocery in this Walgreens,so for me this store is good.The cashiers are really nice to me,I can buy laundry detergent in low price here.

name: Chaundra Ishman
text: One of the best location. Entire store staff is always helpful and so friendly!!

name: Holly Lapointe Jordan
text: I am convinced that as far as a neighborhood pharmacy with convenient shopping and intelligent staff... I have never been to Walgreens that lacked in any of these departments.  By znd far, Walgreens sets the standard and is the Industry Leader.  This Walmart included!!

name: Chris S
text: Always a great experience with their pharmacy.  They've gone above and beyond for me in the past.

name: Carrie Shelley
text: Just hate this walgreens people are not friendly and they dont go above and beyond to help anyone out

name: Kody Ledbetter
text: Took 4 hours to get some antibiotics. Went by there and told me that they are "working on it" called 3 hours later and told me that they were still working on it but we can have it for you in 15 minutes. Hope you guys dont need an hour pharmacy cause this isnt the place

name: J C
text: Okay

name: Clayli Overstreet
text: Terrible. Save your time and money and go across the street. The pharmacy staff is incompetent.

name: Kate Nauman
text: Awful experience with the pharmacy on more than one occasion.

name: vader
text: sometimes no one is at the checkout

name: Jonathan Heathcoe
text: Very rude

name: Carl Vickroy
text: the pharmacist informed me of an online promotion that allowed me to get a month supply of my med free

name: Stewart Mitchell
text: These people are idiots.

name: Brett Tolbert
text: Slow, and unapologetic about it.

name: Annalise Harwood
text:
Got my vaccine done here. Very easy to sign up, quickly administered, and painless!

Special thanks to pharmacist Mary - you made getting a shot a very pleasant experience!!

name: Tami Bobicz-Bachelder
text: I don't shop at this particular location often, I actually haven't shopped much with CVS at all. I find their pricing a bit high for my level of acceptance to be honest. I did recently download their app when I was directed to a sale item I wanted. Now, with using the reward app, I have come across a couple of items that are more reasonably priced, to which I purchased. Hoping to find more of those in the future and possibly become a regular shopper, time will tell!

name: Eryn Rose
text: Very rude staff. Once tried to use a goodrx coupon and was told they don't accept them there.

name: Travis Walston
text: They advertise free* flu shots (*"with most insurers" being in the fine print once inside).  I obviously can't know how many insurers there are that they may accept, but apparently it doesn't include BCBS.  They wouldn't run it, so I just payed out of pocket and figured I could file a claim for it.  Of course BCBS refuses to pay a cent, but I guess that part isn't a CVS issue.

name: Lynn Knott
text:
The pharmacy members have always been professional and personable.
Sometimes the wait is a little long, but they obviously care about each customer so I’ll accept that for this level of service.

name: Meribeth Lapidus
text: We wanted to move our prescriptions from Kroger to CVS so we wouldn't have to go into the store and could just pick up in the CVS drive through. Well, after my husband had called and talked to them and we had moved all our prescriptions over to them, they told us they don't accept our BCBS plan! Seriously?!

name: Rhonda StCharles
text: A zero rating would be too good for this place. For the 3rd visit in a row, the pharmacy personnel have been rude and condescending.  This is a pharmacy on my way home from the doctor, so that is why I use it.  In this particular visit i was given an hour wait because the person who could fill it was busy (no other people in line or in store). We waited the hour,  came back to receive the next excuse, to wait another 25 minutes for them to now open the safe! What was happening in the hour?! This is the same treatment and bad service we received the other times we have come.  I am so upset and very sick.  The person with the curly hair (the pharmacist?) should not be in this line of work.

name: Eryn Rose
text: The pharmacy staff is rude and judgmental. I've been in 3 times now, and every time I have had a bad experience.

name: Donna Bartlett
text: I had a refill prescription my doctor called in that was supposed to be ready Saturday morning, but I got a text from cvs telling me it would be ready Monday after 4pm. When I called and let them know that I would be out of my medication all they said was sorry and maybe I could call my doctor and have him call a prescription into another pharmacy. That would have been an option on Friday morning when I confirmed that they would have my medicine because I would be out, but my doctor isn’t in on weekends. They have given me a prescription bottle from the manufacturer that had been opened and was short 8 pills. These are just a few of the things I’ve put up with from this location.

name: Janet Kim
text: I don’t know why every time I call whoever I talk to pretty much hangs up on me! I ask a question and when I say thank you they hang up! I have more questions! So rude!! Seriously hangs up while I’m about to ask a follow up question! WHY

name: Scott Allman
text: An extremely friendly staff. They take great care of my elderly Mother. That means nothing but great to me...

name: Brad Wilson
text: The average wait on the drive thru is over 10 minutes per vehicle. Will be changing pharmacies too see if I can find better service.

name: Jennifer Stieglitz
text: Yesterday I was in distress to get medicine that had been stolen out of my car the other day. With the holiday it had been 2 days since I had this medicine and the CVS on Cecil Ashburn was not helpful but this Pharmacy, was awesome!!! They immediately gave me a 3 day supply until my insurance would cover my prescription. I could not be more thankful to that Pharmacist!!!

name: Jim Robinson
text: They are close to my client and I pick-up his meds here. Everything runs smooth except when one particular Pharmacy Tech is on duty. She always creates some unnecessary drama.

name: Scott Simmons
text: I'm reviewing the store, not the pharmacy. The store is fine, the staff is five-star, but EVERY TIME I SPEND MY MONEY AT CVS, THE PRICES HERE AMOUNT TO HIGHWAY ROBBERY!!!!!  For that reason, I'm never going back.

name: Joshua Grounds
text:
The pharmacy here is usually prompt, and this would be a five star rating, but I just had to wait an extra week for a prescription to be ordered because the pharmacist failed to put my prescription into the order.
Customer service at this location is great, and I've never had this problem before, but in the future I will wait to ensure that my order has been placed.

name: Bethany Folse
text: I have nothing against CVS as a whole, but this particular pharmacy is a joke. They gave me the run around for several hours on filling a prescription I needed and were nasty about it. In most customer service positions, the customer is always right. That was not the case this day. I was told by a pharmacist that she never told me what me and my witness heard her say and kept telling me to call my doctor. Guess what the issue ended up being? THEY DIDN'T CHECK THEIR VOICEMAIL! If you want and need a pharmacy and pharmacists that truly care about their customers, go to walgreens or any other place on the planet. CVS is a bloated corporation that doesn't give two shakes of a rattlesnake's tail about their customers. Will never go back. Having all of my prescriptions transferred elsewhere.

name: Kate Parker
text:
I have been using this pharmacy for five years and have always received prompt and professional service.

In comparison to Walgreens I find the prices more competitive at this CVS and other in the area.

name: Tennelle Ackerman
text: This pharmacy is pathetic.  They never have prescription ready when they say it will be ready. A prescription that cost me $18 at another pharmacy cost $35 at CVS. This is unacceptable. My family will find another pharmacy that will not rob u blind.

name: John Nickel
text: The worst CVS one could visit.

name: Elmyra Lowe
text: Large selection of African American products. Service was given promptly but without a friendly greeting. No eye contact offered either. She is Korean, so, I am unfamiliar with their customs. I didn't take it to heart. It was probably a sign of her humility. I found a product that I had been looking for for 3 months, so that was a thumbs up for me!!!

name: Candace Little
text: Great selection on hair and hair care products.

name: Hazel Turner
text: Love  this place

name: Kimberly Gordon
text: I'm going to miss this store 😢

name: Kevin McMullins
text: In addition to all beauty supplies, the shop does excellent alteration work at very reasonable prices.

name: Amber Watts
text: They have a good selection of hair and wigs but the lady that works there  guessing she's one of the owners she had an attitude cause my mom wanted to try on a few wigs before she bought one,  so after the third wig she was getting mad!

name: Michael Yoon
text: Very nice and helpful staff! Great prices and they also do some tailoring at the store as well

name: Tracy Jones
text: Majority of the times that I have visited, things that I needed was in stock.

name: Casey Miller
text: Won't go anywhere else

name: Rhonda Newman
text: Friendly an very helpful staff.

name: OCTAVIA THOMAS
text: Selection is very small.

name: wolf
text: Do not, I repeat do not use Walgreens in Chelsea, AL unless you are prepared for a huge headache. I have never in my life been to a pharmacy where it takes half a day to get your medicine filled and the bad attitudes and lack of dealing with public is horrible. I don’t see how Walgreens as a corporation let’s one of their pharmacies be run like this. Not only that, but every pharmacy I’ve ever used has always had refills and fill at certain date prescriptions ready the day before so it is ready the morning it is supposed to be filled. That way you can pick it up on the way to work. The longest I’ve ever had to wait at any pharmacy is 1 hour and normally it is 15-30 minutes and I have lived in every area of Metro Birmingham my whole 42 years of living.

name: solar _
text: This is the only Walgreens in the State of Alabama or in any State surrounding Alabama that you have to wait over 4 hours for a refill on prescriptions. Not a new prescription, but that would still be ridiculous, refills that are done every month.

name: Darryl Pipes
text: An item that costs $18.99 in store on sale. Only costs $8.69 online at Walgreens.com. BUT they don’t price match their online store. I waited another 10 minutes as I put my info into a system and purchased the item online for pickup in store and waited for it to come across the system. Where is the transparency? Where is the customer service?

name: 1Alone
text:
done with this location! pharmacy employees have gotten very cold to the customer! it's almost as if they are mad at something! when asking a question, the response is distant and cold. at one time this was a friendly location. whether it is new management or whatever, it is no excuse to treat customers like this! will be writing a letter to the corporate office on this for sure! maybe EVERY one of the pharmacy cashiers should take a class on "customer relations" or just "general kindness".... especially the ones working on 3/23/21 around lunch time! either way, won't be doing business here no longer!
UPDATE! COUNT YOUR PILLS BEFORE LEAVING THIS PHARMACY!

name: magical monkeystik
text:
was shorted on pain med quantity, called in to complain about it, after dealing with a very rude woman, I was told I would get a call back about it... still have heard nothing! very unacceptable!!! DONE with Walgreens!!!
if you are picking up pain meds from here, I suggest you count them before leaving the register!

name: E J
text: Pharmacy would be happy if you took your business elsewhere. Literally couldn't care less about saving you time or money.

name: Lil Moe
text: teach your pharmacy employees how to speak to the customer ....walgreens!!!  you do know, that the customer is what keeps you afloat, Correct?????

name: Martin Bachtel
text: It’s ok.  I agree the pharmacists could be a little more personable but they’re ok.  The people at the counter are very nice.

name: J Von
text: will not be back to this pharmacy!

name: Jeff Elliott
text: When the pharmacy at winn dixie closed months ago they sent me to this walgreens.  I was spoiled by the personal service at wd.  Every time i walk up to the scrip desk at walgreens i'm a stranger.  they are brusque and dismissive.  i come in for the same scrip at the same time every month.  last time they say "oops! we don't have enough!  come back in a few days.  well, i am outa here!  want personal service in chelsea?  go to chelsea apothecary.

name: John Roland
text: We use them almost every day. Very customer focused and always looking out for us. Highly recommend

name: Bizarro Stormy
text: Christian, James, and Jamie are always there to graciously greet me and help me find whatever I need.  They're open literally every day.  As much as i despise corporate enslavement, its just so damn convenient that I can't help myself

name: John Roland
text: We get all of our prescriptions from Chelsea Walgreens. They are super friendly and very knowledgable. We are grateful for how they take care of our family.

name: Kevin Jones
text: Pharmacy always does a great job and is very friendly. One stop shop for medical, Redbox and quick grocery items.

name: Brandon Waites
text: I spent 1 1/2 hours making photo books for Mothers Day with a 40% off coupon that was in date only to be told by the manager I couldn't use it in store. It was only for online. He clicked to the "fine print" and said it's only for online. The huge coupon that Walgreens emailed me said 40%off all photo books just for Mothers Day. I asked the manager was there anything he could do. He said no and unplugged my device cord before it was ready. Will never use Walgreens photo again. CVS did a great job!!

name: Casey Wilson
text: Pharmacy staff is fantastic. They have always been helpful working with my insurance.

name: Allison Bishop

name: Harry Rape
text: This is the worst pharmacy I've ever had to deal with and the pharmacist is the laziest  person i have ever meet.  They tell you 1 thing one day and another the next  they shouldn't be allowed to do that job

name: goth gf

name: Mary Pariseau “Mary Liz Pariseau Slaton” Slaton
text: I purchased a lovely Tory Burch handbag and a really cool credit card holder at CK Collection.  They also carry Vince clothing - the only place I know of that carries that brand in the entire area.

text: The most beautiful selection! Their clothing is perfection! So many beautiful shoes as well. Thank you for such great customer service!

name: Kim B
text: We bought a birthday gift for my Mom from here. They have VERY nice clothing here. Love the fabrics - very high quality. Excellent customer service, right down to wrapping the gifts for you in the cutest box and ribbon! Definitely a go-to in the future for Mom's gifts.

name: Melanie Ferguson
text: Neverchange! Upscale unique women's fare. Always fun. Beautiful shoes, assessories. Kind gracious staff. Just the most  lovely shop!

text: Had a problem with a foundation that I purchased. Used one time and the color is wrong, and they were not willing to work with me.  I don't think they really have the skills to help you with the makeup or at least they didn't really take the time to help.

text: Very friendly staff. Went above and beyond to find the scent I wanted in wallflowers even though they did not have it on the floor. The sales associate with certain they had it and she looked in other places in the store and found it for me. Very impressed!

name: Jessica Cost
text: I shopped at this location a few weeks ago for the first time and was impressed! I wasn't hounded, but yet I wasn't ignored either. The store was spiffy, the guy who helped me out on the floor was super nice and knowledgeable. And best of all... no Bridgestreet traffic!

name: Naomi Cooper
text: Greeted immed, asked us what we were looking for, AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE

text: Very attentive staff, smaller store but has a good stock.

name: Angelia Rembert
text: I came in after working out, the 2 ladies were so focused on me and constantly asking me questions that they couldn't see the 2 women that was stealing merchandise! I (PURCHASED) over $176 worth of what I like. Employees everyone does not steal no matter what you (look) like.

name: Shalea154
text: We have given this store 3 different tries. Each time, the employees only care about chatting with each other or looking at their phones. This visit, I finally had to step out of line and go ask a group of 4 associates if anyone in the store is actually qualified to work a register. And by the way, the “Keith” that posted that the staff is great, works there.

name: Sarah Bradley
text:
Hours as of 1/14/21
Sunday 12p-6p
Monday 9a-9p
Tuesday 10a-9p
Wednesday 10a-9p
Thursday 10a-9p
Friday 10a-9p
Saturday 10a-9p

We have updated our hours on Google numerous times, including submitting photos. It continuously reverts back to the old hours of operation. Please call the store to confirm hours if you are unsure. We are working hard to stay open and safe for our customers!

name: natashia toney
text: They're usually pretty helpful

text: I love this store so much it’s one one the prettiest store in Huntsville! I love the staff they are super friendly I just can’t anything wrong about them!

text: Always the right gift. Good product, good price.

text: So glad this store is open. Such a friendly staff.

text: The girls there are so helpful.
