text: Pharmacy staff was amazing! Helped me out with my son’s prescription and made it very easy to obtain his meds in less than 30 min. I was a bit skeptical due to prior reviews, but what I witnessed was nothing short of great customer service. I would definitely recommend this store

name: D Day o' reckoning
text: Most of these people who work in the pharmacy are some of the rudest humans I have ever encountered. I have been an RN for 27 years and if I talked to people like these do I would expect to be in an administrators office the next day. I worked in a prison and the guards were much nicer to the inmates than these people are to their own customers. These people SHOULD NOT WORK WITH THE PUBLIC. I'm moving my prescription.

name: Rebecca Campbell
text: I love that they have a drive thru so I don't have to take all of my kids in the store just to grab a prescription.

name: Whit Defoor
text:
If I could give it a 1/2 star I would. Absolutely unprofessional staff except for maybe 1 person and that’s the only reason for the half point. I’ve been forced to use this pharmacy for a little over a year and  every single time I have had to pick up my monthly prescription (same thing every single month) they tell me a time for pick up and it’s never ready. I usually have to call and wait on hold for 15-20 mins just for them to tell me they haven’t gotten started on it even though it was supposed to have been READY an hour before. Not only that but I no longer have insurance through my job and I pay out of pocket, but for some reason they still make me run around every month explaining to them how I pay out of pocket and have no insurance to verify so they will actually get my medicine together. And like I said I get the same thing every single month.  I pay the same way every single month. This is the worst pharmacy in the history of pharmacies. I’ve used a cvs in warrior AL before and they are amazing so it isn’t the company or brand CVS. They just picked the wrong person to run the Jasper CVS.  And last complaint. I have made numerous complaints about how the pharmacy is treating the patients and I always get the same thing. “We are so sorry we will have the pharmacy manager call you to discuss your issues”. Never heard from anyone and issues still aren’t fixed. Worst run pharmacy if you value your time and money and don’t enjoy having to run around and do the pharmacies job just to pick up your monthly prescription.

So excuse my rant, but,  I’ve had it with this place after a year and a half of trouble. It’s sad when your moving and one of your moving “perks” is getting to use a better pharmacy. Please! someone go to work there and fix this place for the sake of all the people that need their medicine to survive.... because if it’s up to this place... they won’t.

name: sherry rushing
text: It's always a headache to get medicine here. My insurance will not allow us to go to a better pharmacy. Always awful !

name: B. Alys Russell
text:
Update: so after well over 30 minutes, and an f up on their end , I've determined that Amber, the girl I was waiting for, who is also in training, is extremely confident .This is generally a great thing EXCEPT when making mistakes . Her superior should be paying more attention to her at this point to be sure things are not just being done, but being done correctly .

VERY SLOW . My prescriptions have been sent in twice in the past 30 hours. I get here and am still told "20 minutes". They just called my name and the girl is in the back running her mouth. It's been 5 minutes now. The back area is extremely messy ,I don't see how they find anything .Most CVS get things done in a timely manner with 2 workers . There are currently 4 people on the back and they've just told one girl , also the one I'm waiting on , she should let patients know when there's a 3 hour wait, instead of just saying "15-20mins"...I'm still waiting...i wonder if this is one of the stores being closed down ... won't be coming back .

text:
I have had nothing but trouble at this cvs in jasper. They are
Rude and unprofessional. I am going to try and switch to Dora cvs. Checking reviews first. Update: we have switched to Glover Pharmacy and they are the nicest people and no problems with my scripts. They are located in Urgent Care in Jasper on 78 Hwy.

name: Katie Fischer
text: Normally CVS pharmacies are very on top of things, but this one is rough. I wish I didn't have to rely on them. I'd change pharmacies immediately if I could.

name: Lindsey Tyree
text: Terribly unaccommodating. Rude staff. I was in person trying to transfer a script from another state and the girl just says get the app. Then it's call your doctors office. Then it's get the app again. She didn't know the solution herself but wasn't willing to help either. When I didn't walk away I guess she realized she would actually have to help me. BTW there was an issue with the script that I couldn't have fixed myself. I call a few days later to see if my pills are ready but the rx# changed during the transfer so I couldn't check if it was ready on the automated system. When I talked to a tech over the phone again it was just get the app. When I told her the app wasn't helping me do what I needed and I was tired of hearing about their stupid app she pretended she couldn't hear me by saying hello twice and hanging up on me. I use CVS in VA because of their great customer service and they always go out of their way to fix issues. This one in Jasper is a shame to a good company and I have been so disappointed.

name: Kennedee Harris
text: My experience at this CVS was simply horrible. Let me explain. There have been multiple occasions when the pharmacy staff told me I have 0 refills, and I hear verbatim from my doctor that I should have a prescription for one- year- supply. Please keep in mind the phone consultation I had with my doctor regarding the difficulty receiving my medication cost $$- so it bothers me that they refuse to refill my prescriptions when I have refills. It is a shame they do not train ALL pharmacy staff to have the competence to troubleshoot any insurance plan issue that arises. These staff members have an ethical responsibility as healthcare professionals to help- that they lack.

name: J Kindred
text:
I drive nearly 5 miles out of my way to shop at this particular CVS. There's one near my house, about 4 miles away. But the personal, hospitable, kind, compassionate & knowledgeable staff that I encounter at this store is more than worth the extra time. One's relationship with their pharmacist is a very close & personal experience. I've sadly found that many pharmacists seem to have little or no respect for those who are essentially their patients.
What earns this location the rare 5 star rating is that the golden qualities of the pharmacist & their pharmacy staff is found in every employee with whom I've had interaction. Honestly, Corporate should utilize this store as an example of the standard they need to see in every one of their pharmacies/ stores.

name: Jesse Pope
text: Not surprised to see they have below a 3 star rating already. Just moved to the area used CVS my whole life 8 different branches across 5 cities and this place by far was the worst pharmacy experience iv ever had. Employees are rude and reluctant to offer any kind of help. I have used the same medication for years I just needed a refill. None of my insurance or Dr. Information has changed but somehow they claim it has. After calling my Dr. (Phone consultation $20) reassured me the problem was on their end and he didn't want me to be without my meds so he sent in another refill. When I arrived they said I would have to pay full price wich I could barely afford it . Not wanting to argue with someone who could clearly care less I agreed and they said it would take about 15 min. I arrive one hour later to find they forgot to fill arguably my most important perscription of them all. To make matters worse I'm flying out of town the next day with alot less money and without my medication.  Awful group I recommend going litarally anywhere else but here.

name: Stephen Hummel
text: Will not answer the phone and half the time I stop by to use the pay near me they have it's down.  One lady told me they didnt even have payment services but the next day they did

name: Mrs. “Wildfleur” N
text: I thought they were super sweet and friendly. My husband went a different time and said the same. Usually I think most Cvs stores are rude but not this one.

name: Domonique “Dom” Fields
text: I'm glad I don't just go off of the reviews. I have been going to this pharmacy for a few years and never have I ever experienced what I've seen noted on some of these reviews. The staff are kind, friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to help when they aren't crazy busy because most of the time they are! Please don't just read the reviews and decide based solely on them whether or not you'll use their pharmacy. Go and form your own opinion. I love them and that's my story!

name: Freeman I
text: Terrible experience at this CVS. Throughout the day I was on hold for hours... Unacceptable. Some woman (sounded like a white female) picked up with a bad attitude, short temperature, and just rude. She yelled out on the phone for me to stop yelling at her and then ended our conversation. I just wanted to make sure she heard me! Called Pharmacy manager and she said "well she thought you were yelling at her." So that is a excuse to end the call. What about her short patience/lack of customer service. I had been on hold for hours, what if I had an urgent need? I moved to Alabama to experience this kind of behavior? One star for the pharmacy is a compliment. I can't wait to fill out the survey for this chain! I do not feel safe getting my medicine from this location.   Everyone I spoke to today had a bad attitude!

name: Mark Hickinbotham
text: Friendly and knowledgeable pharmacy staff.

name: Monica Montasseri
text: Went for passport photos. Tristan was very helpful and friendly. The process was fast and efficient. Thanks, Tristan.

name: Tarah Shenay
text: They are fine until you change insurance companies. Apparently they all have trouble reading or don’t have the time to. I called to tell them my insurance changed and I was told to bring the card when I get the prescription. A couple of days later I had my fiancé pick up my prescription with my new insurance card but they said I needed a prescription card so he left with out my prescription. I call and read off what they needed on the same card my fiancé gave to them earlier. So make sure if something has changed to call before you go and insist that you read it to them instead of coming in or you will be aggravated and writing a post much similar to this one.

text: Good location, really convenient. Also they have good deals on vitamins and other products.

name: JayJay Wong
text: Called the pharmacy to ask about typoid vaccine shot. Pharmacist said there's no shot, only pill and sworn by it. According to CDC website, there are two different vaccinations: oral has live typhoid vaccine and shot has inactivated typhoid vaccine. To have a pharmacist (actual pharmacist and not their helper) who is wrong and unwilling to admit or even know that he’s wrong, is horrific. To think they suppose to know more about medicine after the schooling they went through and passed… Beware!

name: Eric Taylor
text: This is my local Walgreens. I usually visit several times per week for small shopping trips. The staff is friendly and helpful. The store is always clean and well stocked. Despite the neighborhood, I usually feel safe here at any hour, even with my kids. Like any chain drug store, the prices can be a good bit higher than a grocery store. However, if you stick to the current deals, use your rewards card, and load coupons, you can save a great deal.

text: This is the one that’s closest to me so it’s the most convenient. However, it’s this one cashier that works there and she is very unprofessional. I don’t think she should be able to work there acting like this especially if this is what she applied to do ! Her name is Brittney and I hope the manager does something about this.

name: Emily Busby
text: The two pharmacist are usually very helpful and nice and the cashiers are too but they give me trouble just about every month concerning my prescription. I take one prescription a month which is a schedule three or four narcotic I believe. I go to my doctor and he writes my new prescription every 28 days. I take two a day which equals 56. I drive almost two hours to this doctor and live in a rural area that never has this medicine so I always stop at this Walgreens and every time they tell me they can’t fill it until the next day or I have to wait two days even tho my doctor schedules my next appointment on the exact day my medicine runs out. For example I got my prescription filled there last month on 2/5/20. Went yesterday after my appointment to fill my script for this month which ran out yesterday. Waited in traffic and in line for over 20 minutes only for the cashier to tell me she can’t fill it until tommorow. I didn’t even waste my time explaining to her that I couldn’t turn around and drive two more hours again the next day or that my medicine ran out yesterday so technically I could have gotten it filled two days early as per the narcotic laws. I’m not sure if she dosent pay attention to the quantity and counts thirty days or she just dosent care to actually read the directions on the prescription. This is also a medicine that if I don’t take it causes extreme withdrawals so I ended up having to drive 30 plus miles out of my way and wait two to three days for another pharmacy to fill it. Got home and called and asked them via the phone if I was eligible to get it filled yesterday and the lady said yes. Needless to say these people don’t understand that some of these medicines are people’s lifeline and they don’t understand the danger and inconvenience of having to drive all around the country and risk your health all because they can’t take twenty seconds to read a prescription look up last day it was filled and count 28 days. Drove 30 miles to another pharmacy keep in mind another WALGREENS pharmacy and they told me I could have gotten it filled Sunday. Done with Taylor road. They also charge me(no insurance same medicine and same amount every month never changes) anywhere from 180$-300$ went to another Walgreens paid 112$ explain that.

name: Clayton Waring

Before this I️ was in the store for 15 minutes and was never asked if I️ needed help. If you are a service worker you can at least pretend to be nice or even have some manors.

The car in front of me was not given any consideration when they finally pulled up to the window at the        6 p.m. - closing time. I have never seen anything like this from a customer service standpoint -- and I have seen bad service.
Unfortunately my insurance has forced me to use Walgreens for my pharmacy needs but I am going to look for another location.

text:
Words are hard to come by to adequately describe how rude and unprofessional the pharmacy technician was to me this afternoon. I waited 20 minutes on the phone to ask if they had a prescription in stock (which every CVS I have ever called is happy to do), she cut me off, rattled off an excuse for why she couldn’t look it up and hung up on me mid-sentence. I called back 3 more times waiting 5 minutes each time trying to save a trip to the store and never got an answer.

The best part: I called 3 other CVS stores in the area, all of them answered right away and gladly looked up their inventory for me. The pharmacy technician is uninformed, unhelpful, and apathetic.

If you don’t believe me, just read the other reviews. Do yourself a favor and go to a different CVS.

text: This Walgreens is always extremely busy. I’ve had to wait for 20 minutes in the drive through. They take at least 45 minutes to fill prescriptions. Then someone told me it would be a while because 3 people were in front of me and the vials had to be taken out of the refrigerator to get to room temperature. They don’t seem to have enough staff. Either it’s that or they do not have a good workflow process. Do anything you can to avoid this location. They are very scattered and seem very unorganized. At least the girl was polite and told me it would be a while. That’s why they got 3 stars instead of 1. Time is valuable though and no one should have to wait for more than 10 minutes to get a shot. The actual shot doesn’t take that long. Because of this I left and don’t know when I will reschedule or if I will reschedule. But it won’t be at this location.

Since they gave out the medication and are aware of any problems concerning a medication, you would think they would know what's going on with it. Only time I have used Walgreens. CVS I'm coming back.

text: We switched to Walgreens because it was a more convenient location. Since switching we have not had a single prescription filled in a reasonable amount of time. The pharmacy seems to have no sense of urgency. We will be switching back to CVS.

text: This place has the slowest pharmacy I have ever been too.Doctor called prescription around 8 a.m. It still wasn't ready after 2:00 pm.This particular location is awful and poorly managed

name: Jessica Garcia
text: I made the mistake of having a prescription sent to alabaster location at 5:40 when they were closing at 6. I stood in line and had prepared to ask them to send my prescription to another pharmacy if it was too late. They agreed and said the other pharmacy would have to call them, which they said they would. I asked if I was set to leave, was given the okay, so I headed to other pharmacy. They call me and say walgreens never answered their phone, that it went straight to operator saying they were closed. So, I head into traffic to go to hoover's 24 hour walgreen's pharmacy and I call ahead so they know to get it ready since it is a 30 minute drive. I was on hold for 25 minutes before they picked up. I figured--they must be super busy. 5 minutes later, I pulled in and there was no line, no rush, no hurry... they told me I had to wait another 15 minutes. When I inquired about why I had to sit on hold for 25 minutes if they weren't busy, "I dont know" was all I got. This woman could see I'd been crying (from worry over my kid) and I didn't get an apology, a rush job, kindness, nothing. If they had picked up their phone, they could have done the transfer for me at 6, and I could have had the meds to my sick child an hour earlier.

name: Sarah Trotti
text: The pharmacy has been so unhelpful. I am a student at The University of Montevallo and I am not from the area thus promoting me to transfer my prescriptions down here. This process has tried to take place every day for the past three days and I am finally giving up. The first day it took me 10 minutes before I could talk to anyone and when they finally answered they said their phones are down. That in itself was sketchy because I was talking to them through their phone system, but I figured that they got something working. I gave them my information and they said that they would get that in and text me from their personal phones (that in itself is odd) when it was ready. I never got that text. The next day, around the same time, I went down to the store to pick up school supplies and I asked them about my prescriptions. They had to take my information again as their phones were down and their computers were acting up the day before and they didn't get to my order. They asked me when I needed it and I said the next day and they told me they would call it in right then. The final day, at the same time of day, I called them and checked my status of my prescriptions by putting in my information that they had to take twice (well technically three times as they asked me twice the first day for my information). They said that they couldn't find my order. They have some issues they need to work out if they want to be in this business as my prescription is actually important to my health.

name: Billy
text: First and last time I will ever use this Pharmacy. Very rude when I first called. After already having such a stressful week, I don't need some lady being a sassy b**** to me when I've never used this Pharmacy. When they said it was ready, I immediately went to the store. Took 10 minutes (probably longer) to receive my prescription.

name: Step East
text: I had just gotten in the store good when they played the announcement that they were closing in 5 minutes and I needed to bring my purchases to the front of the store to be checked out. I didn't have any purchases yet and according to my cell phone, I still had 15 minutes before the official closing time. I thought I'd at least be able to pick up the important things on my list and that shouldn't take any longer than 5 minutes. As I started walking toward the back of the store, the cashier yelled for me to come check out right away. I informed her of the time and asked what the urgency was all about, and she told me that their system was problematic and that it would automatically close out the day 10 minutes early, on occasion. If this were to happen, the transactions for the day would be inaccurate, and I understood what a mess that would be for the accounting people, so I told her goodnight and left without buying anything. It was only a 10 minute drive to Hoover, and the Walgreens there is open 24/7 and never closes. They really need to get the system fixed asap so that more business isn't turned away from that store.

As he rang me up I waited for him to ask for my members card he never did.  I said I had a Walgreens card and he said “oh how am I suppose to know you think I can read minds”. The store was clean and organized and is also the only place so far in town that I can find large sensitive skin band-aids.  They have sanitizing wipes at the door, I was happy with my visit there.

name: Jody Hebert
text: We pull to the window at 8:45 to have a meds filled for my wife that had been in a car crash a few hours before. We checked the website on google to see what time they closed and it states 10pm we are well in our time frame to have this done. So once at the window we hand the lady the med script and she tells me there is no time to have this filled due to the fact they are closing early at 9 tonight, I asked her why and she said due to weather I would understand this if we had ice on the road or snow every where but it is only 40 out side and light rain why would you be closing for weather, but anyway I asked the lady nicely if there is any way she could help we still have 15 minutes before you guys close the store she looks at me laughing saying no there is no time. I look at it like this if you are open then you have time to make this happen so now we have to waiting till tomorrow in order to get it now. What is this world we are living in right now.

Everyone that works in the pharmacy are the rudest most hateful people that I have ever encountered in my life!! Wish I could give a zero.
They keep you waiting for the longest at the counter & then when they do come over there they don't say a word, they just give you a mean look like you are bothering them!I will never use them again!

text: The pharmacist that works there is nice, but the young ladies are another story. They need to work on their attitudes and customer service if they are going to be customer facing. And on top of that the one lady was rude over the phone. I don’t take too kindly to being spoken over.

name: Bethany Henderson
text: I have had to wait a long time to get my medication inside the store when I was told it wasn't ready, even when my medication was called in days before in speaking with someone on the phone numerous times and told it would be ready that day. Then there are times I don't have problems. But when I am in pain I don't need to wait for a long time when I have called days ahead. When I have called ahead to prevent the very thing from happening. There is no excuse for it happening many times. I have spoken to Derek the pharmacist many times and he is extremely rude and condescending and I am a nurse and I know about medications, he is very argumentative and has even hung up on me a few times, with me just holding the phone thinking to myself did he really just hang up the phone? He is very unprofessional and he makes CVS look bad. And I have never been rude to him only asked a couple of questions or something in general he obviously has a anger problem and deals with pressure by taking it out on customers. I know him by name because this has happened so often it's sad. All the other pharmacists are very friendly and professional especially the older male pharmacist I wish I knew his name because he has always been so kind and courteous to me. Derek and having to wait after I have called days ahead and waiting in pain has made me want to elsewhere and I will when I have time to change pharmacys.

name: Sharon Zito
text: Ridiculous... We had so many problems the last year that they accepted Blue Cross and then my Dr made the mistake of accidentally sending a prescription there that they called me about and said they would transfer to Publix or Walmart Pharmacy.  Well -they lost the prescription in the transfer and now say they don't have any record of it.  I have to call my Dr and request it again but perhaps they won't give me another one this quickly so I get to go without blood pressure meds for a month - thanks CVS - you are the worst pharmacy I have ever been to!!!

name: Eric Tant
text: Dereck  the pharmacists at rainbow city is the most condescending person I have ever displeasure of doing business with. My insurance was willing to pay for my medicine but he would not fill it until the day after my prescription ran out. And he had the audacity to ask me if I had any underlying issues I would care to discuss with him. Very unprofessional, self centered hollier than thou!!! Because I have a degree. I went to another cvs and they filled without a question with a smile on their face. Looks very bad on CVS in rainbow city.

text: Until today I was very satisfied with Wallgreens. Today I went there to find out if I am eligible to receive a Covid 19 vaccination and if Wallgreens uses Johnson & Jonson. The female pharmacist was very friendly and told me that they would use Phizer as the vaccine. When I asked her if she could tell me where I could get vaccinated with Johnson & Johnson, a pharmacist of about 30 years interrupted me in a very rude way and said that they would not give me any information. I think a "We do not know" or "We are unfortunately not allowed to give any information like this" would have been enough. This was in any case, the last time I visited Wallgreens to Carl T Jones. Too bad you can not also give 0 stars. I have rarely met such an unfriendly person. On the one hand I have been a customer there and on the other hand I am much older than the young gentleman and therefore deserve a little respect.

Alan Strickler

name: James and Tara Hutchison
text: Terrible customer service in the pharmacy department by Kevin. We went to this Walgreens in between training assignments for the Navy. I am currently 8 and a half months pregnant. I had two prescriptions that needed to be filled. One of which was fine, but the other needed my docs authorization for the refill. That is standard for that particular medication, and at all other Walgreens has never been an issue. Kevin proceeded to inform me in an untactful manner that the medication was expired and had no other refills allowed. Both statements were untrue. The medication did not expire until 2020, and while the prescription required my docs authorization that can be obtained very simply by contacting my docs office like every other Walgreens has done in the past. If someone does not want to do their job then get out of that field. I will never go back there or encourage anyone I know to go back.

text: Very nice staff. Always very nice welcome when you go in. Shelfs are always stocked. Never had a problem finding stuff I need. They have a balance reward system that you can sign up for and it is a must have. It refunds money to you as you purchase items there.

name: Brandi Edmonds
text: Hubby went to pick up my daughter’s prescription today and they have no medicine and we are not even in their computer system...🙄 Been going there for 5ish years off and on. My husband definitely gets super mad 😡. He calls me in an attempt to clear things up and while I am on speaker phone the pharmacist walks off and says “Im not arguing with a phone😯”. Now I have to go to Walgreens to show Terry P. the notification on my phone that says my prescription exists!! Get to the store. Calmly startover. I say you know you could have saved me a trip if you had taken the phone from my husband and agreed to talk to me over the phone. To this he scoffs and rolls his eyes 👀!! Transfer prescription to Grant Pharmacy eventhough I have to drive to get it! In the 20 years when i use Grant Pharmacy I get exceptional service. One day they forgot to put my prescription in my bag and drove it to Huntsville for me!! I never meant for this prescription to go to Walgreens but my doctor sent it there and I gave them the benefit of the doubt because we use them for little stuff and things that we need right away. I will never use them again and Terry P. will sleep just fine tonight because apparently he doesn’t have to say Im sorry for your inconvenience. Im sorry we couldn’t find your daughter in the computer and you had to make two trips!! Nope just a scoff and an eye roll! Obviously his pay is not tied to customer satisfaction. Im just one less customer for him to worry about!! Oh well I will miss the convienence of running in the store for multiple other things!!

I pulled up to the CVS pharmacy window tonight at 7:54. The window was already shut down so I immediately went inside and got behind another customer to pick up my child's prescription.  I had stood in line for at least 5 minutes when at 8:01 pm, Marcus, the pharmacist, decided to notice me and tell me they are now closed.  I spend thousands a year at this CVS and this is the first unprofessional treatment I've encountered in the 15 years I've faithfully used this location.

Update: If I could change my rating to a zero stars, I would. Marcus is still terrible and unhelpful. I asked for a nasal spray, he told me they didn't carry it... And my 75 yr old mom ended up finding the exact product I asked about. I honestly think he does not want to do more than the bare minimum.

I asked her to call the cops bc I was doing nothing wrong and this was not good customer service.
Secondly this is the 2nd time I've delta with the black female manager that never says anything to me. The time prior I went at midnight once my husband was asleep and bought a card and bottle of wine. She apparently called the cops bc I sat my stuff on the floor looking at cards and she felt uncomfortable.
Needless to say nothing I mean nothing was done wrong yesterday on my part or the time before. Apparently in Auburn Al if your in a "convenient store" longer than 30 min, your up to no good. For god sake that's a vacation for me with 16m old twins at home and a 5 yr old and a husband who acts like one of the children. I want this lady fired and the female officer who left bruises on my arm bc I walked to the other side of the door and she also called me fat and said I looked 6more pregnant.  I will get the report on all involved and add this to this crappie cvs store bc I sure wouldn't want my family or friends in their treated in such manner. Oh and someone please fire this manager. She looks like filth and doesn't do her job and is apparently racist.
Ty

text: Today the two people in the store closing up had the doors locked and the sign turned off 15 minutes before closings. We tried to open the door, and they just looked at us. The girl smiled at us while we walked away.

name: Holly Bearse
text: The pharmacy is perpetually under staffed and overwhelmed. Don’t even think about using the drive through unless you have a minimum of 30 minutes to waste (even if the line looks short. I had 3 people in front of me yesterday and still waited 35 minutes.) Some of the pharmacy staff is nice and genuinely doing their best, but I’ve also encountered some who are either completely clueless or very rude (like leave you on hold for 10 minutes then loudly cut you off mid-sentence and talk over you when they finally get to you rude). I feel bad for the ones who are actually trying to be nice and professional because there’s only so much they can do when they’re surrounded by chaos. Get it together management. Seriously.

text: The store was clean, stocked, staff was great as always, I get checked out relatively fast every time I go. I have no idea why this place has such bad reviews. I go here fairly often, as it's very convenient, and I've never had issues!

name: nfd1960
text: Went there with out of state script and they filled them no problems, they also seemed very fast and efficient

name: Karen Glenday
text: Always a wait! Too long. Pharmacy staff are like robots. Never thank you for shopping at Walgreens or even crack a smile. But yesterday was a serious violations. You require customers to wear masks inside the store. You have a sign posted outside reqiuring this. Several customers and including a cashier were not wearing their masks properly, not vovering their noses. I asked the male customer kindly to please wear his mask properly. He told me "to mind my own business and that I got up on the wrong side of the bed!" He was rude and self entitled. The cashier said nothing and wasn't wearing hers properly either. There were others as well. The cashier or someone should have asked them to either wear it properly or leave the store. This not happen. This is unacceptable during a pandemic. A pharmacy not enforcing their own rules. I believe much of this is politically motivated. Management and or any employee should report customers that do not wear masks covering the mouth AND nose should alert management immediately and tell them to wear it properly or leave the store. Personnel who do not wear masks properly should be fired or severely dealt with. Did any of these employees receive any training about the severity if COVID-19? Do they even care about not endangering their customers? Why should I ever enter that store again? All of this is unacceptable and not following CDC guidelines. This store is located in Fairhope, Alabama. I will report this to local health department authorities. I myself have been trained in contact tracing, epidemiology in public health, and spent my career in public and environmental health.

name: Maria C. Cardoso
text: They are always so very helpful.

name: Susan S
text: Is Fairhope choking on its growth or is this the worst managed Walgreens in the entire chain?  Just waited ONE HOUR to pick up a refill that I dropped off last week.  I've been in the store 14 TIMES since then trying to pick it up in a reasonable amount of time and without rubbing shoulders with other people who may be sick.  I couldn't get it done, so I caved tonight and waited and WAITED.  I recently moved to Fairhope from Atlanta. I never waited like this at my neighborhood Walgreens there.  The express lane at the Fairhope store is a joke.  I'll check out CVS next time.  Goodbye Walgreens!

name: April Harrison
text: Ìjj love the selection, just feel they, as well as CVS are a little overpriced. Uh unless you catch a good sale it's going to be a bit more on the pricey side. Missing Rite Aid lol

She is the reason I continue to shop there, because it's nice to know I will get the help I need and be treated kindly while getting it!

text:
I've always loved going in to Walgreens, especially since it's so much nicer in atmosphere and cleanliness then CVS. However, the newest addition to the Walgreens team has me never wanting to go back. Their new cashier, Adele, is a very rude women that made me feel belittled.

I'm not sorry that I am an older women and sometimes take a moment longer to do things than I used too but that's no reason to treat me like a second class citizen.

I asked her for help finding something and she said it fast while not looking me, so I asked her to repeat it. She rolled her eyes and told me in exasperation where it was.

I refuse to go back to Walgreens and shop within the store if I see her working. Please, to whomever is in charge, tell her that she needs to remember to watch her customer service.

name: Jerri Galloway
text: Was in the pharmacy line forever !! You better not be in a hurry if you have to go there!!

name: unclewalt56
text: Haven't dealt with the pharmacy, but the cashiers are always very helpful as well as friendly as is the manager who has gone out of his way to help me with some OTC items. Very much appreciated.

name: Max Taylor
text: Understaffed pharmacy

name: Mario Gabriel JR.
text: I’ve been to Walgreens in Fairhope several times even though I get most Rxs via the mail. It’s always a wait even when I use their express service. Not many greetings other than “Can I help you”. I’ve inched closer to finding another local pharmacy other than Walmart, where I can feel completely appreciated. As for the rest of the staff and store, not a complaint. I could easily give them a 4 star but not the pharmacy.

name: Daniel Campbell
text: Great pharmacy. The store has a good selection and good prices. You just have to be prepared to drop your prescriptions off or have them called in ahead of time because they stay very busy. Conveniently, they have a lot of technology to help with a Walgreens App available in the App Store, etc messaging notifications or email for when your medication is ready, has been delayed, or is ready to be refilled.

name: Leigh Ann Walker
text: Their drive thru needs a major overhaul!!  Perhaps Chic Fil A can coach them on process improvement.

name: Anthony Rogers
text: Pharmacy is usually busy and backed up. Employees work hard and do a good job

name: Richard Baker
text: If I could give a negative I would ,customer service is nonexistent...unfortunately They bought out rite aid

name: Tabitha Milam
text: Literally the longest wait time no matter what time you go in the drive thru, and the in store pharmacy AND regular check out always has a line and long wait as well. The only reason I haven’t switched is because it’s 2 seconds from my house, but definitely considering a new pharmacy if this store doesn’t get it together.

name: Sandy McDonald
text:
I've always had a very positive experience shopping at the Fairhope Ave. Walgreens.  The employees are always very nice and helpful, but my recent experience prompted me to take the time to write this review. I was looking for bar soap that contains zinc.

Katie, the young lady who assisted me went way above and beyond her duty to help me. While I was in the store, she looked in the store and online in an attempt to find the soap. When she found no immediate options, she asked that I call her in a few days so she could do some research. She found that zinc soap manufacturers are having production issues resulting in long backorder times, but that zinc supplements and sunscreen products were not impacted. She is now working with her manager to identify any special ordering options. I greatly appreciate Katie's kindness and genuine desire to help.

name: Jennifer Heaton
text: Ever since Rite Aid merged with this store it has been a nightmare!  The wait is extremely long to get your prescriptions at the drive-thru or inside, even though they have about 10 pharmacists behind the counter.   I couldn't get anyone in the pharmacy to pick up my phone call either.   I tried three times and waited on hold forever.   The manager even went back there to have them answer the phone,  but to no avail.   Horrible service!!

name: Bob Morrow
text: I require certain med for arthritis.   Ran out, so called around to find a pharmacy that stocked the med so could get filled in one day.  Walgreen said they stocked the med.  Had doc send scrip there.  Waited several hours and called about status of scrip.  Was told they did not stock the med and ordered it.  Could not get till next day.  Second time something like this has something like this has happened  at this Walgreens.  Will not happen again.

name: David Jones
text:
The pharmacy recently did not have my prescription. I would have to wait 8 days. No one in the pharmacy offered to call other Walgreens stores to check on the availability
They were not very helpful and somewhat annoyed when I asked them to please check with other local Walgreens. They were not busy at the time. I  was the only one there.

name: Page Ellis
text: Now that Walgreens has bought out the local Rite Aid, the pharmacy wait has become unacceptable. I gave it a few months to let them get acclimated to the larger number of customers but it has not improved. Last night it took 45 minutes to get my script which was called in by the doctor before hand. There were 10 people working behind the counter but it didn’t seem to make the process any faster. There must be something Walgreens can do to more efficiently process their customers in store. Walgreens, if you’re going to buy more customers from another pharmacy in an attempt to make more money faster, make sure you are able to keep the customers with good, efficient service. I also didn’t see the Rite Aid pharmacy employees who were supposed to be kept on staff when I came into the pharmacy this last time. I am missing the personal, friendly relationship with the employees and the good, quick service.

name: Mike Dodd Mini Storage
text: Doesn't matter when you go the the pharmacy inside or outside it's always a loooooooog wait! Hire some help,

name: Lisa W
text: Had to call 4 time to finely get a live person! Get rid of that recording that picks up your phone. You get stuck in a loop when the recording picks up. Let your customers know they are important to you and your business and have someone answer the phone not a recording. Or risk losing your customers. This is bad business.

name: JeremyAshleigh Davis
text: Worst customer service. Tried to give me the wrong medicine three times. Pharmacy staff is rude and unkind... don’t care to help you at all. Don’t expect your medicine when they say it’ll be ready. Ridiculous!

name: Lauren Strube
text: Longest wait ever and everytime i go this lady is so rude at the window. I don't know her name cause she won't even give you a chance to talk. I literally switch to Fairhope Pharmacy because of her.

name: Johnathan King
text: Was told Rx would be ready at 11:15 called in at 10:15. Showed up at 11:30. Was told to come back at 12. Show up at 12 to be told it would be another 20 minutes. Still don’t have the Rx at 12:20. Expect to spend a few hours at the pharmacy

name: Christy B.
text:
I ended up waiting in the drive thru for my RX for at least a 1/2 hr.
The line was short and the Rx was ready.
(It had been called in a day prior). Service was soooooo slow.
I will not be back! 😡

name: Allie Knutson
text:
The only reason that I would give this Walgreens one star instead of zero (if I could) is because the staff IN the store are very nice.

However, the Phamacy staff has continuously proven themselves to be extremely unfriendly and rude (outside of one person I’ve encountered while picking up perscriptions). They make it seem like you are inconveniencing them by picking up your medicine.
My boyfriend and I have gone seperately to this Walgreens to pick up our prescriptions for months now and we both always experience the same kind of treatment.

On top of the rudeness, the drive thru takes FOREVER. It always takes at least half an hour in the drive thru.

We will be switching pharmacies.

name: Shirley Miles
text: The quick corner coming from uptown across from Carwash

name: David Larson
text: The pharmacy makes the same mistakes over and over. Be prepared to wait 4 or more hours to get a pascription filled. Once they finally let you know it's done , it's not. It is never really ready. Now wait another 15 min and try again. This time when you think it has to be done, guess what its not going be filled. The worst part is the attitude of the workers. Try Rite Aid in Fairhope and you will avoid this tragedy of a store.

name: Kayla Stump
text: Tried to use the pharmacy because i liked the idea of the drive tru and thought it would be convienent. They are ssllooww. They are rude and could care less if you were there or not. I told the lady to forget about it. They are worse than Walmart and that's saying a lot! Looking for a pharmacy in Fairhope that has decent workers, it's not this one!

name: James Ekelund
text: 2nd Try. Again, terrible development. 75% of my 80 prints had major edges removed, cutting off faces, heads and other features of my photos. This was my 2nd experience, about one year apart. Additionally, two copies of same print, one is OK, next is blurry. Maybe development computer needs adjustment! I tried Walgreens because of same Keibler at Walmart. Need recommendation as to whom can print these digital photos correctly???

name: tami lindsey
text: Horrible service with the pharmacy. My little has had leukemia three times, and I cannot even get these people to actually order the prescription which was called in almost two weeks ago. They are incompetent.

name: Zackery Presnall
text: Had to wait over an hour to get a my prescription that had been called in beforehand.  I would give 0 stars if possible.

name: Michael Brantley
text:
here is a real consumer review for this product
"bot it tried it put it away"
immediate relief last for 2 minutes waste of money .

text: Love it period

text: Got my COVID-19 vaccine and everything was great!

name: Kalila Sankey
text: Great customer service

name: Alex Creznic
text: Would love to rate higher but the phone answering service automatically booted me off all 4 times that I called. I had an insurance question for the pharmacy and was unable to reach a store associate during normal business hours on 4 separate attempts. Will change rating  to 4 stars if this gets fixed.

name: Frank Rivers
text: Drive thru is faster than walking in for service, sometimes calling ahead is better for certain items...................

text: Friendly service, helpful cashiers!

name: Brandi Edgeworth
text: Long wait !

text: Always very helpful

text: Always helpful and kind, even though the check out process is slow if more than 2 customers are in line.

name: Penny Bolen geiger
text: Customer service was terrible.  The lady who helped me at the drive thru was disgusted to have to look for an item I requested, liquid tylenol.

name: Big Pop Productions
text: Visited Walgreens looking for summer a dental repair items because I had a Crown come loose. The clerk that helped me was knowledgeable and pointed me in the direction that I needed to go in period the store was well lit well organized and clean and tidy. Also while I was there I had found some items that I had been looking for at other stores that were not available so I happened upon some a luckily I happened upon some things that I had wanted or needed. When cashing out the young lady offered to join their Walgreens value club membership card she was not pushy or and she didn't ask for any information that was above and beyond but I was willing to give her so it made it for a pleasant experience.

name: Rebecca Collier
text: I have been using this pharmacy for a while now and they are always very friendly and helpful. They have helped me find coupon cards when my insurance copay was really high on two of my medications.

name: sarah chapman
text: I can't say enough good! Alex (a manager) went out of his way to find a FedEx package for me and o so greatly appreciate it! All the staff present that I interacted with this morning were so nice and helpful here!

name: Douglas Rathbun
text: Been coming here since relocating to Mobile in January. This store could be a poster child for how a retail operation should be run.  The staff (store and pharmacy) are always super friendly and helpful.  The pharmacy is ran efficiently.  I can't say enough about how well they treat their customers.

name: William Johnson
text: Mary was incredibly rude and disrespectful. What kind of Manager is this? I hope she gets caught in her ways. I overheard her call a small younger woman of color a “whore” and made her out to look dumb. I feel for the girl. I was so disheartened I left without buying anything. This isn’t the southern hospitality I was raised in and my family shouldn’t witness it either. Never going back.

name: Megan Bartlett
text: Usually have a pleasant experience getting my prescription from this location. This time the lead pharmacist was incredibly rude. I have been using a savings card for my prescription at that location for over a year now with no problems. They accepted it with my insurance no issue... today I went to get my prescription with my savings card and instead of the pharmacist apologizing and saying they don't accept those savings cards with my insurance she begins to tell me that by using the savings card I'm getting them in trouble because its illegal, my doctor is illegally practicing by giving me savings cards, I'm illegally trying to get my prescription... she didn't even offer a solution she just kept telling me its illegal? Last time I checked they were the ones accepting it for a year with no issue... don't try to come onto a customer for your own company's mistake. I had no clue it shouldn't be accepted with my insurance until today.

name: OSCAR FERUT
text: Manager would not accept return for an unopened Walgreens branded product without the receipt bc he reserves "manager discretion" even though the corporate return policy allows returns w/o receipt for store credit. The policy is posted directly on their entrance which I pointed out to him.

name: Patty Rocco
text: They have gone downhill quickly. Get it together!

name: Jeff Alfred
text: The pharmacist I dealt with was extremely rude. Not to mention my prescription that I had to wait for took two and a half hours. Terrible experience. Zero stars should be an option.

name: THE WOMACK'S WAY!
text: Rude pharmacy employees, I had to hang up on her just to keep from cursing her out!

name: Waleed Y
text: The pharmacist helped me to find the right medicine.

name: Savannah Reed
text: I recently had my hair colored here with Tasha. She did it once before and I really loved it. I went in again before my baby shower and she totally messed up my hair. She bleached my roots and tried to hide it by parting my hair. I get home, and the roots all over my head are ORANGE. Needless to say, I've gone all over Birmingham to find someone to fix her COSTLY mistake because I don't trust her to lay another finger on my head. I still can't get this orange out and I will never come back to this store. For any reason what so ever.

name: Haley Traylor
text: The hairstylist was very rude and unprofessional. Paying $40 for a dry cut just to be constantly insulted. "You have SO much gray hair"  "your scalp is so dry" "your hair is SO dry"  "you have way less hair on this side" and being told to highlight your hair multiple times to cover the gray. What a lovely appointment. Right? The gray is not a problem. It runs in our family and our women rock it.  The point of going to beauty appointments is to feel better when you leave not worse. And theres a feeling that negative things were being said to push product. No thanks.

name: Emily Scruggs
text: My appointment was at 1:30. My stylist didn't come to apologize for being behind until 2pm and then I had to wait another 15 minutes before even getting to my chair. Then I give specific instructions on what color I wanted but it turned out WAY lighter than I thought. She took forever and ended up doing her 4 pm appointment while she was still working on my hair. If another stylist hadn't stepped in, I think my scalp would have burned.  The other stylist ended up finishing my hair. I was there for FOUR hours total. And then my bill was higher than I expected.

name: Aimzway
text: The salon scammed me into paying $50 for a haircut. They said they gave me "a deep condition treatment" that I didn't ask for. When the girl shampooed my hair she said, "I'm going to leave the shampoo in for a minute." I didn't know that would be considered a deep condition treatment. The employees at the salon were also passive and unhelpful. The girl just cut my hair didn't do any face framing or layers. I could have gone somewhere else, but I didn't know because it was my first time there. Throughout the entire haircut she didn't tell me what products she was using on my hair unless I asked, she didn't seem to care about what she was doing. I would recommend not going to the salon.

name: Jacqueline Harper
text: Poor customer service. My cashier was snobby, and I felt like my business was not wanted even when I entered the store. I only went there to pick up some hair products because they were on sale. It sad that someone on the sales floor greeted me with a smile. I watched as others were greeted while coming in to the store, I didn't even get greeted while making my purchase.

name: Azziza S
text: Both budget priced and high quality cosmetics offered. Great place for all your skin care needs.

name: Emily Nieters
text: SOMER IS THE BEST STYLIST THEY HAVE, OTHER STYLIST ARE EXTREMELY RUDE!!!

name: Leah Graves
text: Frustrating because every time I go they are out of at least one thing I need and I end up going over to sephora. Also it is usually understaffed. One cashier and a line of at least 7 or 8 waiting. I like the discounts/points, but will order online from now on.

name: Kylie Jerkins
text: Fantastic selection and great staff

name: Elizabeth Gary
text: Great products!

name: Nick King
text: Employees are consistently rude/condescending.

name: Kristina Billings
text: GREAT

text: Build one closer to Oxford, AL.

name: LISA LAGASSE
text:
This place is normally higher priced on most items than walmart. Sometimes we have had prescription mix ups such as two different antibiotics when only one was meant. Not sure how this happened.
The drive through and pharmacy people are very nice.

name: Jessica Ferguson
text: Staff is very rude and act like you are wasting their time by being there. I use Publix normally but have to get one prescription here cause it's cheaper otherwise I would NEVER come to this location.

name: Elizabeth H.
text: I usually have a good experience but the lady who checked me out today seemed annoyed that I told her my prescription is $21 cheaper at the Madison location and I had called them to discount my prescription at this location. I didn't appreciate the eye roll and attitude. They should do more to help their customer's with discounts when they know they're available because the people in Madison sure do and was so nice & helpful when I called them.

name: The Gian Institute
text: Worst pharmacy ever!! Alyssa, the pharmacist, is the rudest person. She changed my daughter's prescription without doctor's approval!! When we asked about it, she and the technicians yelled at us to get out and never come back. Rudest pharmacist and technicians ever! Don't go there!!! I have reported them to the Corporate Offices twice now because of the rudeness of this pharmacist and the staff.

name: Alyson Girdlestone
text: Wish I could give 0 stars.  I have never had trouble filling my medicine at any other CVS but ever since I've moved them to this CVS it has been nothing but problems every month. Most of the pharmacy staff are rude and can't explain anything they just say to call my insurance and as I said other pharmacy's have filled the same exact prescription with no problems.

name: Stacey
text: Been a customer a long time. Shopping and prescription.  I worked some 10 years in the business myself. Changed doctors, ran out of a script by accident non-narcotic, much needed, asked for a few until my script could be called in on Monday or so. Consultant hem hawed around and said no, sorry we can't help you.  I know they could have.  That's how you lose customers folks. Three customers gone.

name: Joe Birch
text:
Called today concerning a prescription that just expired. Experience with other pharmacy they offer to contact doctor for new script. This pharmacy says they fax doctors and get no response. ???
Are my problems with CVS or just this location ?

name: Joe Birch
text: Very rude pharmacy staff . Noticed they have little or no patience with seniors. This would be a great place to put a pharmacy !

name: Bailey Chasteen
text: Either update your sign or actually close at 10:00. Spare me coming in at 9:06 to withdraw cash from the ATM and being me told you're closed.

name: That Girl
text: have had mostly positive results with them. occasionally they take longer than they say to fill the prescriptions. but the staff is friendly and helpful.

name: SenpaiSnek
text: The staff say they will do stuff like call your other pharmacy and get them to move your perception to this store and 3 days later when I go and get my medicine, and nope. They're not ready yet. Seriously? This isn't the first mishap I've ran into either. If you say the meds are going to be ready in 15 minutes and I come back an hour later and they're still not filled. Yeah, I'm going to be upset. That's happened on more than 3 occasions. I do not like this store. Find another CVS for meds?

text: We have had problems for 3 years with my MIL meds, she has dementia and they never have a full stock or never fill them on time. Plus they are very slow. I know they took all of Fred's pharmacy patients but they need to have more workers. I'm sure Walgreens is making more money now with all these new people coming in. I personally go to walmart and have NEVER had a problem. Tonight I waited 35 min in line with only 2 people ahead of me,and the girls working need to work of social skills or Walgreens need to hire more people and give folks a break. Either way let's get it together Brewton Walgreen!!!

name: April Blake
text:
So I do enjoy getting lashes, hair color and nail supplies here. The prices are unbeatable and the employees are very kind and let you shop undisturbed except occasionally asking if your finding everything ok..i come in here a couple times a month as it saves me alot of money than if I went to walmart or Sally's even.
My only  2 true complaints is that there is no cosmetics in my skin color or any caucasian skin tone for that matter. I feel they could try to cater to the needs of all their customers of every shade even if it's just ordering a few items in those shades. I even remember asking them one day if they had any cosmetics in my color and got a straight no. My other issue is I've noticed alot of times there is alot of items that are not kept in stock in the nail section and old polish that needs to be turn out.Honestly I understand that it's a big store and normally I only see 2 people working. Itd just be nice to come in and get the correct nail tips i need. Instead I sometimes see alot of empty spaces in the nail area. I'd come here more often if they did.

It another 10 minutes before anyone even  approached the window to ask me if I was picking up or dropping off. This pharmacy is close to my house and the worst service I have ever experienced. Hopefully in the near future they will become more organized, more efficient, and a little more courteous toward their customers.

text: There was a lady she was very mean and disrespectful she treated us very poorly and she also roused her voice and talked back.I don’t recommend coming here because their service is terrible.

name: Letricia Ogutu
text: I have no qualms about the store itself; generally, the staff is friendly & helpful. The pharmacy, however, is another story. The customer service there is awful -- & I'm putting it mildly. They're always out of stock of crucial medications (e.g. medications for management of diabetes,  antiepileptic medications, etc.). With the exception of one, the pharmacy techs are generally unhelpful, rude, &/or unpleasant to deal with.

name: Paul Burns
text: Very poor pharmacy service here.  They do not care for customers.  It's not worth my time to describe how poorly I was treated here.  Highly recommend using any other pharmacy.

name: Laura Coates
text: Love this location...great people and nicely kept store!

name: Misty Marks
text: I used to love this store but lately they need to train their cashiers on their own coupon policy. Telling me I can only use one coupon is ridiculous when it states 2 or 4 on the coupon. I will not be returning. Walgreens is already overpriced.

name: Mario Heard Sr.
text: Always great more helpful than Walmart love the text when medicine is ready and a phone call before you run out.

name: Melissa Seay
text:
They NEVER answer the phone when you call...EVER! Then you end up driving there to take care of something that could have been resolved over the phone. Service is so S L O W...

Updated:  If I could give less than one star, I would. I had a prescription filled for Flexeril, a muscle relaxer.  They gave me the wrong medication!  I received Singulair, an asthma medication instead.  I called and the tech that answered the phone was less than concerned and borderline indifferent! I am so mad right now!  I spent  almost $600 out of pocket for physical therapy because I thought the medication wasn't helping!

name: Katrina Conley
text: This is the worst place to get a prescription refilled. I called about 3pm and the girl told me it would be ready about 5:30pm. When I get there(after 9) they don't have it and they tell me its not covered under my insurance. I get the same script filled every month and its always something. I bet I'll get a call tomorrow with the voice message saying my prescription is ready. At least she should have called to let me know or something instead of me wasting my gas. Think I will go to CVS

name: Caroline Tygret
text: Prescription was filled by different Walgreens so they cancelled it to fill here. While I sit  there waiting finally someone asked who I was. I told them and they said, they didn't have the medicine to fill my prescription. So I had to call them to refill it again and go out of my way to pick up my prescription. Will be finding a new pharmacy. I have already told a few other people and they will no longer shop at Walgreens.

name: Carol Disney
text: I have my share of issues with them, but at the end they solve the problem and a smile. We must remember we are not the only person they see.

name: Misty Moore
text: Update since last time...I thought I would give this store another shot but then they refuaed to take even ONE coupon because it was already on sale....are you freaking kidding me?!?!?!

name: Ferletia Sheppard
text: I Like this Walgreens.

name: Stephanie Staton
text: This is the worst pharmacy in all of Huntsville drop a prescription off at 4pm was told it would be ready by 6 called around 6:30 was told it wasn't ready yet called at 8:30 and no one would answer called the store its self and the manager said it wasn't her problem this store needs to have its staff fired will never go here again and would not recommend this place to anyone under any circumstance this store needs to be investigated DO NOT GO TO THIS STORE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

El servicio es pesimo ,tardan una hora recoger tu receta afuera y tardan en tenerla lista , no contestan el telefono te dejan en espera y nunca contestan 💣💣😡😡😡

text: I walked with my friend all the way there and should have had 2 minutes left when they should have closed at 6:00 they were already closed. My prescription was ready but noone would get it for me. It was counted and could have been gotten....She missed getting her medicine and was very disappointed.  She may change pharmacies.....

name: Robyn Mudd
text: Don't expect to be able to use your reward points here. Doesn't matter whether you put in your phone number or use the card, you're going to get "You have nothing to redeem". Tonight was the final straw for me. The MANAGER checked me out and of course said I had nothing to redeem yet my receipt said I had a beginning balance of 5000 which was $5 I could use. Called customer service when I got home and they said "You should have been able to use them because you actually have more than $5". This happens ALL.THE.TIME. Why should I be loyal to this company when they hardly ever follow through on their word/policy?

name: Mallory T
text:
Apparently this store may close a few minutes before they are scheduled to close. My husband and I, along with two other customers, were met with locked doors at 5 minutes until closing.

I understand that it’s not ideal to pop in last minute, but I guess Walgreens won’t be our go to anymore.

name: Jeffery Robison
text: Conveniently open for late night needs and many kinds, thanks for being there.

name: Mallory McAtee
text: I went to drop a percription  off gave the lady my insurance card she said they take it. It will be ready at 1 great go about my day. I come back at 2 to get my medicine to be told they do not take my insurance. No phone call or anything so I have to go somewhere else being sick and pregnant driving all around town because they could not pick up the phone or check it when I have the lady to begin with. I will never shop at Walgreens again!!

name: Vin Bryant
text: The regular part of the store is great. They have the best selection of candy in Decatur. An employee named Scottie is always helpful and nice. Too bad Scottie don't work in the pharmacy. The pharmacy rates at the bottom of all big named pharmacies in Decatur. They never have prescriptions ready when promised. If you drop a prescription off to be filled it will likely take two or three hours. The pharmacy staff are rude and treat people like you are there to serve them. I've tried all of the big name pharmacies in Decatur and they are the worst. Go to Walmart on 6th Ave sw for your big named pharmacy needs.

As employees it is obvious that you have first pick of items that are much wanted by everyone and cannot be found anywhere, but no need to run it in the public's face!

CVS will always be my first choice..even though it takes up to 45-90 mins to get your meds filled; they txt you when your scripts are ready and have auto-fill as an option, as well. The staff at Scottsboro, AL are very friendly and informative.

text: Walgreens pharmacy in general is horrible. Facility in Foley Al is twice as bad. Myself and wife have had to change do to the inability to provide a decent service. We’re sorry. Really busy. We’re sorry, not sure what happened, can you come back in a couple hrs or maybe tomorrow. Same $&it every time. I would love to be contacted by someone at corporate. Horrible service and major attitude from the pharmacist at foley. It was all my fault in her eyes. Should be accustomed to it. I will now change my daughters Rx to a home town pharmacy.

text: Went to drop off my mother's prescription and the lines were backed up down an aisle. There had to be 20 people just standing around the pharmacy area & suddenly two customers begin yelling, cussing & threatening each other. Several customers asked a Walgreens employ to call the police, & she decides to page just management. At this point I walked out & told my 74 yr old mother NEVER to go back there. The parking lot is dangerous too!

name: Ed Wheeler
text: We use the pharmacy and always have found them polite and knowledgeable. There phone notification is timely. When an item is not in stock they have always gotten it withing 24 hours.

name: jane .flippo
text: Sick baby’s prescription called in from doctor office at 9:30 am. Mom went to pick it up at 4; not ready. Pushed out of line by window clerk with no explanation. I returned at 7:30 pm, waited in line 18 minutes to find out is still not ready! Asked for insurance card, it’s on file for a regular prescription. Took 20 more minutes to be ready. Asked why, got a shoulder shrug! Asked someone else why, got an “I don’t know...” Store manager not in. Now brick baby has missed 3 doses of prescription and not one person can tell me why, apologize, or offer a Refund! Go to a Publix! Don’t waste your time here!

name: Roxanne Dugger
text: When I stayed in Spanish fort I loved going to Walgreens, but for whatever reason every time I try to get a prescription from the one in Foley I have to fight to get it done. For one thing they don't let me know when it's ready. My most recent prescription they tried to say my insurance would only cover but one pill. That's bull because first of all it's not even expensive without insurance, second, I have BCBS and my package is over 500 a month so it's not some rinky dink insurance. Just save yourself some trouble and go to island drug. I have never had an issue, and they treat me like I'm a friend not a number.

name: Brandy Knodel
text: I stood in line for almost 25 minutes when I got up to the counter the girl pulled out two of the three prescriptions and then instead of asking me to wait or even telling me anything she looked past me and called for the next customer. Not once saying anything until I asked her what I was supposed to do.  While I understand that they were indeed busy,  there is no reason for rudeness. Shame on Wendy!

name: Boxcar Willy
text: Great store - Always clean and staffed good - Pharmacy is the greatest!  Always on their game and always friendly and helpful! Best pharmicist on the coast!!! We love this store!

name: Andrew Novak
text:
Guaranteed the biggest groups of idiots you will find in one space

*UPDATE*
It has been 10 months and Walgreens has failed to fix or provide any feedback to any of their high number of 1 Star reviews (more 1 stars than any rating put together as of 3/13/19) glad to know how much they actually care about their business. Just go to publix trust me

name: Dorothy Brown
text: I would give this pharmacy zero stars if I could. They do not value your time at all. I went to pick up a prescription for my dad from the weekend & it wasn't ready. It was a partial prescription so it should have been ready. They knew I was waiting but they didn't care. Everyone else who was waiting came & gone. I sat there 30 minutes. This pharmacy is a joke.

text: The pharmacy Staff at the window is always rude! There is no need in being rude to anyone especially someone who is sick. If you don’t like your job get another one preferably not in a customer service field.

text: Horrible place to fill prescriptions!  Rude and unprofessional. Ridiculous really that you can’t speak to a person who’s job is to serve without being short and disrespectful and have an attitude.  I understand a bad day but this isn’t the first time and by the remarks I see below combined with a very low rating, it’s easy to see why.

name: Bridget L
text: The pharmacist was very helpful and nice.

name: Anna Gonzalez
text: 4 months pregnant wearing a heart monitor, I called to see if my 4yo ADHD medication was in stock before I drove all the way there with my 2 other children. They told me they couldnt tell me over the phone they would have to see the prescription to answer that! Drove up there had to take my kids out and go in, my sick 2 yo in my arms asleep and ofcourse they didnt have it, I wasnt rude I asked why they couldn't of told me before they said because of the type of medication its an requirement I asked of it was a law and no its not a law its only a precautionary requirement, my son has multiple special needs not just ADHD and with a history at this pharmacy you would think a simple yes or no could of happened. Not coming back, it's sad I get better service and hospitality at Walmart.

name: d Busch
text: The pharmacists are patience and kind.

name: Denise Dixon
text: My son has asthma and was in need of his medication as soon as possible i went through and refilled his prescription at 12:30 and was told to come at 2 to pick up.. i get off work early to pick up his meds only to be told they " somehow got pushed back" and that it will be a few hours now. This is the most UNPROFESSIONAL AND UNORGANIZED PHARMACY i have ever did business with. I will no longer do business with this pharmacy!!! They should be SHUT DOWN how they run this pharmacy especially since it is someone's MEDICATION!!

text: Very rude staff. Perhaps they should find a new line of work, away from the public.

They couldn't tell me anything about my rx, customer service is nonexistent at this store. Then the dumbest one that answered the phone complained to me how she been answering calls all day, I told her good job you're at work that's what you're suppose to do. I swear this Walgreens was sent from hell to drive all their customers away.   If you need a rx, just drive somewhere else anywhere else. These people will have you on hold all to day just to not resolve your issue. I wish I could subtract these damn stars.

I left the store feeling very small and extremely disrespected. I knew I was in the right and having someone speak to me that was so insulting. I went straight my usual Fedex drop off who gladly took my package.

name: Sheri Dorgan
text:
FOLEY ALABAMA Between Happy & RUDE.........
I called Wal green's in Foley, Al. to ask how much my husband's prescription was. The pharmacist answered the phone and I ask the price of the medication. He replied in a condescending monotone “he is over the age of 18 and he can call himself” I said “excuse me” and he repeated himself.  I am calling corporate in Deerfield IL., first thing in the morning. It is bad enough to be sick, but to have a pious demoralizing pharmacist talk down to you when you are giving them your hard earned money is just not the norm……. He acted like he had done a few dowers himself.

text: Horrible customer service. Inflated prices and the store manager has absolutely no idea what she is doing. The pharmacy techs are rude and I waited in line for over 28 minutes. Go to Walmart instead!

Asked for assistance and immediately a sweet girl came to my rescue. She answered all my questions, gave me tips, showed me what products to purchase. Couldn't have been a better shopping experience without her.

When I was checking out, I finally realized she didn't work there. Big thanks to her friend who did work there for having her help me. This was my first time at this location. I will be back and recommending to all to go there.

Ps to the girl who helped me.  I manage a fitness gym Riviera Fitness Centerpoint. I help promote OUR MEMBERS BUSINESSES. COME SEE ME. WOULD LOVE TO HELP PROMOTE YOURS😊

I've been a repeat customer for many years and even worked for the company many years ago. Nipples, really. She needs to be more professional. Not funny at all.
