name: Debra West
text: Wish I could have left 0 stars. Had surgery this morning and dropped off my prescription at 2 pm they told me it would be 5 before it was ready it's now 10 minutes until 6 and it's STILL not ready. Very rude customer service also. Last trip there for me!

name: Tonya Harvey
text: I hate this store, lines are too long, takes forever!!

name: Twizty X
text: Used this Pharmacy for many years had a few issues though none of them major

name: Rafael M
text: Ok

name: Jim Dunning
text: My girlfriend loves this place

name: Matthew Blevins
text: I went to this Walgreens to drop off a Fedex package and the cashier at the front of the store was friendly and helpful however the lady in the photo department in charge of receiving packages was rude and didn’t want to help. She told me “she didn’t have any space left to hold my package” and then ended up taking the package anyways after she sighed and reluctantly took it. I told her thanks for the help and she just mumbled “mhm” while not looking at me at all and just walked off. Not a very good employee.

name: Suresh Mathews
text: Driver’s beware: This is a review for the Drive-through pharmacy pick-up. Friendly staff at the window; fairly quick service. If paying by cash the change is returned in an envelope - all great. But, drivers beware of your car/SUV driver’s side tire scraping the sides of the concrete. It happened to me couple times, and the second time was scary loud that I thought my tire ripped. Fortunately, it was fine. The exit out of the drive through is narrow and curves left; and therefore the tire scraping the concrete. It appears that this happens to every driver that is unaware of the lurking danger. I called and made a complaint with the Manager but there have been en changes yet to the drive through. I’ve educated myself that i need to turn my wheel to the right as I exit out and then lean left into the turn. This way the driver’s side rear wheel gets more space and avoids scraping the concrete.

name: Eli Rowe
text: I got double charged for some OTC Walgreens brand Naproxen. It was $7.00 something per bottle and one bottle plus a pack of M&M’s and the total came to $16.00 something. Didn’t answer phone when I tried to call to fix issue.

name: Alan Manning
text: This pharmacy and its staff are completely incompetent. I called asking why they and several other Walgreens stores have absolutely no supplies of the medicine which I've easily been able to purchase from them in the past and can just as easily purchase from any other pharmacy, and they had not the slightest clue. They were also incredibly rude and not helpful AT ALL. It's not like Walgreens doesn't carry this medication either, as I've been able to purchase it at other Walgreens locations in the past, and it is a prescription medication.

name: Brandon Yates
text: We have used this pharmacy for several months. We have had a great experience each visit. They even gave our dog a treat. They are very friendly here.

name: Mia Tucker
text: The staff are polite and helpful!

name: Michael Lane
text: The pharmacy people are the worst! They say they are filling your script. NO you show up and the act like you ever dropped off! Had to wait another day for my meds. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!

name: Christie Musso Bruce
text: We have always used Walgreens for our prescriptions. We moved and started using this location about 6 months ago. I have never seen such rude people in the pharmacy in my life. None of them are friendly, never say thank you or nothing. They act like your bothering them when you pull up to get your medicine. It’s been an issue since we’ve moved here. We will be looking for another pharmacy.

name: McKenzie Middleton
text: Moved my prescription today due to this pharmacy's incompetence. My first run in with them was I had a Dr. back home and they refused to fill the prescription bc the dr was from out of town. But I took it to Walmart and they had no issues filling it. The 2nd run in was after i had surgery and the tech was extremely rude. I asked what the hold up was, thinking they may need to see my license or insurance and he responded "there isn't a hold up i told you it would be 15 minutes and it hasn't been." Then this last time they were going to charge me $194 for a monthly prescription,  I told them I couldn't afford that and had the dr call me in the same prescription to CVS, it was $0 and covered fully by my insurance. Will not go back.

name: Charlotte Collins
text: Pharmacy Staff is slow, rude and lazy. Seems like the most miserable place around to work. No one smiles or even remotely acts like they want to help you. I will be moving my rx needs to another pharmacy. Thank goodness the rest of the employees are very friendly and courteous. The pharmacy needs some serious attitude adjusting.

name: Diane Natale
text: It's a hit or miss. Some of the techs can get extremely rude and think that they are the pharmacists. Sometimes pharmacy can be very helpful. You just never know.

name: Sissy Smith
text: They RARELY, if EVER, even answer the phone at this location?! TWO WORDS: BAD. MANAGEMENT.

name: Eric Lawman
text: The store is great up until you get to the pharmacy. Every time I try to do anything with them either they don’t have the medication or the system is constantly down. So it’s either pay cash and get reimbursed later or wait for who knows how long for the system to come back up. I’ll shop here but I’m gonna find a new pharmacy to use.

name: Caleb Wilson
text: Every employee has always been helpful to me

name: Julia Thomason at Love the Mouse Travel
text: This my "go to" Walgreens. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The pharmacy used to be 24 hours but now closes at 10:00pm. If the pharmacy was still 24 hours I would have given them 5 stars.

name: Renee B
text:
Friendly Staff.
Great selection of allergy/cold/flu items in various brands.
The cutest theme/holiday gifts and decorations.
Every time we visit we're greeted with a smile.
Pharmaceutical Techs are knowledge and always ready to answer any questions we have and they do a great job explaining the meds.
Come back around Mother's Day for the perfect little something!

name: Robert key
text: Very rude an treat you like your a criminal, someome with a drug problem or poor! Very discriminatory the way those people in the pharmacy act especially lead pharmacist

name: Talia Ledbetter
text: Really sweet, accommodating pharmacy staff! Highly recommend.

name: Talia Ledbetter
text: Really sweet, accommodating pharmacy staff! Highly recommend.

name: Steven Hughes
text: Fed up with their incompetence.  Never again.

name: Jonathan Perez
text: I was told by one the ladies in the pharmacy department my medication would be ready by a certain time. I showed up a little late just in case they had been backed up. I show up and my order hadn't even been put in the system. O get asked by the young lady who took my order. I describe to her the person. She goes in the back and asks on of them. They loudly start mocking me saying did I just pick a random description. I mentioned to her when she got back that it was not a random description. The other women started laughing at the fact that I overheard. No level of professionalism shown here by them.

name: Natalie Chambers
text: I will personally never step back into this Walgreens again. My fiance and I went in there tonight and noticed one of the workers kept watching us. I didn't think anything of it at first but, she followed us outside. We asked her was there a problem she said no. But, wrote down our tag number. I have never felt so disrespected at a store in my life. I've never had a problem at Walgreens before. As ststed before I will never step back into this Walgreens again.

name: Taylor Ivins
text: I have only ever used the drive thru. My experience there varies. At times, I feel valued and am cheerily greeted by an employee who seems to genuinely care and enjoy their job. Other times, I am not greeted at all for several minutes while the employee types away on their computer (more than one of the employees do this). It’s not hard to quickly pick up the drive thru line and say “Welcome, I’ll be with you in just a moment” and carry on. As a customer, it does not leave a good impression when you are neglected. Typically the wait time is incredibly long, even if my prescription is filled and ready to go. I will continue to use this Walgreens because my insurance switched its contract from CVS and it is the closest location to me. But I will advise my friends and family against going here. The employees here need reinforced training on customer interaction.

name: Matt Morris Sr
text:
Best Walgreens ever The service here is Stellar... Pharm. Matt is Awesome
.....As are the rest of the staff !!!!!! Surprised i am the first to do a review....Love this store!

name: mahmoud suleiman
text: I will never go back again rude pharmacy staff prescription never ready when they tell you is going to be ready their system always having problem-connecting with insurance they just lost me and my wife and my five kids

name: Martha Pack
text: Horrible! Pharmacist very, very RUDE!

name: Valerie Harris
text: The pharmacy guys are terrible!!!

name: JC Minton
text: Love this location! Was disappointed when they started closing the pharmacy at midnight.

name: RL R
text: No Wonder no one was in the parking Lot ? Word of this Businesses prices must have got around  $12.42 for a small box of Alka-Seltzer cold night . thats double everywhere else . Look around elsewhere much better prices elsewhere hell anywhere just check it out ?

name: Charles Chestang
text: I checked my call log to verify the following times - I got to the pharmacy 40 minutes after a CVS employee stated on the phone that the prescription would be ready in about 45 minutes, in other words I was 5 minutes early, and am then told "we should have it ready by about 12:20"  which means I either have to wait for 43 more minutes or make a second trip. What was even more irritating is that the clerk had nothing to say at all, if she had simply stated "I'm sorry for the delay", even though it may have been a meaningless or hollow remark, I wouldn't have posted this negative review but to waste someone's time and make it clear that it means absolutely nothing to you is beyond rude.

name: Chuck
text: When you walk in they always greet you. I normally go inside to the Pharmacy and the ladies are always nice. When you are walking out the lady upfront normally tell you to have a good day. I have not had any bad experiences with CVS with the one in Saraland and Grand Bay.

name: Clay Mcdaniel
text: The pharmacist was very polite, professional and breathtakingly beautiful. I can't wait to get my prescriptions filled again .

name: Blueeyes WECP
text: Jennifer one of the managers was very rude, argumentative, not willing to help, and apparently didn’t care if she got my business. Called higher management.  Hopefully something will be done to resolve.  I definitely will not be back as long as she is there. Sadly I was a regular.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Pharmacy staff is unprofessional--lacking common etiquette and manners, ordering "Hold on" on the phone, and when thanked, they give you "mm-hm" and hang up instead of "you're welcome" and returning APPRECIATION for you as a customer. I will seek to change with whom we do business.

name: Goddbod. Junya “iceberg” Winston
text: very neat...

name: Andrea B.
text: This is by far my favorite drugstore and this location is my favorite CVS location. The pharmacy team  goes above and beyond for every customer. The store and pharmacy managers are friendly and professional.

name: Shannon White
text: I love shopping here!

name: Bryce Karcher
text: Nobody answers the phone in pharmacy department. Hold 20 minutes and now another 12 minutes.  Too busy to just answer or ask to call back. Terrible.

name: Jns S
text: Rude cashier & wouldn't answer questions about passport photos or pricing wow, nice store & good digital photo system.

name: Ji Hoon Jung
text: Clean and nice staff

name: Always A&A
text: Great store

name: Bryn Ealy
text: As a medical professional, I can say that I’ve never had another medical colleague speak to me so condescendingly over the phone. My patient was out of state on vacation and unfortunately was having severe pain in a tooth we had recently done a root canal on. I sent prescriptions for an antibiotic and pain medication for the patient. The patient called me after hours stating that the pharmacy wouldn’t allow her to have the narcotic and that I needed to call them myself to verify the prescription. When I spoke with the pharmacist on staff, she berated me for trying to transfer a controlled substance from another Walgreens. I questioned if her e-prescribe was comparable with my dental software, and she basically told me to kick rocks. The prescription ended up going through, but from the sounds of it, she was also very rude to my patient. For someone whose job is literally to help patients obtain medication in order to feel better, this pharmacist clearly had no interest.  Disappointed in the care given to someone clearly in pain and not drug-seeking. My patient is not the first person in the world to have ever had a toothache while away from their regular dentist. She won’t be the last.

name: Erik Newby
text: Can’t speak to picking up prescriptions, but the store itself is well stocked with friendly staff. Found everything I needed and more.

name: Amanda E
text: The pharmacist last night was great at helping me with ear drops for my son! The prescription was filled fast and helpful with all of our questions.

name: Debbie Shumock
text: Had a terrible experience at the photo counter. Very rude lady. My order was late being processed and I didn’t receive all if my pictures. When I returned to get them one of them was awful. The color and clarity was terrible. They had to change something on the machine and I believe that caused the issue. I told the lady, Linda I believe is her name, the picture was fine on my phone. She refused to reprint saying the picture is what it is.  I had to toss it in the garbage.

name: Stacy Johnson
text: I had a great experience compared to other people's reviews. I am from out of state, needed a prescription and then a prior authorization called in from my doctor, and Drew in the pharmacy went above and beyond to get me the medicine I needed to help me feel better. Couldn't have asked for better!

name: Alex Elizabeth
text:
Dropped off a prescription right when they opened at 9 am and it’s now 6 pm. Went to pick it up and come to find out they were out of stock. I never got a phone call regarding the issues. According to the lady they were “too busy” there was no one there and she was very rude.

If you need a prescription filled I would go to CVS.

name: Wen Ka
text: Supper friendly pharmacy staff.

name: Nancy Johnstone
text: Not nice pharmacists! When I brought blood-pressure prescription to be filled there, they said my health insurance card doesn’t cover that and they would charge me $54 for 90-day supply - CASH only(!). I wasn’t sure prescription was generic but not helpful the pharmacists that didn’t even ask me if I wanted generic ones or whatever. I left there without picking them up. Went to another one for only $15 for 90-day supply even it covers my health insurance! Cash or card!

name: riley m
text: I went here to get some child melatonin and i had a question and i was at the pharmacy for easily 20 minutes waiting to get my question answered. There were 3 of them in the pharmacy and they didn’t pay any attention to me

name: James Gentry
text: Pick a different Walgreens. Wish we had read the reviews before going to the WORST Walgreens ever!! Took 4 hours to fill an  amoxicillin prescription. They wouldn't give us our prescription through the drive-thru for some reason so we had to bring our sick kids into the store. The people that run the store need to be fired immediately what an embarrassment to Walgreens.

name: James Meadlock
text: Friendly staff, but... I am prescribed a medication and insurance pays for 2/3's of it; they will not fill the whole prescription and let me pay for my third on the same day; I have to make an extra trip each month.  Stupidity makes me mad.

name: Ramey Holsten
text: The customer service at this store is TERRIBLE!! If you have a sick child please find a different pharmacy. They close up to walk out at 9 pm and do not open until 9:10.

name: Nicholei Sinclair
text: Just went into the store. The cashier was rude and homophobic, will definitely not go back!

name: Davida Ashley
text: Lovely ladies working here. They are always polite and helpful. I wish they had a bit more inventory but that's ok. The service makes up for the lack of options. You also have to remember that although Mobile is a major city in Alabama it's still a small city respectively. With that being said they definitely have enough to satisfy the demand of the locals. The location is ideal and they have normal prices

name: Maryah Payton
text: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. The Chinese lady that owns the place I guess, is so RUDE. She followed me around the entire store! Every turn I made she was right there watching me. I couldn't even shop. Will not be returning eveeeerrrr. Ain't nobody about to steal from this store! They don't even have anything. Wish I could give 0 stars.

name: Lakendra Bryant
text: I love Son she is always sweet and I always get what I need when I'm there

name: Kellye Wilson
text: I've been shopping there for years and I love it. Great customer service and they are very helpful.

name: Arlene Pettaway
text: Products are plentiful, but the customer service is HORRIBLE.....the manager/owner never smiles. If you don't speak to them, nothing is said by them. The Only reason I went there is because my stylist choice of hair was there......

name: Brittany Fleming
text: I go here all the time and they have good prices on they hair but the customer service is awful. Well the black girls are very nice but the Asian ppl that work here always follow you like you are stealing and stand there and watch you while you are trying to shop. Every black person does not steal and you can loose a lot of business like that.

name: Debra Colbert
text: I always enjoy shopping here, friendly and attentive personalities

name: Tori Witherspoon
text: lets begin walked in the store made it to the 3rd aisle before either of the 2 women looked up from their phone to speak only 1 spoke. Neither asked could they help as i walked up every aisle.. when i ask clerk very rude and nonchalant  and the manager snickering as Me and the clerk exchanged about what i wanted..  Asked the mang. where something is she pointed back wall oh ok its 50 items on the back wall... idk if it's petty women or lazy  or if its just going to a black ran store but i will not patronize there again.. SMH trying to support small black ran stores and get treated poorly

name: Sheryl Johnson
text: They got all your beauty needs

name: Cindy Smiley
text: Nice selection of jewelry and make up

name: Alisa Simpson
text: Great store lots of merchandise on hand

name: Elnora Beck
text: What so ever you need  it is here.

name: K Bookman
text: Professional  and excellent customer service.

name: Neila B
text: They Have almost everything you need . a few out of the employees i have asked for help finding something act as if they didnt here me and then took their time  when they chose to get up and help.

name: LaToya Mayweather
text: Always pleased.

name: victoria cawthon
text: good selection

name: Chris Walker
text: Ok

name: Elli Maye
text: Horrible service. I bought a gift certificate less than a week ago, and while the cashier happily took my money, she never informed me the store was closing. That would have been common decency and obviously too much to ask. My mother received an email today of the store closing, and went right away to use her gift certificate, and there is hardly any inventory left. What IS left is what most have left on the shelves for a reason. They will not refund any money, and stated it was the rules as per the back of the certificate. I believe a better rule should be that you don't sell gift certificates to uninformed customers right before you close the store. I understand she can order from online or from another store (and now have to pay shipping), but to not inform your customers that you are closing as they buy a gift certificate days before you close is just plain rude and no way to do business. Shame on you. No wonder you are closing.

name: Kim Tannehill
text: Horrible that we drove from Madison to this location for my mom to get one thing and they up and closed 15 minutes early.  Actually caught a worker locking up and she did not care one bit! Pretty lousy customer service. I used to be a manager and work in customer service and if that was me I would even stay late to help a paying customer! Guess Athens location will be the one getting our business! She claimed they closed at 5:30 now? Well anytime one of my locations open times changed I always made sure online times were changed, because in this day and age that where people find your business times, location, phone number, etc.

name: Allyson Monday
text: The WORST customer service I have ever experienced! Marty has a fine way of making people feel unwelcomed in this store. Feeling threatened while shopping is not what I had on my agenda today.

name: Candice Klien
text: I have been a regular customer here for years and realize there are many other companies I support too for cosmetics. I am an Avon rep too so it is kind of counter to what I "should be doing" endorsing them. But I like the staff and the store.  Decent product I've used for years. Brand loyal.

name: joan folsom
text: Can't say enough for this Cosmetic Shop; great products & professional assistance!  Standing ready to meet the needs of their clientiele!  Luv this store!

name: Roger Wilson
text: People lied about Merle Norman discontinuing my wifes products and found out was not true.  Will drive all the way to Guntersville to shop at Merle Norman there.

name: Chris Jones
text: My family was charged twice for a single ear piercing service because of a malfunction with the piercing gun on both of our three month old daughters ears. When we first decided to file a complaint with management at this location we never heard anything back from the store owner Belinda McCulley. When we finally made contact with her one month after leaving numerous voicemails and she outright told us we were to blame for the malfunction of their piercing gun because I didn't hold my 3 month old child's head still while Marty, the store clerk performed the service. I am HIGHLY disappointed by the lack of customer service and outright non-caring attitude I received from Mrs. McCulley. How can she say that we, the customers, are to blame for something she didn't even witness, and then dismiss it as if it never even happened. The Outcome:  We were charged the additional $50 for a second set of $15 CZ earrings and they have no intention of returning our money.  In short, I would never treat one of my customers in this manner and therefore will not recommend this store or their services to any friends or family members. You might as well allow a 15 year old kid at the mall to pierce your childs ears, you will get better customer service....  not to mention save yourself a few dollars.

name: Jamie Martin
text: Great customer service.

name: Jain Train
text: My beauty/brow expert was Katherine. She was wonderful. She hooked me up with a wax and a tint and an easy product in my price range to help keep them flawless. This is sincerely the best brow job I have ever had. My husband told me I *have* to see her specifically every time. I feel so confident with my pretty brows! Also, she was so professional, kind, and knowledgeable. She kept it light-hearted and kept an interesting conversation going. There was never an awkward or uncomfortable silence like I have experienced so many times in the past. Seriously, go see Katherine!

name: Brianna Judd
text: I absolutely love this location! I came in a couple days ago and the girl Brandi there was so determined to help me find the products that I needed! She recommended every single item that fit my description perfectly and I love the products I bought so far all because she took her time with me while I was being a little difficult haha! She kept every ounce of her patience and thoroughly met my accommodations. Would recommend customers to her!

name: Consuela Colburn
text: They are always helpful. Always have what ever I need in store.  Yes I would shop more if they were not so pricey but the people are great friendly in all departments.

name: Terri Hilgenberg
text: I love shopping at Ulta. All of their staff are friendly and so helpful too. I guess this is why I have been a Platinum member for so many years. For every dollar spent, I rack up points  and at times I receive 5X points for each dollar spent. On my birthday I receive 2 gifts and a $10 off coupon my next purchase.  This Christmas I had enough points saved up that were worth $70 along with a coupon for 20% off total purchase. I bought around $100 for my daughter's Christmas gifts she picked out from Ulta and only had to pay $21 +change.  I think that's pretty awesome.  I also get my hair done at Ulta. I love Jackie at the salon and now I will not go anywhere else.  She has highlighted and taken care of my hair better than anyone else I've ever gone to. I highly recommend Ulta and their salon to others.  Very Satisfied Customer, Terri

name: Madison Anderson
text: Manager and Associate held me up at checkout saying I couldn’t use my coupon. They said it excluded the brand I was purchasing... however, the fine print didn’t exclude it. Then they said I didn’t even have the right status to be getting that coupon... They also said I needed to buy more to get the coupon to work which was not true. After being told no more than 3 times, they finally scanned it (something they should’ve done from the get-go) and it worked. Manager was not nice and actually seemed upset when it worked. The whole ordeal was embarrassing and took up time, which was not necessary. They need to listen to their customers and not be so proud when wrong.

resp.text: We are sad to hear that you had a negative experience at our Tuscaloosa store. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention as we are always wanting to create a better shopping experience for you. This feedback will be shared to ensure better visits in the future. Thank you.

name: Pam Partridge
text: The staff is always friendly and eager to help you find what you are looking for.

name: kenlyn white
text: Went there today and had a great experience! Staff members were Very nice. We were greeted at the door and then two employees asked if we needed help finding anything. Cash register ran nice and fast even with a long line. 10/10 would recommend going! 🙃

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
You ladies and men that work at Ulta in Tuscaloosa have ALWAYS treated me so well and have helped me any time I needed it. I wanted to leave a new review bc I have been particularly impressed at how great you ALL have performed during these difficult days we are in, due to Covid-19. Shopping in-store, I do feel safe as is possible, so I do appreciate y'all for putting in so much extra work and effort- IT SHOWS! THANK YOU for being there when many other stores didn't even try to open in the beginning of the "reopen stage." (and YES, I understand why some did not- no issue with that)
Playing around with makeup is an outlet for me because I'm already stuck in the house 95% of the time anyway, due to an illness. So I am EXTREMELY APPRECIATIVE that you all have chosen to come (back) to work. The curbside pick-up option has been such a great thing to do. You all have been so nice and friendly to me and I wish you the very best and PLEASE CONTINUE TO STAY SAFE and take care of yourselves! THANKS AGAIN! -Amanda

name: Crimson Ledbetter
text: I love Ulta in general but this is specifically for their Salon. I went to the salon for the very first time. Jackie was the woman who cut my hair. Let me tell you, she did such an incredible job. And by the first five minutes, I felt like I’ve been going to her for years. She is so sweet and so talkative. She’ll explain everything she’s doing and answer any of your questions. She’s truly so good. She transformed my dry, damaged long hair to this beautiful, luscious, and hydrated bob. Perfect. I already scheduled a dye-job with her for the following week.

name: Erika Crespo
text: Drove to this location from columbus even though I live 5 minutes from the location in columbus. Parking was easy. Customer service was exceptional. Elle went above and beyond to help me find exactly what I was looking for. Thank you Elle!

name: Heather Donovan
text: Nicole @ Chanel is who you need see - PERIOD.

name: Rachel Bagley
text: Joann is the best person I’ve ever been to for anything with my hair. I’ve had a cut and a color with her now, and I would recommend her to anyone! The rest of the team were very helpful and kind, from the moment I walked in to the time I checked out.

name: Kristen Smith
text: Staff was extremely helpful. I wish I remembered the name of who helped me. He went in the back to make sure they were out of stock and I complimented his makeup. Very nice person. Will definitely be going again!!

name: General Rage
text: Very helpful and friendly

name: Alev Guven
text: I love this place. Staff are also so helpful. I just went there today and a staff, her name was Tonya, helped us a lot and she was so nice. Whenever i go there I will definitely see her and get her suggestions about products. Whatever you asked her about any products  she just takes that products and applies on you and shows you how it works. My four stars go to Tonya and one star goes to the store.

name: Andrea Garcia
text: The cashier that checked me out tonight was the worst. She was the second to last associate on the cash register. Absolutely awful customer service. Never would’ve known it was such an inconvenience to do your job with a good attitude. I’ll be shopping online from now on.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your visit, Andrea. We always want our guests to feel welcomed and valued each time they shop with us, so we're truly sorry to hear this about your visit. We appreciate your honest feedback as it allows us to improve and create better shopping experiences for you. If you have additional comments or concerns, please email us at gethelp@ulta.com.

name: Caine Chaffin (Lysergic Casserole)
text: Used to be a great place to shop for men's grooming supplies. Now, instead of an actual men's section where you can go to pick out what you want and only have to hunt an associate if you can't find what you need, everything is scattered all over the store, seemingly to hide that they've removed over half their men's care products. Out of the 5 or 6 products I would regularly buy in there, they now carry zero. If you're an introvert that just likes to be able to grab what you need and leave, this is definitely no longer the store for you. The layout now seems to be set up to force you to ask for help. At least I still have Amazon. Millennials aren't killing stores, poor layout design and poor customer experiences are. This shop is dead proof of that.

name: Christie Watson
text: Store is very hard to maneuver around in.

resp.text: Hi Christie, We always want our guests to feel comfortable when they shop with us, so we're sorry to hear this about your visit. We truly appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve service in the future.

name: California21
text: I went in last night to choose some makeup pallets and upon entering the store there were 3 employee standing on the floor. Not one of them greeted me said "Hello welcome to Ulta" or asked if I needed help or anything they all were very smug and continued there conversations. This location has to be the most dirty Ulta that I have ever been in. ALL testers were filthy and not wiped down, the inside and outside of the pallets are just nasty smashed ,crushed and messed over. The outside of the pallets have all kinds of mess on them obviously they dont maintain them. Also a lot of the pallets were not even properly attached to the display  barley touching it it fell off... touch the pallet next to it.. they both fall off.. especially in the Tart cosmetics section it was a mess. All of the lip sticks were smashed and running down the jar it did not look sanitary or properly maintained. If you did take a sample or a swotch of a color there were no wipes to clean your hands ex.. the clean up sections were not properly stocked. The isles were unorganized and had products on the floor in the hair care area. Make up storage boxed that are $60 + strung out on the floor with brushes and what not. The entire time I was in the store not one employee greeted or asked if I needed help finding anything they were very unwelcoming and uninviting and had a dont bother me vibe.  I will not be returning to this location of Ulta beauty.  I go to the location in River chase and theres is perfect friendly, clean and welcoming so I know what to expect from the franchise.  Midtown village location is not hitting the mark. Also the store needs a good airing out because the perfume testing smells were so over powering it hit me like a truck the second I entered the store. It was distracting and over whelming how it felt stuffy as if there is no air circulation in the store and smelled of stale perfume samples all mixed together with thick air. Which the other Ulta locations I have visited do not have this problem. The store did  not have a clean sleek environment that Ulta is known for. Non of the products were properly fronted on the shelf for easy and clear access. I had to keep checking to make sure the correct pallet was sitting in the proper spot and most of the time they were not. Everything was jumbled around not in its proper place not properly fronted for easy viewing. At the end of it all the store was such a mess I just left. Will not return to this Ulta.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed by your visit with us. We're always looking to improve our services, so we appreciate your honest feedback. Please email us at gethelp@ulta.com with more details so we can connect with you further about your concerns.

name: Kellan Hyde
text: super great if you want to buy up all of an item to resell it for more money than it's worth online, not super great if you're just trying to be a normal customer.

name: Raychelle Ivie
text: Went in to look for 3 things. And of this three things they had 1. There items were ulta beauty items so nothing that should have been hard to find. Instead of the employee trying to help me find the item she asked me if I needed help but in a confrontational way, like the thought I was stealing. I was taken back by the attitude so I told her no, that they did not seem to have what I needed. As I kept looking through the store she purposely inserted herself in my way, walking in between me and the item I was looking at, talking to someone standing on the other side of me. I left without buying anything since I felt so berated by the employee.i might never go back. *Note went to saphora after and was helped by a great employee and got everything I needed. I will not go back to Ulta for sure now.

resp.text: Hi Raychelle! We are sad to hear that you had a negative experience at our Tuscaloosa store. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention as we are always wanting to create a better shopping experience for you. This feedback will be shared to ensure better visits in the future. Thank you.

name: Brookes Vlogs
text: I love coming to this place!! Staff is super friendly, professional, and their stylists are amazing! Customer for life! Just had my daughters hair cut and colored. Fantastic job!

name: Janene Woods
text: Everyone is very friendly and I enjoy shopping at this store.  They were out of both cosmetics I went in to get.  My biggest complaint is the employees taking up all the front parking.  I got there prior to opening and had to park way down.  Most stores make employees park away to let customers have decent parking.

name: Megan Searcy
text: I visited this store for the first time in years and wanted to look for some wishlist items. Like 5 employees approached me at different times asking if I needed help. I can understand that since checking on customers is their job. However, 2 employees approached me at the same time while I was looking at Bare Minerals. They asked if I needed help, and I said I was looking at wishlist items. Then they asked me if I used Too Faced and which of their products I used (I know they were trying to push that Too Faced event happening then). I was annoyed because they just stood there while I was looking like they were being pushy. I just wanted to shop without being bothered every second.

name: Melody Kernan
text: Sara is always super kind and professional!!

name: Brittany Turner
text:
TERRIBLE SERVICE. I had previously given this location 3 stars, but I was obviously way too generous. It is so difficult to get any help, and when you finally track down an employee they act like it’s a huge inconvenience to answer any questions. The cashiers are so rude and always act as though it is beneath them to help customers. This location also never honors the gifts with purchase promotions. I went in today to get matched for foundation. I was not helped or even acknowledged for that matter. I spent the gift card I was given for my birthday and I will NOT
spend any more money here. I have given this Ulta location so many chances. I’ll be a Sephora customer from now on.

name: Gwendolyn Greyer
text: Love this place, I could walk around in there for hours!!

name: Maria Juno
text: Wide selection of products but never anyone around to answer questions.  When you do luck up and find someone, they either don’t work that department or they aren’t very friendly.  Prices are too high also.  Can order most items online at half the cost or less from somewhere else.  Will only shop here if I need something I don’t want to wait for, but I dread having to shop here.

name: Patricia Dunkin
text: Went in for touch up to my roots and to gets foils so that I would have more brown color. My regular stylist was out sick, so had to use someone else. NEVER AGAIN!! She colored all of my hair instead of touching up my roots and foiling in the brown like I asked. She also did not pay attention to how long she left the color on, as she went on to cut someone else's hair while coloring mine, never set a timer and ran around like crazy the entire time. She was very pleasant and friendly, just does not listen to what the customer wants at all.

name: David Battles
text: The ultimate hair experience!

name: Alexis Dragon
text: Smell so good !!! Thanks Miss Cat

name: Brian etc
text: Great place to shop a constant variety of supplies you can choose from

name: Amber Barnes
text: Great customer service during the hectic Christmas season!

name: Julie Tompkins
text: Great store, well stocked and has great knowledgeable staff.

name: Sami Barry
text: Has a great selection, but there is rarely anyone on the floor that you can ask questions of, and many of the employees do not have the background to answer more advanced questions about may of the products.

name: Kayla K
text: Super helpful beauty techs as soon as you walk through the door!

name: Bad News Gary Brown
text: High quality perfumes and things .

name: Brittany Turner
text: The store has great products, but unfortunately has terrible service. The cashiers are always rude. So disappointing.

name: Steven Hodo
text:
I am very upset with Ulta.  After standing in one of their very long lines, they offered me a months subscription to Glamour and Allure magazine.  I signed up and received a magazine for each.  After said month I had a charge on my account for Glamour magazine where they had automatically debited my account.  I called Glamour who refunded my amount and stopped the subscription.  I told them I had never given them my credit card, and how did they have my card number.  The rep advised me when I signed up for my free month that Ulta transferred my credit card number over (which they failed to clarify) and it was something I authorized when signing up.
Very dissatisfied with Ulta!!

name: Jordan Lagrone
text: Got some great makeup half off!!

name: Rene' Howell
text: Great selection and plenty of products to sample

name: Kim Mosley
text: I love this place, the products, the staff. Every visit is an experience..m

name: Lilly G
text: While I was at the register talking to the cashier abt my item she in the middle of me talking started talking to another employee who was walking out the door abt dropping off some stuff for her and I'm just standing there waiting with a whole long line of customer behind me with her as the only cashier! Oh and to top it off when I asked to speak to the manager abt my product issues she cut be off and didn't let me explain my problem to him. Rude customer service!

name: Meredith Hawkins
text: Drugstore makeup with a few pricier brands including Benefit, Tarte, Amazing Cosmetics, Cargo, Smashbox, Stila, Too Faced, Lorac and Urban Decay. Also has hair products, toiletries and fragrances. Hard to sample things. Overall disappointing.

name: Beth Lindly
text: This store has helpful staff and almost always has the makeup that I need.

name: Denise Lowe
text: My favorite place

name: S. Thompson
text: Not too polite their not consistent with the hospitality they speak to some and ignore the others

name: Delilah Antionette
text: The worse ulta I've ever been to. The sales associates have terrible eyebrows.

name: Tracy Tondola
text: Awesome!

name: Elizabeth Malone House
text: Well organized, nice, friendly staff

name: Kimberly Anne Latham
text: Great products great staff

name: Lisa Bailey
text: I shop at a lot of Ulta stores. The Tuscaloosa store is dirty and the staff are selective in who they help.

name: Austin Jordan
text: Beautiful workers

name: April Cannon
text: Favorite store ever!

name: David Vaught
text: Rude management.

name: Ryan Kirkley
text: Love this store.

name: Jeff Jones
text: Great products

name: Happy Lady
text: Service is not good.

name: Trecarya Mitchell
text:
I dropped a prescription off at 8:34pm on yesterday.  The system told me it would be ready 7:34 this morning. I went to pick it up,  and I was told it wasn't ready.  I just called back to get info on pickup.  They told me I couldn't have it ready by 12 unless I come wait in the store for an hour.  They entered it twice which slowed it down.  They made the error.  Why wouldn't you accommodate me? I shouldn't have to make
three trips to pick up one prescription.  I definitely plan to file a complaint with the company.

name: Angel Reyes Tarafa
text: Pharmacy needs to get organized,  I when a week with out my heart  medication

name: Michelle Howard
text: THIS IS THE WORST PHARMACY EVER!! They take forever to do anything.. Takes them days to fill anything.. drive-thru is ridiculous.. I hate this Walgreens with a fiery passion.. get your medicine filled somewhere else.. they also 9/10 times never have the medication but you’ll wait over an hour to get to the window in store and twice as long in the drive-thru.. this place is a joke

name: Matthew Potenza
text: Pharmacy and photo. No stars. Do not recommend .

name: Dorothy Wright
text: I love the convenience of being able to get over counter medicine quickly plus prescription meds as well

name: WonderWoman 1986
text: They sometimes have nice staff but they never fill medicine on time, it's an absurd time frame all the time, medicine is literally never ready. Lucky to get the 3 stars from me, it's only bc I'm friendly

name: keron Batson
text: Instead of serving customers in the Drive-thru, workers are shopping and and talking to each other. While I’m sitting at the window for over 30 minutes with no one even bothering to attend to me.

name: Victoria Edwards
text: I can't stand how long it takes this place to fill medications. It does not matter if it's called in at opening you probably can not get it to your hands til that night. They should read these reviews and hire additional staff.

name: Tammy Phillips
text: The most rudest Pharmacy I've ever seen.  Takes hours to get someone to even answer phone.  Then the pharmacist talks to you HORRIBLE.  Will never go back there.

name: Shay Rodriguez
text: Never fill your medication on time. Even after you get a email notification, go to get it and it isn't there, and go again. The wait is 45 mins minimum in line to even get to the window. This is the worst pharmacy I've ever used.

name: Kountry_bow_ Keith
text: Good place for a  squatted truck meet

name: Randal Roberts
text: Absolutely absurd how long it takes to receive servicr via the pharmacy drive through. I'm guessing it's a staffing issue. It's unfortunate, because the remainder of the store is a pleasant experience.

name: Melissa Taylor
text: They have the worse pharmacy I have ever had to deal with they never answer the phone they are extremely slow. Bye taking my business to Walmart.

name: Jessica Hill
text:
The line in side today August 10th is extremely long , the lady that's working the widow with the brown hair rather stand and wait on drive  thru . There
was no one at drive-thru she just standing there waiting on cars to drive up LoL

name: Ashley Johnson
text: Worst pharmacy between Columbus and Phenix City. I can never get through to the Pharmacy. They never answer their phones.

name: Shakeidra Logan
text: The absolute worst! Every time you call, the wait is over 25 minutes and they just hang up! And the express line is a joke. You have to wait in the (always) long line with everyone. Most of the techs ignore you and have casual conversations, but look at you like you made them choose the career.

name: Christine Edgar
text: I always have great customer service. Yes I have to wait at the pharmacy but I already know that I will have to do this. It’s a busy place.

name: Toni Michelle
text: Terrible customer service. I was left waiting an hour past my pick up time for my card I ordered. All because the girl working there never printed it. And then couldn’t even find it once it was printed and it’s now 10pm might I note.. I’m extremely aggravated. The store is not busy so why am I still waiting such a long time for one little birthday card ?? She was not prompt. She was not apologetic. She is not an asset to that company at all. And it’s because of piss poor employees like herself that I will spend my money else where and tell everyone I know to do the same! Quality customer care really does go a long way. And they just don’t have any.

name: Kayleigh Bowers
text: On hold for 25 minutes, then hung up on. Called back, spoke to someone who transferred me somewhere else only to be hung up on again. Called back a third time, on hold for 10 minutes before someone picked up. They transferred me to someone else who transferred me to a never ending ringing phone which eventually hung up on me again. Absolutely useless customer service.

name: Effie Carrington
text: Wish there were less stars.  Don't know what to think of a store which will accept a call, tell caller there are 2 calls in advance of you, then one 1 call in advance of you, then keep you on hold for 25 minutes, 26 seconds, and HANG UP ON YOU.  Trying to find out about a prescription that I was to have available at noon today, it now being nearly 7:00 pm.

name: Christopher Williams
text:
Worst pharmacist and customer service I have ever dealt with. My wife had surgery and we dropped off 5 prescription slips at around  1645 We were told it would be ready at 1830.

We went to the store at 1830 we were told that they had not been filled any of the prescription and to have a seat, 30 min later they said there was an issue with one of medications and they would have to call the doctor in order to fill the pain medication. I provided them the doctor number which they didn't call, I left the store and got ahold of the doctor who inturn called the store. After talking with the store he then called back at 2032 and said that everything was straightened out and that they would fill the prescription. Went back to the store at at 2103 they had asked if we could come back in 15 min that they just got off the phone with the Doctor (which was a false statement they had gotten off the phone around 30 to 40 min prior). Finally got the pain prescription around 2133. The surgery was over at 1200 and was able to take first pain meds at 2140. Every interaction I had with them they acted as if did not care. When I asked questions they seems extremely bothered and annoyed that I would even inquire on what the issue was. I just hope that another consumer doesn't have to go through what we went through.

I would STRONGLY recommend not using this walgreens to get a prescription filled especially if you are counting on them for customer service (a caring attitude and a quick filling of a prescription). It is truly just the employees that work in the pharmacy.(I was not the only person that was struggling with getting medication, I witnessed two our families having issues as well).

To be fair the rest of the store clerks I worked with were extremely helpful and polite. I normally don't make comments but it was so bad I really hope nobody else has to go through this type of treatment.

name: Christina Clayton
text: Every single time I am in here it takes entirely too long. The staff either needs to be trained to be more productive in a faster time or they need more employees on hand. Either way, having to wait in line for over 20 minutes is absurd. Not to mention we already tried to come earlier in the day and left because the line was so backed up then too.

name: Lori Verga
text: Love this place! Every team member does exceptional work and truly cares about customers.

name: ZULK THE GREAT
text: Pharmacy is very very very slow!

name: A Colwell
text: Jacob in the pharmacy is great! I needed a prescription for my son and another pharmacy dropped the ball on it after having it for a week. Then I found out that they couldn't even get it. I called Walgreens to transfer the prescription and see if they could get the item for me. Jacob was very nice, helpful, and kept me informed. He got everything transferred quickly, was able to locate the item, and it even came in the next day.

name: Kristie Robb
text: Terrible customer service. Pharmacy is a joke (wasn’t waiting on a prescription). Just wanted some allergy meds & the line was half way across the store. They expect you to wait in that line just to get some simple Allegra D. They need more pharmacy help if that’s the way they sell regular allergy meds.

name: Deborah Watkins
text: Don’t fill when they tell you a time

name: Michael Mitchum
text: If you are getting your medicine filled here and need them to call and get your prescription transferred save yourself the trouble and don't. The employees seem to not care about the patients and only care about themselves. I spoke with Kelly and she is very condescending with me and made it seem like she was doing me a favor by trying to call to get my prescription instead of it being her job.

name: lorrie taylor
text: Switched to this pharmacy to keep from having to go to the one I normally go to in Eufaula, they are very helpful when you have questions, great customer service and open 24 hrs and they will let you know when busy times are so you don't have to wait, unlike Eufaula pharmacy you wait every time, I will do the drive to get the professional service

name: Angelica Leadabrand
text: I'm giving this Walgreen's location five stars because of the extremely helpful & courtous employees.  I go to this Walgreen's 1-3 times per week when I just need to "pick up a few things" & don't want to deal with the hassle of a big store.  I cannot recall a time when I have not been greeted by an employee as I enter the front door.  Employees always ask if I need assistance when they notice me looking around for something.  Not only will they walk with me to the item's location, but they will assist me to the cosmetics counter where they will ring up my items without me having to wait in line at the main register.  That being said, it is obvious that whoever manages this store puts customer satisfaction first & does an excellent job at instilling that belief in their employees.

name: Mrs Cricket
text:
I started at the drive thru and after waiting in line I find out there was an insurance problem. The gentleman working the drive thru didn't know what the details were so I went inside and stood in line to figure out the problem. After clearing things up with the insurance, I then had to wait for the prescription. They called out my name but then I had to wait in line again. Finally at checkout when they needed my id that it is naturally in the car. At this point I'm just done; I leave. 3 hours and no prescription. Yes I could have gotten my id and waiting again but I chose not to. They were under staffed and it was now peak time.

The prescription was dropped off and given a pickup time. It wasn't ready. I believe because of the insurance problem but I'm guessing because it was never said. A simple phone call could have helped this situation.

name: ryan 1981
text: It's hard to believe the positive reviews. They called our elderly family member who can't do for her self anymore. She can't talk like she used to so we have power of attorney. Walgreens has had no trouble in telling about her medicine for the past year now. Now all a sudden they refuse to talk to us about her medicine saying it violates her hippa privacy when they have been talking to us for over a year. They are just harassing us and throwing us around. This walgreens has bad customer service.

name: Lit Kit10
text: I've always enjoyed my experience here. It's always quick and efficient!

name: Kayleigh Saal
text: Got a call saying my prescription would be ready at 3:15. Got here at 3:40 and was told it was not ready. She told me it would be ready in 15 minutes , it's 4:30 and the person in front of me got there prescription before mine. I've been waiting 45 minutes for a prescription that would have been ready over an hour ago. I am highly unstatified with how poorly this pharamacy is ran. They have lost my business for sure.

name: Robert Schumaker
text: All Walgreens are pretty much the same. What makes this store stand out is it's staff. They are excellent!

name: A.T. Robinson (365atr)
text: The store itself might be ok, but that Pharmacy Department is completely incompetent. They never call when they whole up your medication. Said they had a question for me, I was sick to the bone. I said you guys never called, strike 1. Now I'm here right now months after the first incident and the lady Fri had said they couldn't give refills, I said that's fine fill it as it is and I'll call in a new one. Now 4 days later I get here and they never filled it, said they tried to contact me, never did. Tired of them, goodbye and good luck.

Like I was suppose to get off work and skip school so he didn't have to deal with the problem not only the pharmacy was facing to fill the RX but I was facing as well. He made me really upset. I decided to call the dr instead and found out she did have a refill. Go by there today (3 days later) so they can get it ready and we can pick it up on the way back home only to find out they have to order it so it will be 3 days until they get it. Had they answered the phone this wouldn't be an issue. Called another Walgreens to see if we can have it transferred they also didn't have it which is understandable, but atleast they answer their phone and offered to order it. Now we are trying to find a compounding pharmacy so they can mix her meds because she has to have them so she won't be in pain. Im definitely switching pharmacies. I had saw friends post about driving up there while witing on someone to pick the line up and still be on the phone waiting when they got there. I honestly thought they were exaggerating. name: Olcay Ciftci
text: Shopping at Walgreens is like playing a gamble. You find a good deal and clip the coupon. Then, you see the item is available at the nearest store. You order it and wait for pick up, but then you get an email which shows the item is not available at the store. You want to purchase the same item from another Walgreens store or online, but you realize the system assumes you used the coupon and doesn't offer the same coupon. I had this issue several times. Once, one of my orders was canceled because of the same reason, but I saw the product at the shelf in the same day. Walgreens's online system has a lot of problems. Waste of time!

name: Nathan Floyd
text: TOTALLY Agree about just kids working there and being jerks.  I came in at 11:55pm, not because I wanted to, but because I was having an allergic reaction to some medication and needed benadryl. I mistakenly thought they were open 24 hours. Some young blond manager jerk caught me coming in the door and said, "Just so you know, we close in 5 minutes. I mean, I guess you can come in if you need something but you need to leave quickly."  Then, he proceeded to follow me around the store about 15 feet away; not to help find what I needed, but to either act like I was going to steal or rush me out. He followed me all the way back to the register and sat there sighing until I could leave. I will literally never give that Walgreens another penny.

name: Isabel Aleman
text: Avoid this Walgreens!!! The employees were so rude when I asked a simple question about printing pictures. I first asked the woman working the register at the photo center and she was short with me and got the manager. The manager came back and was snarky from the start and when I asked my question again about printing photos she did not attempt to help me and was being rude without cause. We are never coming back to this Walgreens again.

text: This pharmacy at this Walgreens has the worst service I’ve ever experienced. Not only are they excruciatingly slow, but they have literally given me the wrong medicines that belonged to someone else. They have told me on several occasions that my medicine was not in yet, but when I say “my doctor said she sent it in” they respond with “oh yeah here it is”. Not sure how that makes sense. The staff is also rude. One time I was talking in the drive through and she just hung up the phone and walked away. So I proceeded to go inside and speak to the pharmacist. If I could describe this Walgreens with two words they would be careless and negligent.

text: I have never seen a pharmacy tech treat a customer so poorly. The pharmacist did not bother to turn around and address the tech’s behavior and after “helping” me the tech turned around to another tech and made fun of me in clear line of site. There is no reason anyone working in the medical industry should treat a patient/customer with such poor manners and outright disrespect. I will never return to this location and will be working on changing my insurance so that I never have to return to another Walgreens store. (Publix, here I come!) As someone that has worked as a pharmacy tech and is currently in school to become a pharmacist myself I cannot imagine how this behavior could be seen as acceptable and believe that someone in charge should have addressed it as soon as it began. So disappointed in the entire interaction.

name: Carl Klimah
text:
READ BOTTOM LINE AT END if you don't want to read this paragraph.

I have had mixed experiences at this store. The STORE part is fine.

The PHARMACY is another story. I have had mixed experiences with them, from some pharmacists being competent and outstanding, to some being downright rude and dumb. I tutored/ taught organic chemistry when I was an undergrad and have had many arguments with them over medication. I have had them get my dosages wrong many times (telling me to take to much). On top of this many times they treated me like I was a criminal for trying to get medicines with no street value. Other times those medicines that did have street value, were handed over to me like candy. Some of the employees also were not aware of basic pharmacy policy, upon which I had to remind them of. Needless to say many of them can be rude when you question there blatant incompetence.

BOTTOM LINE: go during peak hours. Know what and how much to take. Then double check when you get home. Remain calm through the rudeness or plan on taking your business else where.

I hope by using my phone now my photos won't be lost.   I have another order if the pictures I sent goes through .  I might have to go to another source.

name: Gabrielle Griffith
text: I was on a family vacation and had to refill a medication I forgot at home. After ringing up I was informed that a prescription had raised from a $0 co-pay to $100. This came as a big shock and my mind was wheeling with trying to figure out how to afford that each month. The staff at the pharmacy informed me to call my insurance and make sure something was not incorrect and were very patient while I did so. This was all happening at the end of their shift. The new co-pay was the correct amount and luckily my family was able to help cover the cost. Fast forward to a few days later and I received a phone call from Walgreens patient care. The pharmacy staff had contacted them on my behalf to enroll me in to a co-pay assistance program through the medication manufacture. The new total monthly cost would be $20! They also applied the discount to the original refill and I was able to give my family back the money I had borrowed to cover the medication. I am truly thankful to the staff at the Fort Payne, AL location for all the help and kindness they showed an out-of-towner. Walgreens will always have my business.

This Fenty foundation was the first thing I have purchased from this location in years so I knew for a fact that I didn’t buy it and just forgot. It also showed that I “bought” this right around the time when I actually got the Fenty foundation. The cashier rang up the wrong item when she checked it out now I am unable to make any returns or exchanges with this item and was basically told there’s nothing they could do because it’s not the product that’s on the receipt. Now I’m stuck with a 40 dollar foundation that I cannot wear because the cashier made a mistake.

text: I was very unhappy and put off on my visit to Sephora located at JC Penney in Prattville, Alabama. I had to return a foundation powder by KatVonDee due to the change of formulating. Her response most of the time was she did not know what to tell me, there was nothing she could do, didn't know what I wanted her to do. I finally asked if there was a comparable brand, she did bring some from 1 other collection but it was not the same coverage. My daughter finally suggested swatching my old one (which I had with me, although broken) on my wrist and then the new KatVonDee's to see which was the closest. That worked and I made the exchange. Due to the way she nearly rolled her eyes out loud, her complete lack of caring, and making me feel less because I don't wear a lot of makeup, I will be quicker to use Walmart from now on.

name: S Wyatt
text: If there was a minus zero I would put 32° below zero as that is how I was treated. I AM NOT PREJUDICE but I want to ID exactly who treated me so poorly in the event there are other employees working there so they will not be identified by this review. 1st, I have Systemic Lupus and in very bad health. Most of my hair is almost gone (Alopecia Areata) but I have a resource for a $500.00 scholarship to fund for a natural hair wig or Cranial prosthesis.  The Asian man told me RELUCTANTLY that if I bought a wig cap that I could try on up to 4 wigs. Then because I didn't find a real hair one that suited me, I asked to try synthetic ones in style and color of my  desirous purchase  (all of which could be made to order) he refused to allow me to try on ANYTHING and I was told that this is not for browsing but for purchasers only. I had my daughter with me with a 7g credit card and could have spent every cent IF I CHOSE but was not allowed to even touch. I wasn't even ashamed of how I was treated for myself but for him, I was appalled. We were clean, decently dressed and sincerely interested in several products. I  knew my long hair looked shabby and was getting it cut the next day so it was really important to have access to anything to help with the natural grief anyone who loses all their lashes, brows, scalp hair etc. experiences. Vanity? Yes, but the way we were treated was unconscionable.  Skin care is an issue so no makeup but no rashes or anything to contaminate his inventory. He simply judged by my appearance and all but ushered us out the door. I may be weak physically, I may be unwell, but I, nor ANYONE ELSE deserves to be treated so very unprofessional and unkindly. God help this man and I pray he is never on the other side of this ENCOUNTER.  SHAME ON YOU.  SHAME ON YOU! IF YOU TAKE DOWN THIS POST I WILL POST IT IN NEWSPAPER IF I HAVE TO PURCHASE A FULL PAGE AD. GOD BLESS YOU AND KEEP YOU FROM ALL SICKNESS AND DISEASE, ESPECIALLY THE ONE OF PREJUDICE.

text:
This is just another typical CVS and there's nothing particularly good about it.  Customer service isn't great and at the front they won't help you unless you ask for something specific.

These type of stores all have the same thing in common and that is pricing everything in the store as if the whole world has their goofy card.  That way when you try to check out with no card you get hit with a ridiculous total.  So, I just don't even go anymore.  Would have rather had a  restaurant or something else built here in this spot.

text: Your 4 for $10 Coke drinks is misleading. Look at it however you choose but the drinks cost me $12 not the $10 as advertised.  So I get a $2 reward bucks toward my next purchase. If I never shop at CVS again, where is my savings?  Probably will not shop at your establishment again.

name: Robert Broome
text:
Although some of the staff are professionals, for the most part this has got to be poorest excuse for a pharmacy it has been my misfortune to stumble across.

In 11 months i have not been able to pick up my prescriptions in a single visit.  Not once.  I have received an excuse every single time ranging from the pharmacy tech left the insulin out of the refrigerator and it is ruined to being told it is ready only to find out it has to be ordered.

Tonight I asked to speak to the pharmacist due to their latest screw up only to get hung up on.   Then the little phone jockey calls back and just holds the phone line open without saying anything.

They get one star ONLY because I can’t give a negative raiting.

I will not be back .. my insurance money and copay can be spent somewhere else.

I came in for cosmetics because the store in Athens where I live acted like it was an issue when I returned some products with my receipt! I noticed right off the bat that all their Covergirl cosmetics were nice & neat. At home they were all out of order & just not stocked properly. The reason I know these were placed correctly was because they were out of a shade I wanted so I thumbed through the other rows. Not only was the store nice & clean, Timothy was very nice & greeted me as I walked in & asked if I needed any help. This store needs to show the CVS in Athens how to treat their customers & how to keep their merchandise stocked right! Good job 👍

Kim

text: We were required by insurance to switch to CVS only for prescriptions. After always having pleasant experiences at Walgreens, I was appalled at the lack of courteous and friendly workers in the pharmacy with the exception of Devonte who is always willing to help.  The pharmacist is horribly rude. I called in a prescription and he informed me he was busy but would try to get it done.  The following evening I went to check and he had never done it nor had he left a note for the pharmacist who was working to do it.  This was after calling over a dozen times and no one would answer the pharmacy phone.  FINALLY this guy answered and then didn't even bother.  All of my other prescriptions have taken way too long to fill.  My new thyroid medicine was called in by my doctor on a Friday morning.  I received a text (if you don't sign up for text you'll never get any communication out of them) saying it would be Monday evening before I could get it.  Again...after calling literally all day to try to find out what was going on, I got through and was told they didn't have enough to fill my order.  There was no offer to let me get a partial prescription until they received the rest.  Heaven forbid this pharmacist have to fill it twice in order to get a customer the meds they need.  By far the worst customer service I have ever witnessed. I'm amazed this is allowed. Shame on you CVS for not having more staff and for not getting a pharmacist with compassion and an ounce of kindness.

name: patton fussell
text:
I wouldn’t return here if you paid me $1 million dollars. The pharmacist, MILES HARDING is horribly rude. He refused to fill a prescription for my fiancé because her prescription was from Cleveland, Tn. Keep in mind the CVS down the street filled her other prescriptions, but they were out of stock for this particular medicine. She has extreme anxiety and it is crucial for her medical regiment. Furthermore, it’s not even a class two substance. It was simply your standard anti anxiety medicine.

I called MILES HARDING and he told me that, “I’m a pharmacist in Alabama and can fill whatever prescriptions I want.” We just moved to Huntsville this month, so she has not found a primary physician, therefore had to drive to Cleveland today. The prescription was written today, but because of the time difference, the doctor was closed. Shouldn’t have made a bit of difference. He didn’t ask questions, he simply refused for absolutely no reason. SAVE YOURSELF a HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE and STAY AWAY.

WALGREENS filled it and were nice as could be.

name: Amanda Young
text: I have had to block the number for this particular CVS because they literally call every freaking day to ask if I want to refill my prescription. This is after I asked them multiple times to take me off the automatic call list to inform me that my prescription needs to be refilled. So they took me off that list and now the pharmacist/tech calls everyday. It’s ridiculous! How about you just let your customers call and refill their own prescription when they have run out?? The people who work there are really nice but the constant calling makes me want to switch pharmacies.

name: Heather Webster
text: Best deals and really nice staff in the pharmacy and in the front! Very obviously understaffed, but mad props to the staff for still always being so positive, even under stress!

name: Shayla Smitten
text: Just unprofessional. Personal opinion though.

name: Julia Cade
text: Went to the pharmacy today, looking for a particular sinus medicine that was recommended by a friend. The two people there, were unhelpful and unpleasant. Maybe, I just didn't look the part. I was very disappointed and went immediately to CVS inside of Target. They were wonderful there.

name: Nick
text: I have no opinion of the general store, however; if you are looking for a new pharmacy- RUN AWAY! This is by far the worst pharmacy I have ever used. 1-4 weeks on any prescription order, constant “mixups” where they call/text saying they have your medicine ready and then you get there and they’re like “oh we don’t have anything on this computer screen I just clicked on for 20 minutes, sorry it must’ve been a mixup” Constant incompetence and disappointment.

name: Deborah Hunsucker
text: Their new hours are horrible. Went this morning before work closed. Stopped by after work closed. Really what do you do when people need medicine. It would be nice if you would post the proper hours on the website and drive thru.

name: George Winters
text: Pharmacists and technicians have always been friendly, helpful and responsive. Very good pharmacy.

name: Hannah Balsmeyer
text: The pharmacy staff is always amazing!

name: Angela Walker
text: Normally very good service. They always seem to be busy, but I usually drop my scripts off and pick up later.

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: Great place to run into and get medicine if you need it

name: George Howard
text: Excellent service and a very well stocked, and clean store.

name: Marcus Worthington
text: Wouldn't go back

name: Ashley H
text: Takes too long to get a prescription. Never going here again.

name: Kimberly Ferguson
text: Worst Pharmacist! I will never go back! She was unprofessional and rude. I reported her on Twitter.

name: Kevin Pulliam
text: Convenient location

name: Simeon
text: Had a prescription for some iron supplements, took 4 hours to get prescription....

name: Kevin Colin
text: I loved shopping here and its my go to every time. The manager was a great help and I was able to find things easily. Loved the deals I get from my CVS card and altough something cost more than I would have liked its a convenience store so can't really complain about that. Overall my favorite place to shop when it comes to daily use things and I love the variety of things they sell.

name: Caterpillar C
text: amazing place to go! the manager Lisa was a great help!

name: Javier Z
text: wonderful service and very well kept up! def would go again

name: Xavier Le
text: It was super over priced for the cheapest of things. After I went to Walmart and it was so much cheaper there I don't think ill be going again.

name: George William
text: Horrible customer service. I found deodorant marked down on the shelf. The product name matched, the SKU number matched. The cashier said it was full price. I said it was marked down. She said it was probably a misplaced item. Goodbye CVS, hello Walgreens. I expect to see this store vacant soon.

name: Hannah Hudson
text: Saw a product online, and the website said it was available in this store. I went in the store and they said they didn't carry it, they refused to look up the item in their system. I worked at CVS, and I know you're capable of looking up an item, and the database will at the very least tell you what stores it's in stock at. Either the cashiers are either horribly undertrained or don't care enough to put in a little bit of effort. And the manager was conveniently unavailable

name: Robert Evans
text: I would shop here more if they didn't make you feel like you had to have one of their product discount cards to get any good deals.  I just want to be able to come in get their best price and leave. I don't want to have to keep up with a card just so they can track my purchases. I now just visit Walgreens just up the street.

name: glenn bond
text: 25 minutes on hold

name: Nee nee
text: Nice

name: Crystal Dawn
text: Wonderfull

name: Victoria Howell
text: Lauren was so friendly and down to earth! She made sure my hair looked exactly how I wanted it! She made accommodations for my son when I couldn’t find a babysitter and was so sweet to him! She even took the time to message me a few days later to make sure it was still looking good.(which it was) I HIGHLY recommend her! She was quick, professional, accurate, and personable! I loved the whole experience and will definitely be back to see her!!!!

name: Jillian Edwards
text: First time visiting. Will definitely be returning. Jennie Lynn knew exactly what I needed for hair.... TLC!

name: Juliann Winfree
text: Jennilynn does a great job with my fashion colors. The salon is beautiful and always clean.

name: Melissa Ray
text: This review is long overdue. I've been going to Andi for like five or six years. I've left the country, come back, left the country, come back again and every time I'm here, I see her. She is so talented with color. And she's gentle, which is great because I'm really tender headed. I don't find her prices to be too much because you absolutely get what you pay for!

name: Donna Davis
text: TL is a great hair salon. The atmosphere is very nice and relaxing. The staff are very nice and friendly. They will work in walk-ins very quickly. The location is excellent. I've always gotten great cuts and color. I love TL Signature Salon and recommend it highly.

name: Tami Day
text: TL Signature Salon is the best in town!! My hair has never looked so good. The staff is always very friendly. They are up on all the latest styles and trends. TL Salon is located in Midtown so it is very convenient. I will never go anywhere else. LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

name: Elisabeth Ashworth
text: I LOVE this salon! Everyone is so friendly and professional and the salon is stylish and clean. Andi is AMAZING! Her hair skills are definitely the best in Tuscaloosa. I agree the salon is pricey but, you pay for quality!

name: Derek Rice
text: First time visiting. Will definitely be returning. Service was great, was immediately greeted. Jennielynn cut my hair and did a fantastic job. 5/5

name: Chosen Property Solutions
text: Wish they had an ATM machine. Good business though!

name: Julie Dabit
text: Jessica is awesome at my hi-lites, color and cut, it's just a little over priced! I continue to go though cause it was hard to find someone I liked!

name: Durham Davis
text: This salon is amazing! Talented and friendly staff with a great result everytime. And, now, conveniently located!!

name: Ben Hardin

text: Staff not very friendly. Rushed through everything. Color looked awful. Currently getting it fixed elsewhere.

name: ً

name: A B
text: I never use the pharmacy here. I stop in to avoid the grocery store when I need an item here and there. Always clean, well stocked and the front cashier is on point.

name: tim jeter
