text: Was waiting behind a car before 7, and they were taking their sweet time. Guess they decided to close the pharmacy drive thru after that car even though I’d been waiting. This pharmacy can’t even keep medications in stock to fill scripts. Maybe I should find a new pharmacy..

name: Brian Dothan
text:
Great pharmacy. They have excellent customer service and are problem solvers.

Been a loyal customer for 9 years

name: Shirley Coker
text: They always have what I need when I go shopping there. Thank You too the friendly staff

name: DV8
text: When a pharmacy can't fill scripts . pathetic .

name: Tiffany Rowell
text: The lady behind the counter rolled her eyes at me the whole time I was there. I was a new customer and only needed amoxicillin. She was rude, crass and completely unprofessional. I will never go to a Walgreens again.

name: Brandon Cook
text: I typically only use the pharmacy. Most of the staff in the pharmacy are very helpful and courteous but sometimes the turn around times on getting my prescriptions filled are a little unreasonable. The convenient location to where I live and certainly the polite employees most of all keep me coming back.

name: Trisha Hardy
text: Most of the pharmacy staff is fine. One guy that works there is so rude. Every time I have to speak to him he seems like I’m wasting his time. He does not act as though he cares to help. I’ve had to deal with him numerous times and he’s ALWAYS incredibly rude.

name: Rory “Cassandra” Moore
text: This is my Walgreens. :)  I shop here for everything as I love to coupon shop and get the best deal for my buck. The only thing I do not recommend is their pharmacy. It takes too long to get your prescription. I used them for 5 years and recently switched to another pharmacy for prescriptions because when I drop off and come back 4 or 5 hours later I shouldn't have to wait again to pick up. But I use their photo processing and shop there at least 2 days a week for bargains.

name: Christine Oglesby (Gadgetgirl)
text: This is my favorite Walgreens. Things are easy to find and everyone is so nice.

name: Kati Miller
text: I couldn't find what I was looking for and had to search for assistance which would have been fine if I hadn't come across two employees who avoided eye contact and walked by me even after trying to stop them. I found two more employees who were stocking end caps and asked for help after they had finished speaking to each other about what sounded like a personal matter and one told me that they had no idea where said item was and suggested I ask the manager. She points to the person she was talking to and said that he was the manager and walked away. I approached this "manager" who was kneeling down by a shelf. He did not stop working to answer my question nor did he even look at me and advised me to ask the pharmacy what I needed. I glanced around for a second and after not seeing the pharmacy sign I asked him where it was and he responded by pointing a finger in the general direction of its location and said it was "over there in the corner." He didn't even look up from the shelf. Will never go back thanks to the poor service and lack of interest I received.

name: james johnson
text: Helpful courtious quick in and out.

name: hadarosa
text: Most of the pharmacy staff is super nice except for one guy who treated my mother in a  condescending way (she was only asking about an over-the-counter medication)

name: The Hammerdown
text: I just simply love Walgreens!

name: Kelly Maguire
text: Very friendly staff !

name: Rodney Hamm
text: Dropped off RX today at 3:30pm was told it would be ready at 4:pm  at 6:25 I am still waiting!

name: John Long
text: Clean Store Alert!!!!

name: Jacob Atkins
text: Amazing selection of products. Staff is very kind and patient and helped me find exactly what I needed. :)

name: Chanda Mitchell
text: Anytime my hair needs a little TLC I just head to this store. The salesgirls really know their beauty products and I am always have with what they help me purchase.

name: Tammy Price
text: Nice staff.

name: Nancy Davis
text:
Daphne was so helpful when it came to pickng my new makeup for the holiday season's coming up!
Thank you Daphne , you're awesome and thank you Sally's!

name: Leslie Hahn
text: The staff was very knowledgeable about the products. Very helpful. I feel very comfortable with the advice given to me. Will definitely go back and recommend this place to others.

name: ShaNiethia Johnson
text: I have only had positive experiences at this location. The staff is helpful and arr very knowledgeable about the products!

name: Vance Torres
text: They don't have any threding. Probably cause it's mainly used by black females... We had to go to green springs to get it. Ridiculous. Then they say they never get it in.

name: Kimberly Willis
text: This is the second time I have went to this location, and both times I was disappointed. The staff are very RUDE, and do not offer to help you find a product at all. I looked at several hair products, and asked an associate about whether or not the store carried a particular brand. She stated, "No", then walked off. Later, while still browsing, I found that they did have products from this brand. Either she plain out didn't care, or does not know this store's products. Horrible location. Will not go here again.

name: Celestial Collection
text: Happy they are in madison but they are  always out of what I need or they dont have enough supplies stocked up and open late and close randomly throughout the day.

name: Tammie Stroud

name: Isatu Isatu
text: They only sell hair products No extension. I wish I knew that before driving here. But the inside is very clean and organize just wish they sell extensions.

name: Alex Reed

name: danielle cronin

name: PJ Sanders
text: Meridianville Alabama CVS has the best pharmacy workers I have ever met and worked with. I love each and every one of them. They greet me by name and are always willing to go out of their way for me and that has been many times with insurance problems. They always find the cheapest route without me even asking. I will always use them until they retire or move to different pharmacy. I suggest using this pharmacy because they will go ABOVE AND BEYOND for all your needs. Mary Gardner

name: J C
text: Okay but if you want great service go to Publix Pharmacy across the street or Hazel Green Pharmacy about 2 miles north.

name: Nick Burgess
text: I'm really diggin CVS,.. it's a mix between drug store & convenient store with everything in between. Nice employees

name: Michael Owens
text: I needed my very important medication called and asked if someone would be there to let me pick it up at 8:15 if not I’d send someone to get it on time .. I was told yes sir I’ll be here I will get you taken care of !!!!!!! Well I arrive at 8:08 and no one is available to help me now I’m going home with out this medication that was very much needed for the safety of my health !! Lady who ever you are I pray you never have to go through What I’m going through tonight and tomorrow .........

name: Alley
text: Nice, friendly and professional.

name: Jessica W
text: Friendly staff and opened another register fast when the line was backed up.

name: newlaty72
text: Pharmacy closes at 6pm on Saturday even though the store itself is open until 9pm

name: Jeffery Watkins
text: Consistently forget multiple prescriptions when picking up!! Make sure to check everything before you leave.  Forget to even fill all of your prescriptions.  Pharmacist accepts no responsibility for mix ups.

name: casey quillen
text: They do their best to be helpful. In most cases they are correct. Hair is not always a perfect science. There are plenty of times it is a judgement call and without seeing the hair in question they can not be sure of the proper chemical reaction.

name: Cindy Wright
text: Very nice employees

name: Abby Askew

name: Yung J
text: @Sallys on Cox Creek Blvd, I needed multiple things for my mother who is disabled but still wants to do her hair and nails and the most beautiful pink haired little employee helped me get everything on my mothers list!! I was verryyy pleased by the customer service and my mother is Verrryyy pleased with her products, I may need to stop by again soon.☺️

name: Katherine Elliotte
text: The employee was very nice. She helps me find the hair care product that I needed. She offered advice and instructions on how to use the products. Overall she was very very helpful. Great experience and great customer service.

name: Jakaeli Poole
text: Amazing customer service

name: Dalton O'Steen
text: First time visiting Sally Beauty. The sales associate was very helpful in finding what I was looking for.

name: Roger Coats
text: Had hair color my wife wanted and answered questions cheerfully

name: Cassie Mcmurtrey
text: I love this store!!!

name: Deirdre Howard
text: The  service is above board; the employees are very knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Keith W
text: If you care anything about your health, finances and sanity you will find another pharmacy. Please do not give Walgreens your business. I have had so many bad experiences with this particular location. For example:  a stolen debit card, incorrect quantities of prescriptions (supposed to receive 60 pills in a bottle, but only 45 were in there.) They charged my insurance company for triple the quantity of another prescription. Dishonesty, rudeness, and incompetence pretty much sums up Walgreen's Pharmacies. From what I hear every location in the Montgomery area is like this. Run!!

name: Constance Burke
text: Friendly staff with a surprisingly wide options of goods and services. Pharmacy can be slow so pick slow traffic hours if possible.

name: DeAnna Sexton
text: The drive thru is terrible. 30 minute wait with one car ahead. Everytime!!!!

name: Ashley Warren
text: I have been in the drive thru for twenty-seven minutes. This pharmacy has an incredibly S-L-O-W drive thru. I may expire here. (Now twenty-eight minutes.)

name: Debbie Hernandez
text: I placed an order online for curbside pickup for only TWO items. I have been waiting and currently still waiting on my order. I will never place an order online again. I only did this for two items that were gifts to a child for their birthday. They are extremely slow at this location.

name: Bee Bee
text: Normally this location is average for pharmacy waits and competency but they keep changing the hours. It used to be a 24 hr pharmacy, then it changed to 7am-11pm, covid hit and it went to 9am-9pm, about 2 weeks ago it was 7am-11pm again, and now it's back to 9am-9pm... I wish they would go back to 24 hr but I'd settle on 7-11 as I prefer early morning or late evening pick ups as I live 30 minutes away and don't like dealing with loads of traffic to get to town...

name: Scott Braswell
text: Awesome women working the pharmacy they are fast & friendly and usually will put a smile on your face. I highly recommend shopping here!!!

name: Charlar Barnes
text: The staff at the photo area was extremely unprofessional. The staff was rude and provided poor customer service. I decided to take my business to another store.

name: Crystal Reynolds
text: This is the slowest pharmacy I've ever been to in my life! I spent more time waiting inside on my prescription than I did in the emergency room. They never seemed to be adequately staffed for the volume at this location. Them being 24 hrs is the only advantage. I'll be filling my prescriptions elsewhere from now on.

name: M Jackson
text: The Pharmacy wait is extremely too long and the staff don't recognize the people at the window because the always short staff.. the window wait is way too long and this is at night . Understanding that they are tired and ready to go home

name: Viridiana Zambrano
text: Worst Pharmacy, Ghetto came two days in a row to pick up my medication didn't have it ready then have the nerve to get a attitude. Not coming back.

name: Alexis Parker
text: The blonde girl that works there was awesome 👏🏻 she really helped me & was fast!

name: Tim Babb
text: Pharmacy tech was to lazy to go check to see if they had what I needed in stock. She took my script and said they should have it and that it would be an hour and a half wait. An hour and a half later I come back and I’m informed that it wasn’t in stock.

name: Jessica Palmer
text: Terrible customer service. No one else is waiting yet I’m here for 45 minutes with a sick child.

name: Sherwanda Foster
text: I didn't go in with my daughter for this transaction but the staff must be efficient and on point. My very particular daughter went in to make a return and was immediately back to the car with no qualms which is rare for her.  The parking lot was buzzing at the time.

name: Brick Pappi
text: Dropped off prescription at 6 pm and I left without my prescription at 11:10 pm. These people at Walgreens Pharmacy on brown springs road are the most ignorant people ever. Why are the standards so low for pharmacist , techs , and other positions within the pharmacy ? They feel completely comfortable being disrespectful to customers because management doesn’t hold employees accountable at Walgreens.  If I could give negative stars I would give a negative -20. WALGREENS IS AND WILL ALWAYS WILL BE THE PHARMACY THAT EMPLOYS THE MOST IGNORANT OF PEOPLE. THIS REVIEW IS ONLY THE FIRST STEP.

name: Maya Smith (MayaPapaya)
text: This location overall is probably at a B- rating. It's mainly because of the pharmacy. They are extremely slow and don't have medications in stock. They also aren't helpful when it comes to verifying the prescriptions with your doctor's offices or insurances. They send you to do the foot work. I went just last night to fill a prescription for my 11 yr old who had surgery that day. He had to have his elbow reset and a pin put in it. I was told it would take 20 mins tops to get his pain medication. I spent over an hour there with him in pain along with my other 2 children who are 6 yrs old. Came to the pharmacy at a quarter to 10p, left there at 5 mins to 11p! The few times I have to get medications from there, I always have to deal with an issue, whether it be insurance issues, the medications aren't there, they need the doctor to verify, they can't see or find something in the system, etc. Just always something! SMH, if they worked on the pharmacy, it'd be an A+ store.

name: Madison Monte
text: I had an excellent experience here. It was timely and well executed. The pharmacist was simply kind and answered my questions accurately.

name: Sonya Briggs
text: ZERO STARS...Terrible pharmacy experience and this is the last time I use this Walgreens pharmacy. Lady was so very rude. My meds were emailed to pharmacy by 11 am and it is 7:30 pm and I still do not have them.

name: Cindy Green
text: Drive through service nearly non existent.

name: Stephen Pierce
text: The employees are very helpful. However, I now use Adam's Drugs! Much better. 😀

name: Amanda Cook
text: TERRIBLE service at the pharmacy. We tried to use their location because our child had an issue after regular hours on a Sunday and our regular pharmacy was closed. There was a blonde at the drive thru window with a tattoo on her arm who had a TERRIBLE attitude. She tried to make us go inside to present our prescription (after waiting in the drive-thru for 20 minutes) and we explained to her that we were dropping off, she said it would be 2 hours wait for a simple common antibiotic (no mixing - just pills). We left the prescription and told them we'd just have to come back the next day, it was late and the kids needed to get to bed. I understand they were busy, but when we arrived back the next day they had NO RECORD of our child in the system, they had lost the physical prescription I handed to her the night before, and they pretended like we were the crazy ones and nothing was wrong. We had to call the Drs office and get them to send the Rx to our regular pharmacy. Thank goodness our child had an antibiotic shot at the Drs office that was already working or I really would have been put out. If I could give zero stars, I would.

name: Jasper Riax
text: I've waited 45 minutes for one prescription I filled 3 hours ago. They've told me to pull around TWICE because the pharmacist has to "check it" this is the worst pharmacy I've ever been to.

name: Michelle S
text:
Give me a break
Call - Is my RX ready for pickup
Walgreens- yes
Get to drive thru
27 minutes later.....
Can I help you....

If this is your standard. Close your drive thru. Your service is abysmal.

name: Katie Grimes Rotton
text: It would be nice if there an actual phone number that would make it easier to call instead of looking through several sites to get a real (LOCAL) phone number with a real person.  Just remember, every time a business uses automatic phone menus and online applications, someone loses their job, money for school, their insurance (health and life), and probably their house.

name: UnbiasedReport
text: No reason why I should be up so late, but I am to do this review. Customer service in the pharmacy is non existent. At 11:10 PM I turned in my prescription, was not met with kindness, and treated even worse when I told the pharmacist that I did not have health insurance. She told me it would be about 15 to 20 minutes before my prescription was ready. I asked her where did I need to go or did I need to just come back? She said well you can't sit here. You can drive over there and wait. I did so and in turn while I was waiting fell asleep. I just happened to wake up and looked at my clock and it read Midnight. I was literally across from the window. I proceeded to call and find out what was the hold up with my prescription because I did not receive a text message alert stating that it was ready. The automated system told me that I had a prescription ready.  upset at this point I went to the window and I told the lady that no one told me my prescription was ready. In turn she told me that the girl tried to wave me down. I was directly across from the window asleep in the car or as far as she could have assumed was dead from just sitting there. She had no concern at all. They have my number on file and did not use it. Nor was I sent a text message letting me know that my prescription was ready. She the pharmacist then asked if I wanted instructions instead of volunteering the instructions. I did not answer from being so upset that my time was wasted. I will not be going back. I will let others know that this Pharmacy is at the corner of rude and rude.

name: Kids' Videos
text: Good products but their prices are very high. You can get the same over the counter products cheaper at walmart or Amazon. They are always crowded and extremely slow at filling the prescriptions.

name: Christina Buntyn
text: I called to ask a question of the pharmacy staff, and I waited 28 minutes before they answered my call. I have also been in the store before and seen first hand that they ignored the ringing phones. I will be using a independent pharmacy from now on!

name: [C]
text: Went into Walgreens around 9:00 ISH to pick up some aloe vera. Went through the line and it was no problem. I came back because I had forgot something, and I noticed the cashier asked this white female for a donation (She did donate, I think), and when she left I went through the line... And she didn't ask me; she wasn't saying anything, but she said a lot with that action #100 Get your workers together George (Or is it Georgie)

name: Codey Cherry
text: Convenient place for prescription refills and house hold items.

name: Vegans Rock
text:
We ARE now beginning the process of seeking a more formal resolutions.....however-- THIS Atlanta Hwy, Montgomery AL pharmacy staff INCLUDING THE PHARMACY MANAGER- JOE S. have single-handedly created the worst customer service experience of our lifetime.  We honestly advise no one with additional options to patronize with this store if your goal is to seek even a mediocre level of professionalism.
- from dispensing the incorrect patient's medications
- EXTREMELY rude staff pharmacist and pharmacist managers
- omitting the correct medications
- charging customers for the incorrect medications

TRY AN ALTERNATE PUBLIX PHARMACY  (or Rite-Aide deliver)

if all else fells, become a chemist and mix your own drug therapy because NO ONE should PAY a retail store to be treated with hostility

name: Erica Sanders
text: Worst service ever in the pharmacy I changed my location and I'm willing to drive across town to get my prescription just to avoid this place hate I had to give it one star. Customer service is not a priority at this location

name: Lamar Jackson
text: Our visit tonight was spotless. 15 minute wait for meds.

name: Trey Taunton
text: Mike the Pharmacist is kind and informative. I would go no where else!

name: Del Chick
text: Pharmacy is too busy, lousy customer service!!!     Store MGR Frank, however is excellent.

name: Tawny Wyatt
text: This place is very good at consistency... they are very consistently horrible. I hate to even give them ONE star. Every prescription we've ever had to get filled here is always late- like over an hour when your doctor has called it in the day before, OR they click on their keyboard and tell you that they have received nothing from your doctor, when you know that they have. We have also had them call us to tell us that a prescription was ready, only to get there, and they tell us that it is backordered and out of stock. The techs are extremely rude- I've witnessed eye-rolls and dramatic sighs (not just at myself but also other patients), and they don't seem to be very efficient at their jobs. The ONLY reason we EVER use this place is because they are the only 24-hour pharmacy in the area. If it weren't for that, we would never ever return our business here.

name: K
text: I have been using this pharmacy for several years. I have had just a few minor negative experiences during this time. Most of the time I was comfortable with the service. Today was a different story. I called about an hour before they closed to finalize 2 scrip. orders. I called at this time because I had tried several times in the past week and today to get thru to someone on the phone, but had too long of a hold time each time. I thought it might be less busy at 7pm. The woman who answered, who I believe was the pharmacist on duty, had a disrespectful tone a couple of times during the call. I mentally excused her then drove to pick up my orders almost immediately. When I arrived the assistant, who was one of the distasteful encounters I've witnessed in the past, was working the drive thru. I told her I needed the pills cut in the required dose which I'd gotten done many times before without problems. It usually doesn't take very long to do as well. I went to wait across the lot when I saw a multitude of cars arriving at the drive thru right before closing time. 15 or so minutes had elapsed and it was closing time by that time so I decided to drive back over to the window to pick up my meds. When I arrived the tech ignored me for about a minute or 2 and then she mouthed something to me without the microphone and immediately walked away out of my sight. I could not make out what she said, of course. I continued to wait patiently. Within that time the pharmacist walked over and in a scolding tone told me to tell her ahead of time I needed them cut. I informed her I did not because I was informed in the past not to do that because I must pay for them before they are cut. She then continued her scolding by telling me "Well it's just so late." Omg...are you not still open for business when I arrived 15 to 20 minutes prior? And it doesn't take that long to cut them. And I would of done it sooner if I could of gotten someone on the telephone without a long hold time every time I called! That response was rude, unprofessional and unfair and I did nothing wrong. How dare her and that tech or whatever she is treat a good customer this way. I have always been fair and courteous to the staff. I have already found another pharmacy and will pull my business out of there tomorrow. Thanks for reading) Hope this helps!

name: matthew Mccullough
text:
Everytime I use the automatic phone serrvice to order refills, there is always a problem and at least one isn't filled and I have to wait for them to fill it or have to come back!!! On Wednesday August 24, 2017, I called automatic phone service to order my desvenlafaxine and the recording said "we recently tried to call you to see if you wanted your armodafinil  its due to be refilled" I said yes, so it was to be ready after 11am that day. I got to the pharmacy and they said that I didn't have anything!!! I told her what I had ordered so she said I'll get it fixed, it will take a few minutes! When it was ready, she said she only had part of meds in stock and would have to order it!!!! I took the partial prescriptions and left. Thursday I called and asked were the meds in and the lady said yes. I got there and only one was available. When I questioned her about the other medication she said it didn't come in. That night I called and spoke with a lady and asked her what time my meds would be there, cause I was going to Florida at 9am the following medicine, she said it would be after 10am. I told her I was leaving to go to Florida at 9am the next day. I then asked "why is it taking so long after you ordered it to come in? She said it's because it's a narcotic. So I went on to Florida. Now I had already received 5 pills, and you would think that they would have been on the look out for it!!!!!! so when I got home Monday I went to Walgreens to pick up meds, GUESS WHAT?????? NO MEDS!!!!!!!!! She had not explanation on invoice of why meds did not come in!!!!! And now I'm being told it will be in tomorrow.....we'll see!!!!!!!
Update: I called to check to see if my medicine came in and the lady said no it still hasn't come in!!!!!! She said I'm going to give it one more day...I interrupted her and said tomorrow makes a week since you first ordered it and she said "it's because it's a narcotic (?)!!!!! I'm not a dummy, I don't know what they are doing but I will be changing pharmacies!!!!!!!

name: brynn perry
text:
Joseph Witten, the store manager of the Inverness location seriously needs customer service retraining and corporate intervention.
I purchased an item online and was sent the wrong thing and  went to this store to return it. Mr. Witten  was rude from the start. When I explained about the return he cut me off with a terse "calm down."  Had he let me finish he would have known that I wanted to see if they carried the actual item I wanted and I could do an exchange. However, I never got that far because Joe followed up with more mature declarations of  "it's not my fault you got the wrong thing" and "I didn't do it". So now I am just looking  wide-eyed and gape-mouthed at this pudgy man getting all worked up over a return for SKIN MOISTURIZER.  Mind you,  the item was unopened, still in the original packaging, with the receipt and was within the return period and this guy is giving off all kinds of micro-aggressive vibes like I have done something wrong. I felt super uncomfortable as the store was full of people who could all hear this man lose his composure over a return.  He asks for my driver's license TWICE  which I understand if a receipt is not present but again, I had a valid receipt. When he  finally gets around to processing the return Joe gives me a CVS Gift card and tells me it's a money card. I have never returned anything to CVS before so when I ask him how to use it he admits that it can only be redeemed at CVS.  I point blank ask him why he didn't process the refund per the original method of payment  (my bank card) he smirks at me and says "alright, alright, I said I would take care of it."  He then processes the return to my card but botches the transaction and ends up having to give me a partial cash refund.
I will NEVER, EVER, EVER  go to CVS again! It is my opinion that Mr. Witten  needs to be terminated  but at the very least he needs some time away from that store to undergo re-training. As long as he is employed with the organization they will not get one dime of my money. I transferred my prescriptions to Walgreens the next day.

name: Douglas Stephens

name: Max Gannondorf
text: I legit don't think they know how to answer the phone. I've tried 3 times on 3 different days. After 7-10 minutes of waiting for someone to answer I just gave up each time. And they are jerks when you go in too. I just need to know if they have a medication.

name: Christina McClellan
text: Absolutely terrible service. We had a doctor call in a prescription we needed that night. Gave it an hour after it was supposed to be ready just to make sure it would be ready. Drive up, they have "Lost" the prescription, then miraculously "found it" then said it would be 15 minutes to fill it. 25 minutes later it was ready, but then they didn't want to check us out yet. One hour later they decided to finally process the insurance because they wanted to serve other people before even entering in the insurance information into the computer, making our total wait time over an hour.

name: Crystal Burke
text: I will NEVER order photos from this CVS again. Ive placed orders online for pickup at the Inverness store#4864 on several isolated instances. And every time, they "do not have the toner in to print". I took a chance recently and was told the same bs. They didn't even call me to let me know that their was an issue. But I knew better and called before heading there. I hate them so much. They really need to do away with their photo department all together.

name: Randell Hill
text: Absolutely horrible. The drive thru needs to get their act together. I was told 30 minutes.... I had to call from the parking lot to make sure that they had the correct phone number. 30 minutes later I drove back through the drive-thru and asked if was ready...."I'm sorry didn't you get a text "? I was there 45 to 50 minutes total  and didn't get a text for another 20 minutes after I had left. Unbelievable.

name: Gail Thomas
text:
Went to pick up a prescription that I thought was filled at Winn Dixie, Inverness not realizing that the pharmacy had closed and my prescription was transferred to the CVS in Inverness.  When my husband went to CVS, he was told that it was $122 for 90 days instead of the $10 for 90 days at Winn Dixie.  The pharmacist told my husband that the medication wasn't even covered.  We had it transferred to our store, the Rite Aid on Valleydale Road and the cost was $11.00 for 90 days.  These people tried to rip us off.
Beware!!

name: matthew george
text:
I have been a loyal customer of CVS for many years. I started  night shift several months ago so I need to use a 24 pharmacy when I get off work. I drove past several 24 hour pharmacies to use the Inverness store.
Last month the pharmacist on duty said the didn't have enough medication in stock to fill my prescription. Tonight, a month later, I dropped in and was told the same thing.
I wound up going back to a store I had passed up to get my prescription filled.
What good is it to have a store operating 24 hours they fail to stock medication.
Is anyone held responsible for failing to provide customer service or do they have so many customers they don't care?

name: Nameless Faceless
text: Nice and helpful staff. Long lines and wait times, but that's to be expected with a chain pharmacy. They're understaffed.

name: austin Haskew
text: Always helpful and don't give you a hard time with certain meds but also very busy

name: Steven B.
text: Found what I needed and the staff was helpful.

name: Jim Stack
text: Would not sell me psuedophed because I lived in different zip code. Well I am sick in your damn zip code.

name: Ben Stanton
text: Made an international call to this pharmacy for photo printing. Very unhelpful and rude phone service.

name: Brian Meadors
text: The pharmacy staff is, overall, helpful.

name: Qüeen Kay
text: TERRIBLE customer service , kept following us like we were criminals . Made me give the lashes back just because i didn’t want them anymore, saying he was going to put them back in the right place when i ALREADY did & every one was in WITHOUT masks even the EMPLOYEES. If i could rate this a 0 i would!!

name: Marjorie Allen
text: Real nice

name: Sherri Lynn
text:
Very nice store! Nice selection of products & a friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, staff.
I'll definitely be back for all my beauty needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much.

name: C Harris
text: Very friendly atmosphere. Nice variety of products. Me and my wife really enjoyed the shopping experience

name: P. Harris
text: Wonderful selection of different wigs and weave🙌🙌🙌🙌🙌

name: samantha carter
text: Every thing you need in one place. Clean and friendly staff

resp.text: Thank you. You are friendly customer.

name: Kieys j
text: Nice selection on hair

name: Tammy Thomas
text: Good Service!

name: Jacob Chad
text: I drove from Hoover to get my vaccination here, Cheryl the pharmacist made me feel like family as I'm not good getting shots. Chris(maybe I spelled wrong) was also amazing and friendly. The manager Kassandra up front and Paula were also a delight! I'm driving back for my second vaccination and also plan on doing so just to shop. I'd rather drive farther and receive this kind of AMAZING customer service than close to home with none! You've got GEMS at this location!!!

name: Dru Martinez
text: I love the people who work in the pharmacy. I have used the pharmacy for about two years now and they are always professional and friendly. I took my 12 year old (who hates injections) to get her flu shot and the pharmacist was so kind, taking time to make sure that she felt comfortable. This season my daughter suggested that it was time for us to go to Walgreens and get our flu shots! Time after time they treat you like you are their most important customer!

name: Joann Bailey
text: Pharmacists are absolutely the best!  They go above and beyond your expectations. Other employees are always friendly and the store is very clean.

name: Yancey Del Rio
text: Everyone is so nice and go out of their way to please you!  Pharmacy is fantastic!

name: H.W Zhang
text: Love This Store! The Service In This Store Are Amazing, The Shift Leader Ms.Paula She Is The BEST! Thank You!!

name: Terri Walton
text: The pharmacist at this location go above and beyond for their customers. I have never waited more than 10 minutes to pick up a prescription, even if it was just called in. Their friendliness and customer service has made us customers if this pharmacy for more than 10 years.

name: Speakman28
text: The manager gave my wife her coupon credit even though it expired the day before. This store makes my wife happy and that makes me happy. She loves this store and the products. 👍

name: Taylor Justine
text: Only place in marshall co you can find quality hair/facial products. The staff are also very friendly & helpful. So excited to finally have an Ulta! Yay❣️

name: Mar Tina
text: Went in to find my daughter a good skin care line and even though they were really busy the manager Rachel took the time to help us find one that will work for her. Definitely recommend

name: Ralph Westmoreland
text: Client

name: Mary Mack
text: Slowly loosing faith. Calling up here to take care of any issues? Completely impossible I can never talk to anyone. I understand being short staffed and I don’t mind waiting but I always get hung up on. Needed a prescription for a sick child requested quicker pick up because we absolutely couldn’t want. Waited paid the quoted time and still got told an hour and half wait time… pharmacist came over and told me it would be just a minute but I had to wait in the line again with a screaming child. Because going home without this isn’t an option. So have officially spent over an hour waiting. Please just don’t lie. Be honest.

name: Kathy I
text: Walgreens, is another one of my favorites, when it involves Charlie Brown and the Peanuts gang.

name: A. Fabian Portela
text: Whatever you do, do not order from doordash. I say again don't order anything from Walgreens through doordash. They're too lazy to update their items. It seemed like 90% of the items I chose they didn't have it and they had to call me or email me to ask me what else I wanted besides the original item I chose. I'm sure they're going to blame covid.

name: Katie Miller
text: I had a covid test taken here. Well a few days later while waiting on my results they didn’t give me the proper information to log on to view my results. I called them and they apologized but they couldn’t find any of the numbers or information that I needed to view them...they seem very unorganized and I don’t trust the pharmacy because how can you give a test but forget to give the login result information or code to enter in?

name: Shelley Flynt Bradley
text: We love that Walgreens stays open later than the other drug stores.  They quality products, yet they are a tad pricey.  Still, its the only drug store I use.

name: Donna Dew
text: Quick and good customer service

name: Lashay Gibson
text: they have some good deal and the hours r good they close at midnight

name: jamilah b
text: I went in to grab something the other night. I made sure to check their hours before I left my house. No one updated their hours online, so I was greeted with a notice saying they were closed when I got to the door. It didn’t say when they would open or any new hours and it still hasn’t been updated online. Very frustrating.

name: Andrew Phillips
text: Ordered a canvas Friday online. Pick up was set for Sunday @ 8:00am. I called at 9:00 to ask if it was ready. They told me yea! I went at 1:00 and the lady couldn’t find it, called someone else to the front, she said it never printed but she would print it now. After 3 tries she says something is wrong with the printer, and it’s not going to work. She seemed to have no idea what she was doing. I asked her if I call back later, would someone be able to tell me if it was actually ready this time, or would I waist another trip up here? She told me I could just cancel my order. So I did... Went to Walmart and they printed my canvas right then and there.

name: April Renfro
text: Tried to pick up my daughters refill (which she was emailed a reminder) I gave the info to Jennifer at the drive thru window she not so politely informed the insurance was denied bc she’s not eligible until April 21. I explained this is a refill so that didn’t make sense it was just a 30 day supply. Jennifer was very rude not offering to assist in the situation at hand. She kept saying I don’t know what you want me to do. I said maybe someone made a mistake and keyed it in incorrectly that I am the one that picked it up and verified what it was. She continued to talk over me and tell me maybe it was misplaced. I assured her it wasn’t she first told me she didn’t see any record of my daughter EVER filling a prescription at that location ( she has been filling there for over a year) after insisted she told me it was filled in February and a 90 days supply again I tried to explain she continued to talk over me and be very very rude would not help me at all. I explained people make mistakes she stated “Not here we would be fired so maybe you misplaced it” I tried calling the store after I left to speak to the manager about my experience and was left on hold for several minutes and put on hold again I hung up and left this review.

name: A Person
text: Very Selective, open! Waits are very minimal

name: Corey Bell
text: Only had one employee at the checkout line.. Made for a strangely long wait for a slow time of day. The single employee did go through the line fairly quickly though. Store seemed to have quite a bit of items on sale. You could probably find a few good deals in there if you are a smart shopper.

name: Just Flea
text: This is the BEST pharmacy. The folks here go out of their way to help their customers.

name: Mercedes Klebba
text: Two stars only because I was given the correct medication. However the medication which was prescribed went through so many hands and no one caught the dosage error. After calling and speaking to the pharmacist nothing was done or said about the error and I was given a very rude and curt answer back. I am from out of state and I feel as though this was completely unacceptable as this medication was for a thin 6 year old child. If the medication was given at the dosage which was written on the bottle then he would have ended up with more severe symptoms then he had been to the ER with in the first place. I can guarantee if I come up to Daleville again I will never go to this Walgreens.

name: Kimberly F
text: Prices tend to be a bit higher, but it's open 24/7 and offers weekly sales that keep me coming back. Also, the service has always been good and that's a big deal for me these days!

name: Andrea Brown
text: The pharmacist (the older guy with white hair)  by far is the rudest pharmacist I have ever met. The meds were for my 5 year old daughter with ADHD. His attitude toward me was almost embarrassing, this was my first time here and it will definitely be the last.

name: Mike Kemp
text: These people are overwhelmed.   We need a second store.  The customers are paying with long wait times.  The foreign lady is slow as heck and doesn't understand English very well.

name: Karina Smith
text: Great location, clean store and friendly employees!

name: Khokadah G Khamhani
text: Always like this place

name: Danielle Hamilton (Danielle Hamilton)
text: Bad also sells bad drugs I found it hidden

name: Krysti Davis
text: Rude pharmacy techs and the pharmacy is no longer open 24 hours.

name: The Dude
text: Awful pharmacy staff.

name: J C
text:
Don’t shop here.
I signed up my wife to get her Covid-19 vaccines at this store. If they tried to make it more difficult they couldn’t. When we got there we checked in a the front and had to go to the pharmacy to have her insurance verified. I had it verified online a week early. The lady at the pharmacy didn’t know what she was doing and had to get someone else to do it. We then had to back up front to sign in and get the vaccine card then go back and get her shot.
The second time we had to do the same thing over again.

name: John Ballentine
text: The staff are always friendly and helpful here.

name: Laurie Poplin
text: They never have anything in stock. Waste of my time.

name: Alan Hovexak
text: Simple mobile cards are in stock.. they're not across the street.

name: Katie Heider
text: One of the better CVS I have been to. Everyone is super nice and always ready to help. Tiffanie is always friendly and ready to help as well.

name: Jaded Gal
text:
I guess it depends on the person but I love this CVS. I recently became a convert to them after years of staying well clear once I figured out how much you could save with a CVS card! Especially in their beauty club...talk about shocked. Normally I go to the Whitesburg Drive location but I’m a fan of this one as well. They have similar merchandise, not as much foot traffic & it’s happily situated next to a super Walmart which is also very nice.

I’ve never found the staff to be anything but absolutely lovely and wonderful at this location. Ladies if you’re a fan of Kerstase, Fekkai, Living Proof and Redken hair care, as well as very cool K-Beauty offerings, give them a look!

name: Brenda Peacher
text: I love my CVS,  all my people at the pharmacy take wonderful care of me. Wouldn't go anywhere else ever!

name: U No
text: Tiffanie was extremely nice. She made me want to visit this cvs more often than other stores. Great job Tiffanie! Thanks for beings so nice and making a stressful day a lot better

name: Alisha Lowery
text: I have been getting my meds filled here for years now. Every month on the same day and I showed up at 7:56 PM and they refused to fill them because they close at 8. Now normally this wouldn't be a big deal, but I live 2 hours away. If you close at 8, then close at 8. Not early. I have 2 retail stores and I would NEVER do this to a customer, especially a regular customer. So now I have to miss another half day of work just to drive back down here. Thanks a lot CVS.

name: Brenda Hargrove
text: so I had my pain medication filled today at the 2210 Winchester road location, got home and counted my pills and was short 4 pills, Called and spoke to the pharmacist Debbie, not sure who she is. I've been going to this location for over a year. She informed me that she double counted and that she had given me the correct amount, I told her that I  could count also and that there was four missing. She was not very helpful at all, her attitude was like oh well, her word against mine. Usually when i get my meds the quanity on the bottle is circled and initialed, this one wasn't. What are we supposed to do when this happens? Someone helped themselves to 4 of my pain pills.

name: Jane Knauss
text: The pharmacy staff are incredibly rude. I have had to speak with managers because they have given me the wrong prescription more than once. I’m transferring my prescription immediately.

name: Judy Myers
text: Went to pick up a prescription and as always very courteous and prompt.

name: Greg Parde
text:
I have a kidney stone my medication was out of stock no problem we can have tomorrow morning I was told.  I called to check the next morning and was told it would be another 3 to 4 hours. i called again at 11:30 first I was told that my medication was shorted from the order, and then they told me their supplier was out.
This was not my first issue with them but it will be my last!

name: Bohemian Chic Vibe
text:
The young male cashier working the register  on Dec. 26th greeted us nicely but when we went to make our purchase of a lovely African American santa & angel he felt the need to tell us the following:
He doesn't understand the purpose of black Santa's bc it's "historically inaccurate" ...
He then proceeds to ask me if I think that makes the black santa "cultural appropriation"?? He tries to give me some facts on the "real st. Nick"... I politely cut him off with a general explanation of why I find the item appropriate FOR ME... but I shouldn't be engaged in such topics by an employee who in essence challenged my choice & came across as biogoted by breaching the topic  for no apparent reason!

Who does that??? I've trained many employees and I've NEVER heard such a violation of policy.
As a manager who's trained many I found his behavior extremely inappropriate! It made me uncomfortable and quite frankly ANGRY when I later thought about it.
It is the employees job to SELL not to give unsolicited opinions on the merchandise, especially NEGATIVE opinions!!. If he has a problem with black santas, angels, etc. he should keep it to himself. Check your personal opinions at the door unless you are ASKED & I certainly didn't ask for his opinion.
He needs to be re-trained and relocated to a location where all the product is "historically accurate" in his opinion.

Does CVS support this kind of employee behavior? I'm appalled!

name: Daniel Lee Hogan
text: Quick and clean

name: John Boyd
text: Just got my 1st Covid vaccine at CVS.  Well organized, efficient and extremely polite.  Wonderful experience!

name: Barry Adams
text: Good staff but a really really busy store and wait times are often long.

name: Jo James
text: Call the pharmacy and ask two simple questions and got the worst attitude and possible the first person transferred me to someone else. I guessed because I was over my question limit lol. Then the guy got on with an attitude from the start and hung up on me. Worst customer service possible

name: Ron Thompson
text:
The men’s bathroom looks like it belongs to a run down gas station
Can’t believe CVS has something like this

name: Daniel Fagan
text: Guaranteed to make you wait on hold for 25+ minutes, so good luck trying to get ahold of them for anything. Poor customer service

name: Ginger Stone
text: Always have treated me like I'm family love this pharmacy!🙏💙

name: Lauren Meek
text: Been on hold 30 minutes for the pharmacy. They’ve picked it up and put it back on hold multiple times now.maybe corporate should let this store hire more people. They have to be seriously understaffed if the service is this terrible.

name: Brendan Dailey
text: Always fast and friendly.

name: Elizabeth Hallada
text: They refused us dropping off a medication at the window because "you have to do that inside". I looked it up you do not in fact have to do it inside. Just a mere 40 minutes after surgery the last thing someone wants to do is go by tons of people. Why i could just drop it off and come back is beyond me. Ridiculous.

name: Krystal Young
text: Just like the other reviewers have said. Absolute Worst CVS I have ever encountered in my life. First they completely didn't fill my insulin prescription. I had to call it in twice & by the time they finally decided "oh, maybe we should do our jobs", they were out of my insulin. By this time, I had run out of insulin because I had been waiting several days. Never go to this CVS. I had to transfer my prescription out. My CVS in Atlanta was Great. This one should have their doors closed. They also don't have Curbside & refused to price match.

name: Andrea W
text: The pharmacy techs repeatedly refuse to sell syringes with needles for delivery of insulin.  Tonight was just the most recent incident.  In spite of having 8+ years history of purchasing insulin and supplies in the computer, due to not having an active Rx (we can't have an active Rx at every pharmacy in town "just in case" our insurance-dictated regular pharmacy is not accessible at that moment of need), the pharmacy tech gets to decide, based on personal bias/mood, not to sell the only safe method of delivery of insulin (which is now prohibitively expensive without insurance) to a type-1 diabetic who has a documented history of his need for that medicine.  Diabetes does not go away! Once insulin dependent, always insulin dependent!  A pharmacy tech just decided she wants a customer to either use dirty needles (infection risk, tissue damage, increased pain to use) or go without insulin and let his blood slowly turn to poison and kill him.  I hope you sleep well at night knowing your company and staff are directly and indirectly causing death, injury, and diminished quality of life.

name: Sam Gore
text: Came in with a prescription that was more complicated than intend. Multiple members of the staff assisted me, with Mrs. Cheryl being one who especially stood out as patient, helpful and pleasant to interact with. Couldn't be happier with how I was treated at the pharmacy.

name: Roy Turner
text: Pharmacy Is slow and the front of the store has poor customer service!

name: Smokeshotz Official
text: One older lady that works in pharmacy is rude EVERY SINGLE TIME I get my meds filled there so I drive to a different location. She’s a donkey for sure.

name: Dominique Hudson
text: I live near here so I go here quite often. Very clean store, most all of the staff are nice except one of the pharmacy technicians has a bad attitude but everyone else is very friendly and helpful!

name: Kendra Ciezki
text: Prescription was said to be ready over 3 hours ago. Sat and waited for 25 minutes at the drive thru window, left because I had somewhere to be. Called on my way home to explain I needed to leave because it took so long. Have been on hold for 24 minutes so far.

name: Are you threatening me, Master Jedi?
text: This location has been completely rebuilt recently and is in full working order. This post serves only to bump the previous year old 'most recent' post marking the site as closed. Safe travels.

name: Kaitlyn Lewis
text: I’ve had such an awful experience dealing with this pharmacy. The customer service is despicable and if you want to get someone on the phone then have fun waiting 30 plus minutes. :/ total disappointment.

name: Amy Ervin
text: This is the fastest, most convenient place to print your own photos.  There are multiple kiosks and you can print within minutes of uploading.

name: Kenny Norris
text: Busiest CVS pharmacy in the state but the friendliest staff.

name: William Arnold
text: The pharmacy repeatedly gives me the wrong brand of generic meds. If I request (demand) generic X, why would you give me generic Y?? Better profit margins? Shame

text: Terrible place prices mark up more than 100 percent month by month terrible excuses for why  Wana save go locally owned alco  I transferred my prescriptions out of here  don't like being ripped off ...

text: Dear God! They gave me the wrong medication! Then when I told them they told me I would have to bring the. Medicine back for them to check! I called the corporate office! They did nothing and I never got my medicine or refund! Beware

text: Fast and friendly service at the pharmacy.

name: Andrew Farrow
text: Feels like the place could use a good cleaning and staff are helpful at least.

name: Taylor Gibbs
text: i literally got here 5 mins before close to pick up a film camera (which takes 2 secs) and this girl was standing locking at the door, looked at me, and shrugged😂

name: Jenna Tucker
text: I would not recommend using cvs for your pharmacy need or anything g in general. I had to wait a week to pick up my prescription for my 1 year old daughter cause they would not give it to me without her Insurance card which was stolen. They whole time they called letting me know my prescription was ready. Then I go and pick it up and they would not give it to me. I will never use cvs again!!! Not even worth 1 star.

name: Rebecca Richardson
text: This CVS is great! I shop here often. Becky, the pharmacist and her staff are courteous and professional, the prices for medicine is reasonable. I also like the large selection of make-up items, it's a great buy when I use my extra-bucks rewards. CVS also sends out discount coupons as an additional reward.

name: Delia Derrick
text: Trying to have my medications filled at the Hanceville CVS has been very frustrating.  Many times the employees say I don't have refills or that the doctor had not called a prescription in, when actually, the medications WERE ready to refill.  Also, many, many times I received phone texts from CVS telling me that a medicine was automatically refilled or that a prescription was ready for pick up.  When I arrived at the stores, the employees didn't know what I was talking about.   They had NOTHING ready for pick up.  Because of these errors, I have had to go without my medication for several days while they figured out their error... The employees were always friendly, however.   I  now do business with Blue and Gray Drugs in Hanceville.  Their service is much more dependable.

name: Heather Murphy
text: I needed Benadryl for my dog and was afraid to leave her alone in the car. The pharmacy picked it out for me and let me go through the drive through. That’s customer service at its finest. Thank you so much.

name: bjt 2077
text: Rude pharmacist,  long wait times for prescriptions to be filled and if you are going to pick a family members medication up be prepared to show every form of Id possible.

name: brandon brooks
text:
I tried to fill 2 prescriptions and had one of the worst retail experiences that i have ever had. When i gave the pharmacist my prescriptions I told him that I had Good RX coupons on my phone and tried to show him but he just walked off so I thought everything was ok. When I was called back to pay one of the meds was almost 50 dollars than the coupon rate. When I questioned the price the Pharmacy Tech rolled her eyes and started popping her gum in my face. The Pharmacist then said I told him I had the coupon but did not give a card, Good RX is an app, so i didn't get the discount. So i showed the tech the coupons and she told me she didn't need them she could just do it herself. She told me that it would be another 10 minutes and when I questioned why such a long time to change the price they refused to fill the medicine and returned my paper prescriptions. I asked to speak to the store manager and was informed by the Tech that he was not there so at this point all i could do is leave.

Once home called back to the store to get the pharmacist and technicians names and licences number. Well the store manager answered the phone. He then preceeded to tell me that he could not give that information until I told him that it was a matter of public record and that if it was not posted in plain view that they were committing a crime. So when he finally gave me the pharmacist's name , Charlie, i filed a complaint with CVS and the state pharmacy board.

Also I called around to 2 other CVS stores to check cash prices and found out that he was going to charge me more than the other stores.

It is no wonder that BCBS of Alabama will no longer deal with CVS.

I would avoid doing this store at all costs in the future. It would seem that CVS has a standard to only hire rude people along with liars and cheats.

name: Paul Dillard
text: Get all my meds here. Fast and friendly staff and have the scripts ready in a flash. Restrooms are awful though, that much is true.

name: Wendy Shipp
text: Price's are to high but I shop there on occasion when other stores don't have what I need.

name: Joe Tray
text: Friendly staff

name: The Solitary Eclectic Witch
text:
No matter what time you call
the ph rings twice then goes to a busy signal. This makes their LOYAL shoppers MAD as they have to end up calling OTHER stores NOT in the customers area. DO BETTER SALLY’S

name: Rena Turner
text: I went in and was told i had to pull my mask up over my nose right away, no hello or hi nothing, she stayed pressed against the corner of store when i walked in.  NO problem, i am a rule follower, just hot so it was under my nose and frankly tired of the whole mask thing, but tried to be respectful of her!! However i needed a little help with finding a hair color product and walked towards the lady and was not even close to her, but she immediately held up both hand and yelled at me "STOP- STAY SIX FEET AWAY FROM ME!!! i told her i needed help, but she was extremely paranoid.  I understand being scared, but you work in public and absolutely have no customer service skills, whatsoever!!! She was extremely rude, and I ended up leaving because i couldn't get close enough to her or even ask a question before i bought product.  She said nothing to me.  Very disappointed in Sally's customer service.  I normally love shopping there.

name: Emily Brasher
text: Nice, helpful employees. Always out of alot of inventory

name: Chanda Mitchell

name: Corinna Bass
text: I was shopping online and saw that theAveda website had an offer this Holiday for  a free Mini Facial!   Of course I booked it, at the Summit location.  It was pouring rain, and parking was a nightmare, but once I got in, I was greeted by the Beautiful Aroma of all things natural and Cherish, the sweet girl who took care of my face!  She has the perfect amount of pressure (you know sometimes people barely feel like they are touching you, or they may be too heavy handed) and I really enjoyed my facial scrub 😁 Thank you, Aveda!

resp.text: Hi Corinna, thank you for the great review. We're glad to see you enjoyed your facial. We hope you visit us again soon!

text: The best staff, the best customer service and wonderful products. How can you go wrong

I enjoyed my time there and looking forward to using my scalp benefits shampoo, conditioner along with the styling foam.

name: Jorge Ortiz
text: My family and I took the Covid19 shots here, I recommend this store, they were nice and the wait was not long.

name: Scott Seeley
text: I always give Walgreens a look on holidays to snag a couple deals. Gotta have that customer appreciation card - specials don't work without it.

name: Christal Oxford
text: I love the excellent service I get here! Lance, the Pharmacist, even calls if I ever start a new medicine and to answer any questions I may have. Everyone in the pharmacy department goes above and beyond! They are true professionals and I am an extremely satisfied customer!

name: Taylor Mullins
text: If i could give this walgreens a negative star i would! i always use walgreens so i didn’t think this one would be much different. i had a prescription for my 2 month old son sent over last thursday, they said the medicine would be on monday because they had to order it, which is fine. monday i come to pick his prescription up and they couldn’t find it for 10 mins. finally after they found it they said it wasn’t done yet to come back in 30 mins. i cone back later and they said that they were waiting on an approval from a doctor. well it is tuesday now and they have ordered the wrong medication. i will never return here. my son has really bad acid reflux and is in an extreme amount of pain so this medicine is very important for him. will never return here ever

name: Ronald Rupert
text: I've been going to this Walgreens pharmacy for many years, but today is the last day.  There was a problem with one of my prescriptions and they could only give me a partial amount until they restocked.  That's annoying, but not too bad.  The remainder will be ready in a few days.  A week later my wife went in to pick them up.  They had done nothing and the prescription showed as completed.  They said they would order and the pills would be available in two days.  I went back 3 days later and they didn't have them and they hadn't been ordered.  People at the counter where trying to be helpful, but the Pharmacist clearly didn't care.  No, "I'm sorry", no engagement at all.  They finally told me they would order and to come back in two days.  I went back in 3 days later.  The pills are now in stock, but nobody had filled the remainder of my prescription and the system was still showing that it was completed.  The person working the counter was helpful and apologetic, but when the Pharmacist came back, she said "we don't manufacture the pills, so it's not out fault".  She obviously missed the training for customer service.  This was the fourth time I was told the prescription would be filled and it still wasn't done.  An apology, at a minimum, should have given, but I surely didn't expect to get attitude.  Completely unprofessional.  I told them not to fill my prescription and I left and will not return.  I'm transferring my prescriptions to CVS later today.

name: Fair Reviews
text: I have worked at Walgreens.  I know the rules and they are stretching them at the pharmacy.  The attendant in drive thru was rude.  It took a very long time for him to come to the window.  Then he said it would take 20 min fill the prescription and I should come back.  I timed the cars ahead of me.  One was more than 15 min.  One was over 20 min.  I recommend corporate and store manager look into it.  Until the young man's attitude is fixed go somewhere else.  I will be praying for him.

name: Margaret Anne Parker
text: Minus 50+ stars for this pharmacy. It's a pharmacy, first and foremost in the business to take care of a patient's needs by filling doctor prescribed medication for sick people. That alone should mean the employees will be kind, considerate, and have the patient's best interest at heart, which requires a certain level of customer service skills. I can honestly say, this is by far the WORST customer service experience I've ever had, in ANY industry! From the pharmacist herself to the tech working the counter, they are the rudest people I've encountered! My particular issue began with a refill which I called in back in August. Once I received a text that it was ready for pickup, I drove over to collect it, only to be told once I got there that the RX was not ready and the drug was not in stock. The tech argued with me about being notified that it was ready until I showed her the text message and then she had nothing to say. I was then told they would call me when the drug was back in stock and my RX had been filled. Three weeks went by and no word so I drove back over to check on it. This time, I spoke with the pharmacist who literally could not be bothered with my questions about when I might be able to get my prescription. She said it was ordered from the 'warehouse' and that they would call me when it came in but if I didn't want to wait, I could go somewhere else and get them to transfer the RX. I opted to wait. Huge mistake! Yesterday, while picking up 2 other prescriptions, I inquired about my refill on backorder. I explained everything that had taken place thus far to the tech and gave her my previous RX bottle for informational purposes. She checked on the computer and said 'this RX has already been filled.' And so I say to her, no, as I so painstakingly explained, it was never filled because you were out of the drug and could not fill it and I've been waiting for you guys to call me when it came in. Immediately she became combative! Then she tells me that, yes, they have the drug in now, BUT, I can't have it because 'oh look, this refill expired a few weeks ago.' Umm. No, it didn't 'expire,' it's been in your system awaiting the restock of the drug! She very rudely tells me that I'll have to go see my dr (and pay the $30 copay,) and obtain a new prescription. What? I'm in disbelief at this point. And when I asked if she heard any of what I had said to her previously, she began talking over me saying it's not their fault because they're all new and training and learning the rules and I'm out of luck! And that she would be happy if I took my prescriptions elsewhere! DONE! Not to worry! WALGREEN'S will never get my business again for anything!

name: stephen clanton
text: Totally lacks customer service, in addition, they always say we have to order that prescription and then you never hear back again...when you call to ask if it is in, it’s like they don’t know anything about it

name: Claudia Carson
text: Worst pharmacy experience ever! First off, it took and hour and 15 minutes to fill one prescription and then I paid online to save time (like the service advertises). When I pulled through drive thru with my toddler and infant in the car the pharmacy tech tells me that my total is blank amount...I proceed to tell her that I already paid. She then tells me that since I paid online, I had to come inside the store to get my child’s medicine. I begged her to help me out since I had both my toddler and infant in the car but she just told me the same thing again. At this point I’m mad because how can they send you a link on your phone to “save time” but then make you come inside to get your prescription?!?!?! Busy moms beg you to come up with a better solution! Until then, I will no longer get my prescriptions filled here (or shop here for that point).

name: JACK SMITH
text:
YOUR PHARMACY TECH JAIME DID A FANTASTIC JOB HELPING ME WITH MY DIABETIC SUPPLIES. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT HER. MY CVS PRESCRIPTIONS ARE NOW AT YOUR STORE.

THANKS AGAIN JAIME

JACK SMITH

name: Rebecca Sledge
text: The worst drugstore I've ever had.  You can never get the pharmacy on the phone.  I'm changing drugstores.

name: Joe Boxer
text: This location is awful. They Tell you one thing and then it ends up being something entirely different. Then no one wants to take accountability not even the manager.  It will have taken them six days to fill a prescription.

text: Has down good discount items
